I enjoyed my dining experience at Doughbird.  The waitstaff were attentive and friendly, service was fast, and the food was tasty.  My friend and I split the brussel sprouts pizza.  In addition to the brussels, this pizza also comes with sweet potatoes and bacon on it.  We asked for the bacon on the side since I don't eat meat and this was easily accommodated.  I thought the crust had a nice flavor and was soft without being too "doughy."  Very delicious.  I'm not a fan of the Fox restaurants in general, but they did seem to get it right with this place.  Even their website is normal and not the usual over-the-top and trying way too hard marketing nonsense.  If you are looking for a good pizza, that has some unique topping choices/combinations, try this place out.

I have a hard time find a great boba place because every time I order a taro milk tea from anywhere else it comes out chalky and very weird tasting. Found LOLLICUP and I'm in love. They have a bunch of specialty teas and milks and slushes. It's located in one of the kiosks at Las Vegas Town Square right by the park and fountain. You order on one end and grab your item on the other end. If your in a mood for a milk or slush tea you should defiantly try the taro with boba as it's delicious. If your in the mood for something more light and fresh try there black or green tea with lychee it's so good! They have a menu if you don't know what you want and there best sellers and favorites. I will drive out of my way to come here that's how amazing it is.

Spanische Tapas sind ja normalerweise einfache kleine Gerichte, die man in den Bars in Madrid, Sevilla oder wo auch immer in Spanien zum Bier, Wein oder Sherry serviert bekommt. 

Jaleo adaptiert dieses Konzept für die Gourmet Cuisine und das Ergebnis kann sich mehr als sehen lassen. Denn natürlich erfährt man hier tolle und auch ungewohnte Geschmackserlebnisse. Aber durch das Tapas-Konzept bestellt man nicht nur ein paar Gänge, sondern pro Person 4 bis 5 Tapas. Und da man alles problemlos teilen kann, kostet man an einem Abend 10 verschiedene wirklich tolle Gericht. 

Für alle, die Gourmetküche lieben, ist das perfekt. Wenn auch nicht unbedingt preiswert, aber für schnell und günstig ist das Jaleos auch der absolut falsche Laden.

Let me start off by saying that I have not provided Aloha nails any business for at least the last 2 years. I began to notice that their service was steadily declining and time and time again I would be disappointed with the results. The nail techs seem to be rushing and over-worked which led to poor quality nails. I was always respectful and still tipped the full amount because I knew that it was not their fault they were under-staffed but an issue with management. At least they were nice and seemed to be trying. 

When visiting with my mom recently, she told me of how she had gone to Aloha nails for a gel manicure and the horrible experience that she endured. She received the gel manicure with a man who was extremely rude to her. He constantly pulled on her arm and upsettingly would ask her to relax her arms and fingers although she wasn't trying to be stiff. The man yelled at her to stop looking at him work because that was causing her to be tense. My mom even tried helping and said that she would look away in hopes of making the guy feel she was more relaxed. The nail tech was huffing and puffing the entire time signifying he was upset and after all of that, my mom's nails were not what she was expecting. The gel came out very thick and uneven. It should have been taken into consideration that my mother is an older woman and trembling of the hands is something that cannot always be controlled and is fairly common within the older generation. This man could've been nicer and more empathetic. My mother was extremely embarrassed and even when telling the story I could tell how uncomfortable she must've felt. I'm sorry that I wasn't with my mom at the time and would've told that man to get away from my mother and walked out and never looked back. My mom didn't deserve to feel this way. 

I was not with my mom at the time so I can't say that I know all of the facts but after reading other reviews, I 100% believe that my mom wasn't exagerating. I will never return here and neither will any of my family or friends and I hope readers will take this into consideration when referring friends or family and especially their mothers.

Amazing Japanese food!! You get to choose as many items and see what they look like, you order from the tablet and they bring the food right to you! Very fast and friendly service. Delicious sushi rolls and you must get the black pepper beef, it melts in your mouth!

You must forgive me if I start gushing and squealing like a school girl; my charming companion and I are in love with Carnivale and collect Venetian masks. In short, this place was heaven to us. 

My personal bias aside, this place can only be described as amazing and elegant. Appropriately located off the canals in the Grand Canal Shoppes in the Venetian, you can browse masquerade masks while hearing gondoliers singing in the background. And mind you, these are not cheap knock-offs made from plastic like you find at local Halloween boutiques; these are are the real deal. Made by hand in Venice in the traditional style from papier-mâché, each mask is a one of a kind piece of art. From Bautas, to Voltos, to Medico Della Pestes (plague doctors), they carry a large variety of fine masks. 

During our recent trip to Las Vegas, staying in the Venetian during their Carnivale celebrations, we visited this shop several times trying to decide what we wanted to take home with us (it was an unspoken conclusion that we would both bring home a mask or two). In the end, we bought five masks between the two of us. The staff were exceedingly friendly and took very good care to wrap and pack the masks to keep them safe during our flight home, all the while bantering with each other and chatting with us. They clearly cared about what they did and made the experience more enjoyable. 

Prices here are not for the faint of heart, however, but are rather reasonable when you consider these are Venetian imports and hand made works of art. Masks can go between roughly $50 and 800$. More advanced pieces will go higher. You can come away with a good full faced mask for $75 and $300 depending on how elaborate a piece you are looking for. The five masks we walked away with set us back over $700. Were they worth it? Absolutely. 

If you happen to be looking for an elaborate costume or fancy headpiece . . . expect these to go for a few grand. 

Shopping here was a joy, and we adore what we came away with. We know when we come back to Vegas we are going to be making a few more purchases. 

One last thing I feel compelled to say in response to commentary from other reviewers about Il Prato's "No Photos" policy is . . . stop and think about it. This shop sits in the middle of a high-traffic tourist attraction filled with clumsy oafs tripping over each other taking pictures of every little with their iPhones. If a mask shop allowed photos, every tourist and their child would be coming in and taking up room to pose for Facebook pictures in their expensive and fragile masks. Of course they don't want that. 

Once again, this Il Prato was outstanding.
THEIR GOAT CHEESE IS OUT OF THIS WORLD!! Add a bit of olive oil and some fresh basil and you have a meal.

Love this place !!!! I can honestly say this is the best steak I have ever eaten. I went there a couple of years ago and loved it so when I was able to take my parents out I thought I would give it another try. Yes yes yes I know most of the reviews are suprised to find a great place like this in Circus Circus and it is true.The moment you walk in you can smell the grill and your mouth waters ! The food is expensive. I think I paid 45 or so for a 12oz filet but as I see it I am on vacation and , in very very rare cases, you get what you pay for.The steak was very tender, easy to cut and you can taste the wood they use to grill it. Wait staff was awesome and was attentive. The decor is old fashioned but clean and comfortable. Loved the fact that they played Dean Martin and almost made me think Dean, Frank and Sammy might stroll in at any minute. Nice to see some old fashion class in a town that seems to change every 5 years. Give it a try because I will go back.

Awesome authentic Korean BBQ.   I must say the Managers and staff are top notch.  
Get here early or you'll be waiting out in the heat...though they do provide FREE lemon and cherry slushies :0)
Even though there were customers clamoring to get in, we never felt pressured or hurried...shows they care about their customers" experience over making a few extra dollars.

The only negatives would be that they need to up their banchan game and their egg dish was slightly overdone.
As for the meats....extremely fresh and marinated really well....we had both marinated and not.
We liked variety so we got the family set....1 large and 1 medium to accommodate 6 adults and 1 child.  We had the beef and pork combos.  
Rice is complimentary but you have to request it.

If you are new to Korean BBQ, the waiters cook your meats for you by default unless you choose to do it yourself.   Come casual, don't wear your best because you'll come out smelling smoky.

This poor review is strictly regarding my experience with the tennis courts. I played a tennis match here and found out from my opponent that almost ALL the courts have dead spots where the ball dies.

I would not recommend playing tennis matches here unless they fix the dead spots.

Jeremy and his team assisted me in buying my first historic home in downtown Phoenix.  As a nervous/excited home buyer, Jeremy put my mind at ease and operated with a sense of urgency as though it was his own home.  Jeremy was extremely patient with me in answering my multitude of questions and was quickly available anytime I needed to contact him or his team.  Jeremy truly cares about his clients and his team is extremely professional and service oriented.  This process can be complicated but Jeremy and his team made it run smoothly with zero surprises!

This Sprint location really took the cake with the most unprofessional service. I've been in retail for 10 years and get extremely disappointed when I see poor customer service. Unfortunately, Charles, the Assistant Manager, didn't even have "poor customer service". It was simply non existent.  We have been trying to resolve an issue with our account for months and continue to get nowhere. No answers, no explanation, no results. Note to the staff here, it's not worth the sale to belligerently lie to your customer.

You feel the family ambiance as soon as you walk in. The server's are very attentive and greet you with their name. The food is great! My party of 4 had the Mamas Chicken Fried Steak & Eggs, Mamas Breakfast Burrito, Denver Omelet and French Toast. The food was delicious! The restaurant is small however it's worth the wait.

My husband and I are here on August 9th 2016 for lunch. I was actually hoping the food would be horrid because well, I really just wanted to provide some criticism to the Ramsey. However the service and food was incredible.
   We were seated quickly into a booth, the place has a good vibe and decor was on point. We had the best "water" boy, seriously I kept him coming to the table as Vegas is HOT. 
   I ordered a BLT and my husband ordered the fish and chips. The BLT was easily had the best the flavor, probably the best BLT I've ever had. My husband fish pieces were huge and perfectly cooked and it came with a side dish of these amazing peas, I believe to be a dill and basil blend they were so good.
  From the staff, food, beverages and decor this place is everything you would expect from the Ramsey! Well done.

Great Happy Hour . Great Desserts. I don't care much for the main courses.  Wait time can be a bitch on weekends. Staff is courteous and friendly . One of the better casual dining establishments in the East Valley. Did I mention the awesome desserts ?
I love the cut and color by Callie G.! I just moved here and was nervous about a new hair dresser, but she did fabulous!!!

My family has been going to Doctor Karn for nearly 20 years.  He is a consummate professional and old-time perfectionist--- a rare find in this day and age.   I trust his judgment and advice.  He will be my family's dentist as long as he continues to practice which I hope is for many more years.

To start my review I do want to say that this place is pretty run down. Virtually every inch of the grounds needs some tlc. Some of the holes in the mini-golf have nothing to catch the balls, they fall about a foot and a half down a hole. The bumper boats engines fail pretty often, forcing the disgruntled attendant to ride on his boat out there to give you a restart. The food is expensive and is of subpar quality. The fumes from the go karts and bumper boats are bothersome. All that said, I did have a tremendously fun time. I'm no longer a teenager and was skeptical as to how much fun I could have here, but despite all the flaws I spent about 4 hours in the park. About 2 hours longer than I had anticipated. The go karts go a pretty good speed and the track they run on is entertaining to drive on. Bumper boats are fun, but I would caution you that there is a waterfall present so it would be wise to leave your phone with someone safe before starting. All in all, the go karts and bumper boats carry this facility and make it an entertaining place to spend 4 hours. Would recommend checking out coupons beforehand, and I'd highly recommend the 4 hour unlimited ride pass!

My friend brought me here on my whirlwind visit to Phoenix, crowning LGO as serving the best ice cream in the city. While I cannot vouch for best (not having tried any others), the mint chocolate chip ice cream is THE BEST mint ice cream I have ever tasted. 
This rendition is REALLY minty, with actual bites of mint leaves, with big chunks of chocolate embedded in the ice cream. It is so refreshing and hits the spot after a hot day.
Excelentisiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiiimo si van en metro bajarse en la estación Laurie ahí hay un pequeño abastecimiento donde pueden comprar de todo para su bagel me comí al menos 10
Ok Only 3 Stars ..... Not Sure Why... Service was BOMB and the Dogs were Amazing.. The Perfect spot to grub when you are Hungry...

walked in and was greeted , he was very nice.

Jay was top notch. He walked me thru on which one is the best for vapors and gave me some more juice. I will be back every time I need more juice thanks again

Amazing beer selection for a downtown bar! Service was not delightful but atmosphere was nice and calm for a late Thursday night. I enjoyed the bells winter white and he had a Mach 10 ipa. Both of us enjoyed our selections and they were reasonably priced. It is a one beer each and move on kind of spot

I didn't shop for long time actually in this store, it seems like most Apple Stores - plenty of helpful folks who are available but not pushy and rows of gleaming techno-candy to drool about.

What I do love about this store is the blazing fast public wi-fi they offer. I staid a couple of weeks in a nearby hotel, and Apple's wi-fi is so much faster! Thanks Apple!

Went on a Tuesday nite and the wait was only about 45 minutes. Not too shabby
Now for the food. The seafood and dessert stations are amazing. Endless King Crab, Stone Crab,  Shrimp and Oysters! The crab was really tasty and make sure you try the warm crab station in the Italian section. I did not try all of the stations. I grabbed a slider, tacos, nachos and some pad thai and was not all that impressed. 
The dessert station is a dream- loved the chocolate covered strawberries, desserts on a stick and the shaved ice. The shaved ice is on request so make sure to try it- awesome flavors + boba. Skip the cookies (meh).
Ooo and drinks are included so don't try to cheap out by getting ice water. Pepsi for dinner and hot tea and coffee for dessert
Service also top-notch

We did the tasting menu and everything was A-Ok, but I found most dishes to be a bit over salted and seasoned. Presentation was great, but I didn't think the quality of the food was anything extraordinary or memorable.

Definitely a cool museum to see if you happen to be visiting Pittsburgh.  This space used to be an old warehouse and now it includes seven floors of artwork, books, magazines, audiotape interviews with friends, films and sculptures. There's a neat little room tucked in the very back which contains floating silver clouds, you can sit in the room and watch the clouds float about endlessly..

Eggs Benedict with lux was my dish. The taste was super the service was in top and the coffee had a really nice taste of chocolate in it. 
The people around were super cool and all around Toronto is just wonderful. Keep up the good work. Oh and the hash brown was pretty good as well :-)

I would not suggest going to this doctors office. I was treated by a nurse practitioner (who incorrectly diagnosed me) when I called the office because the pain was increasing and becoming unbearable and I was told they can't treat me because the nurse practitioner had the day off. I complained (first they lied and said she'd get back to me that day but when I called back later I was told she had the day off) that it was a doctors office and a day off for a nurse practitioner shouldn't stop everything. They refused to give me pain medication because they didn't believe I was in pain. I chose to see an ENT the next day who said he would have never put me on antibiotics (they put me on 2) and yes I have pain because there was a cast on my eardrum that had to be sucked and scrapped off. They are so concerned about people drug seeking they they never thought to find out why I was in so much pain because yes ear infections aren't that painful so obviously something was really wrong and maybe try listening to the patient and if you don't know what you are doing which she didn't just refer me to a specialist in the first place.
They have the best breakfast burritos I have ever had! The max burro with bacon is amazing. And the cannolis are spot on.

This place is so inconsistent I cannot stand it. They're lemongrass soup is solid - just get it not spicy and spice it yourself.  When it comes to the stir fried stuff, it gets complicated.  You spice it yourself, it doesn't get mixed evenly.  You tell the 6/10 one day and they give you a 8/10.  You tell them 4/10 on another day they give you a 8/10.  Never again because they obviously don't give a hoot about your tolerance.  This place is also expensive, considering that they apparently don't really operate on a spice scale and also, very little meat.  It's all filler.

I would give it three, but I grade on curve (Thai cuisine curve) and this one is definitely below average.

I had Shawna do my hair a few weeks ago. I had partial highlights and a haircut. Everyone was very nice when I got there. The salon was a bit dirty but they also have white chairs so I told myself not to judge so harshly. But as I sat there for hours getting my hair done I can't help but say it really does need a good scrub. 
  Shawna dropped a comb on the floor and picked it up and used it gross! But again it was already done so what could I say really. 
  Once the highlights were done and my hair was washed my ears were full of water. I had no towel to use since she left them at the sink. I purposely wiped my ears several times in front of her to see if she'd offer a towel. Nope had to ask and got a wet towel handed to me to use that was left on my lap for my hair cut. My hair cut took so long that my hair dried twice. I showed Shawna pictures, explained in detail how I wanted it and showed her a coworker with the hair cut I wanted. Well needless to say I walked out of the salon with my entire right side of my head an inch shorter than the left. I had asked for an A line bob and left with a hot mess. 
  My highlights were great she did do a good job there and the owner while I was paying  came up to me and said your highlights looked great. I agreed and waited for him to ask about my haircut but he never did. 
  When I left I had no idea it was as bad as it was I just thought it was longer than I wanted and was probably curling up funny from the blow dry. I have NEVER had a hair dresser cut my hair this uneven and never would've expected a professional to let me leave like this. Needless to say since the owner didn't say anything and Shawna let me leave this way saying to come back next week if it was still to long. I had no confidence that she could cut my hair correctly. 
  So I felt the only way to get the hair cut I had wanted and paid for was to go to another salon and pay again for the correct one. Thank god I did cause I had no problems at the new salon and was able to communicate easily the exact same way I did with Shawna to the new hairdresser and got the perfect cut   I paid $155 to have Shawna give my partial highlights and a lopsided haircut. I would not recommend going here.

I'm retired and met another retired former coworker for breakfast at one of our favorite restaurants, the Omelet House. I've lived in Las Vegas 44 years and this is my favorite breakfast/lunch house. You have to try the Bugsy Siegel omelet that has marinated melt in your mouth beef chunks in a delicious Italian sauce, sour cream, and cheese. Their banana nut bread or pumpkin bread are a great substitute for toast. They have the best potatoes and I've never seen anywhere else. They are very thin sliced, fried and seasoned to perfection. Their baby omelets are 3 egg rather than their standard 6 egg omelet and I guarantee it is plenty to satisfy anyone's hunger at a discounted price.

I have NO complaints!! Food arrived in 20 minutes, we were quoted an hour. It was hot and very fresh. I was expecting to be somewhat disappointed because the prices, but they far far exceeded my expectations! To those who say this isn't  real Chinese food, I dont know as I'm not a huge Chinese food fan, so dont have a lot to compare it to, but what I do know is that what hit my mouth and belly was delish!! And isn't that what's important? Authentic or not, it was inexpensive, great portions, fresh and hot! Will definitely order here again! 
We had the teriyaki bowls ,mine with fried rice (highly recommend, costs a bit more but worth it), hubby had steamed rice. We shared the combo appetizer. We both agreed we weren't crazy for the BBQ pork, but wasn't horrible.  
Take the negative reviews with a grain of salt, and give them a try!

Never got a chance to try because I made reservations to eat and like some greedy businesses during CIAA... They are charging $15 dollars just to enter the restaurant to eat!!!  They want to say it's because they have a show but having a show is apart of your appeal.  Damn GREEDY managers trying to get over on its Black customers because it's CIAA!  Please,  miss me! Good point... At least they called me before I showed up with my guest.
Horrible customer service.  The person on the phone was disrespectful.   Wings were cold and rancid.

unfortunately I can not comment on her ability, either Shawna is a no show for the appointment, or she cancels just before.  
What a disappointment!  Curious as to whether or not this is a scam???
Best pizza on the Westside of town.  Great for kids and families.  Try the zepollis as they are awesome.  Come almost every Wednesday with our daughter for movie night so she can make her own pizza.

I believe my Tech's name was Kevin. Young respectful Man. Very detailed and patient. Light conversation and AWESOME pedicure. My manicurist was nice, she was very quite and perfectly shaped my natural nails to almond as requested with no pictures to reference. She also polished perfectly. I would visit more often if i was in that area.

we always have a good experience here. the show is fun to watch as they prep your food, and it's always fresh and delicious. the ginger dressing on the salad is perfection and the veggies with your hibachi are always fresh and well prepared.

This is alright for all you can eat sushi. I honestly prefer the bossam, pork belly, pretty much the traditional Korean dishes are delicious. The sushi was different. I did not like the yum yum sauce. Something about having sushi with fruity pebbles just doesn't sit right with me. They do have affogato - Korean coffee with Frosted Flakes and vanilla ice cream.

Don't bother booking an appointment for service in advance, it means nothing to them.
I had an important annual dmv inspection for my drive school business vehicle booked 7/18/2017 at 1pm. I booked this one week in advance to be sure I could get in and out in 1/2 hour.  When I arrived the manager or his delegate, seemed confused that I had an appt. He had "to check". Apparently he didn't check in the morning when they opened so he could arrange to have a rack space open upon my arrival. Nothing was ready. So I had to leave and now have to scramble to find another place this week. All I heard was a meager "sorry", as I walked out the door.

I came there today for the first and (I hope) the last time. I had 6 photos of the haircut I  needed (taken after getting the haircut from my regular barber) but the hairdresser was not interested in them at all - rushing into cutting my hair instead. She was rather sloppy with the comb constantly striking me with it making me wince. Eventually, I got the cut somewhat close like what I wanted to get (which is the reason for me ranking it 2 stars insted of 1) but my head looks a bit plucked now.. and I didn't get my head washed nor before neither after the cut. I hope I'll never have to come back to this place.

Maggiano's is a chain Italian-American restaurant that is surprisingly good. Definitely sure to fill the bill for a variety of appetites.

I have been dining at this location for over 8 years, and it has yet to disappoint. Their Chef's are very cautious when it comes to food allergies, and they go out of their way to accommodate nearly any request. They have even made me gluten free fried zucchini that is sure to compete with their original recipe.

Their portions are quite large and reasonably priced, making it the ideal location for large groups. They also have private dining rooms if celebrating a more intimate occasion or hosting a business meeting. Overall, an excellent choice no matter what the occasion. They do get really busy with conventions, etc. so make a reservation in advance. I can assure you that you will be happy with your experience.

The food here was excellent, everything tasted fresh and of quality. I had the philly cheese steak panini and French onion soup which were both amazing. I could tell the business spent a lot of time in providing the full, nice dining environment. The meals are a little expensive but they leave you full and satisfied. My suggestion to the business would be that they offer options for the burger or panini's without the side order to reduce the price if someone did not want the side orders with it. 

The timings for this place are from 11-11pm which are good but I feel they should have it open till 12am or 1am on Fridays/Saturday

This restaurant has a lot of variety of food, since they have a dining as well as a cafe and dessert menu. I have yet to try their Coffee/Tea but everything looks promising.

I am definitely coming back here and I recommend everyone to try this place out.

For anyone who is Muslim, this place serves hand-cut halal meat.

Wow...I'm surprised to see so many 5 star reviews... Guess we went on a bad day. We were seated at a dirty table, the waiter was not caring or efficient at all, the "crispy" fish sandwich was soggy, and I don't believe the prices were fair for the quality of food and service we received. The atmosphere in general was ok and the fries were actually pretty good...but we won't be going back. Hope I don't get raked over the coals for giving a bad review to this establishment since so many others seem to love it...i was eager to try this restaurant even though the last two times we tried to eat there they were closed for different reasons.

Mel does the most amazing brows and lashes!!!! My brows have never looked this fabulous, she taught me how to fill in my brows with a very natural and full look. It's so impressive.  I've never seen anything like it. 
I recently had eyelash extensions put on by Mel which obviously look incredible. My eyes are brighter and getting ready is so much quicker. I also look forward to my appointments with Mel because she has such a kind and uplifting spirit. I enjoy being around her. I just can't say enough wonderful things about melt and the artist behind it!!

Awesome service (Thank You Prakesh) and good. Beautiful, creative presentations that were delicious. Service was timely yet relaxed with great suggestions. Value was spot on--all around I would give a resounding recommendation. Worth the quick Uber ride off the strip!

Becoming very inconsistent the quality of the kitchen is going down fast. I order the same thing for years because I use to love the red curry. Not so much any more. Under cooked squash and blah flavour. I keep going back because of what it was, but now I always leave disappointed.  It was always a little over priced, now that the food quality has slip, it is over priced for what it is.

I'm on the look out for a new Thai home... any suggestions welcome.

Nice little spot tucked behind the Petrocanada.
Food: Giant piece of chicken katsu (fried chicken) served on rice or a bun. There are some other items on the menu but this the reason why you need to go. Should check out the ice cream as well, it's made in house.
Staff: Super friendly and helpful. First time I went with a group of 5 we weren't able to get seats and they pulled chairs out so we could sit at the service area and then offered said homemade ice cream to us as an apology that we didn't have seats, even though it wasn't their fault.
Vibe: Tiny little place that can get rammed at peak outs. Most come for takeout but seats are still limited if you're coming with a group.
Love this place, definitely my 'Go To' take out spot. Have yet to see even a glimmer of a bad experience.

After doing a little shopping on the strip since it is so steamy and hot outside. Pinkberry frozen sorbet in mango flavor makes the heat seem oh so much more cool. The store is very inviting that is probably why the lobby is so filled full. They all had the same idea we did of how to stay cool in the heat!

Pinkberry is a very welcoming store with warm colors of earthy green and white that greet customers as they enter thru the threshold. The staff is highly trained about how to inform the customer to order from their menu. The cashier behind the counter even made sure that the flavor I selected was something I wanted. I chose the flavor from their sampling of mango, but it was lactose free and did not contain any lactose.

The guest does have to pay extra for topping priced at $1.00 each. The selections of topping is extensive and my favorite being coconut. I decided to add rainbow sprinkles and it really dressed up the mango sorbet too! Such a sweet and pleasant way to hydrate ourselves and beat the heat with sorbet and sprinkles.

I was told this place has great club sandwiches, so we went. I was pleasantly surprised by the inside with its big beautiful windows and fireplace. 

We were disappointed with the waitress who kept peeking out of kitchen while on her phone. Oddly too she never greeted us. We ordered our food through the bartender, he told her our order and she asked him if we wanted drinks, he said he didn't know. She never ever came, introduced herself or asked. We had to stop her and ask for drinks. 

The place wasn't busy, she had one other table. So, we weren't off to a great start. Our order arrived and we asked about our avocado (supposed to be on the side) but wasn't present. She said the kitchen forgot to do it. She forgot to mention she forgot to check that our order was correct prior to bringing it to us. We then had to ask for salt, pepper and ketchup, which she then brought. 

The rest of our meal was uneventful and the sand which was as good as promised. 

I needed to use the restroom prior to our leaving and was hit immediately with a foul bathroom! Foul, as in the sewer backed up at some point earlier in the day. So I promptly lost the food I just ate. I came running out of the bathroom still heaving. My husband asked if there was a sewer problem, the bar tender said yes. 

Let me be clear- if your bathrooms are THAT BAD YOU SHOULD HAVE A SIGN UP!! Any business that serves food and then reclaims it because it's so disgusting in ANY area of the place should immediately refund customers money. 

So disappointed in this place! I do not recommend.

Just you basic Sonic. The parking lot for everything is fairly big but at the end pf the day, it's another Sonic. I've only had the drinks here because of the happy hour. Service is fast and my orders haven't been screwed up yet.
Late and lied about landing times. Our ride had to drive around for 45+ mins. To top it off there was already a plane at our gate, had to wait an additional 20 mins to get off.

Do not go to this gym! They only care about taking money out of our pocket. The 10$/month membership is a scam when they have high hidden maintenance fee which they deduct TWICE a year. Other gyms only deduct a lot smaller amount and that too only once a year. Their amenities are not the greatest either.  Definitely not worth the money you are investing. They also do not care if you are a person with a disability which is why we have decided to cancel our membership from here. No thanks. World Gym, GOODBYE for good!

I'm from out of town and was craving a breakfast burrito. I found this place and was satisfied and impressed 
I ordered a breakfast burrito with egg whites and carne asada ($6.65) and it was one big burrito. Very flavorful and stuffed well. 
Yay for good Mexican food!

Stopped by on a Tuesday night at 6. Place was pretty empty, so my group (three of us) was seated immediately. Service was quick and attentive. Sliced bread with pesto sauce comes complimentary, and it was really tasty. I had the lobster mac and cheese. It was good but not great, about what I expected. The sauce it came in was pretty spicy. My friends both raved about their meals - a margherita pizza and a pasta special. This place gets bonus points for its location (right across the street from U.S. Airways Center) and for having San Tan Devil's Ale, one of my favorites, on tap.
Kevin did an amazing job for a pedicure! He took his time and did not rush. He is very friendly and is always so nice!

There's 20+ 'not recommended' reviews for Newdle Bar. Looking through them, I'm inclined to agree with a good number of them.  If I go to Newdle Bar, it's only on a Tuesday for half-priced sushi, because I'm not a fan of anything else on the menu. Prepare for a long long long long long wait, and waiters that couldn't care less. Avoid the white tuna, it's not as good as other places, like Phoenix Express in Stow. The Philadelphia roll is great, but only at half price rates. The online menu prices are also wrong, and are higher inside the restaurant. The atmosphere is loud, so don't expect to have intimate conversations with your dining Partner. Ross overall the place is good for a long dinner and some sushi. Many people have mixed experiences but that has been mine.

One of the best massages I've had in a long time. The front desk staff especially Ellen is super professional, friendly, accommodating and helpful. And then the massage therapist Cat was an absolute gem. Cat probably read my mind before she even met me. I said my goal was to relax and she knew exactly what to do. Her pressure was firm and invigorating at the same time. I left feeling so incredibly relaxed and I will most probably book again requesting Cat as my therapist. Thank you for an awesome job and for making me feel so welcome !!

Family is a huge fan of this chain. The popovers are nothing short of incredible. Love the bacon wrapped chicken, it's my favorite and they always get it right. Most times I get only the market table and no meat because I'm not much of a meat-eater, but I always hear some great comments about the meats from those I go with. Mashed potatoes and plantains are both delicious too. Unique flavors make for a very tasty meal. Overall a great restaurant for anybody, well worth the cost each and every time.

I think this might have been our favorite meal of the trip. Yes, like everything and everywhere we went in Las Vegas  it was expensive, but the quality was very good. We had a little bit of dim sum, shrimp wonton soup which was excellent and a delicious noodle dish with barbecued pork. Very good lunch in a very nice atmosphere.

Love this l place! we had the seafood platter, salad and escargo (excuse my spelling) it was just delicious! When I go places one thing I look for in a place is service and he was an absolute delight I would definitely go back if I lived in Vegas.

Amazing! So glad we found this place. We had a few of their open face sandwiches or "smorebord" dishes and the cauliflower with wheat berry salad. The salad was incredible, simple yet pronounced and flavorful with perfect textures. The different sandwiches were all stellar and really delicious! For dessert we had a kind of angel food cake that was a new addition to their menu, it's bind blowing - try it!
Can't wait to come back and try some of their hot dishes and hopefully wake up in time for their weekend brunch (ends at 3pm).

We have used PreFlight for years. Fast, convenient service and friendly employees. We prepay online for the best rates. Exiting their lot, they always have a cool bottle of water waiting for us. They know how to treat their customers to keep them coming back again and again.

This branch has a newer version of the ATM system that won't ask you if you are depositing cash or checks separately.  You just select the account you want to deposit the money in and you can combine both cash and checks.  Very good idea.

Most of the food here is adequate, but that's about all I can say.  The service is okay, but not great.  The wait staff is generally nice, but not friendly, and not very quick.

I can say that I was VERY dissapointed by their idea of "bruschetta".  I refused to eat it.  It was pita bread, cold tomatoes, slabs of mozzerella cheese, and avocado.  Awful.

I am so happy that Eat has opened up downtown!  I think we've found our pre Smith center show meal!  Our receipt says that JD was our server and he was very friendly and helpful.  The homemade potato chips were very good, the coffee was nice and strong, the owner was walking around saying/smiling hello at people.  My suggestion would be to punch up the flavor of the tofu banh mi.  I am always appreciative when there is a vegan option at restaurants.  I ordered the tofu banh mi veganized and it was pretty plain.  My lunch mates enjoyed their chicken sandwich, salad and grilled cheese.  It's a great restaurant with huge potential.  A soy milk option for the coffee and oatmeal would also be great too!  It's always nice to support a new local business, go eat at Eat everyone!

Great service. Ordered a diet coke and the fried cheese curds with the tiger blue sauce and the garlic sauce. The soda was flat but they fixed it and have me another. The cheese curds were great. The to,get blue sauce it's a horseradish sauce with blue cheese, very good. The garlic sauce could definitely be more garlicky in my opinion. I would have liked to see more dipping sauce choices for sure...bacon flavored, maybe an avocado based sauce...etc

Have been a loyal customer for years and would always go to Lyndzee. I was in Toronto for the weekend and needed a hair cut and fresh look for a friend's wedding. Since Lyndzee wasn't available, I put my hair in the most capable of hands in Dylan, master stylist. I read a lot of reviews about her and I decided to go for it. She was great, professional and knew what I wanted my hair to look like without even asking. She knew I wanted to keep it long and just offered to clean it up very well. She also gave me the bangs I've always wanted. Five stars for Civello AGAIN and Dylan. Check out my hair: http://stylebypatty.com/theres-no-place-like-home/

Ever since I've started going to Salon Sanctuary, I've never looked for anywhere else.  I actually discovered them quite by chance, as I happen to work in the shopping center where they're located and decided to give them a try simply because it was convenient.  And I have never regretted that decision!  The entire staff is extremely friendly and you can tell that everyone is happy to be there.
My most recent visit was several weeks ago for a hair styling appointment with Amerah, who is relatively new to Salon Sanctuary, and she did an absolutely magnificent job!  I went in with a pretty vague idea of what I wanted and she was very patient as we discussed several possibilities for my hair cut.  And she definitely does not disappoint!  She gave me a hairstyle beyond what I ever imagined.  I love how she is so thorough and encourages you to make sure everything looks the way you want it.  I will definitely be returning to her next time I make an appointment.
Overall, I always have a wonderful experience any time I visit and I would highly recommend it to anyone who is looking for a friendly, high-quality salon.
I really like going there for 1/2 Wings on Monday night... also great house beer. It's called Savoy and its 10$ for pitcher.

Plenty of beers to choose from.  On a football Sunday, you can easily get a table.  My burger was VERY tasty and but a little extra greasy (it was their signature burger - The Rusty Onion Burger).  My boys had the pizza and a calzone, very healthy sized portions.  The bathrooms are clean.  Plenty of patio seating, but we chose to sit inside.  The bench that runs along one of the walls was an odd height in relation to the table so I felt like I was hunched over to eat. The service is a little slow, but I didn't mind the pace.  All in all it's a decent local bar/restaurant, convenient to my home, and I'll be back again soon.
Be prepared for a long wait. After 30 mins of waiting they said they forgot my order. Food is good but they need to be better organized.

Cappadonnas came highly recommended to me.  Unfortunately my experience was very disappointing.  They were very dismissive and presumptuous.  I asked if they did in home consults.  Without knowing me or the size of my home or bank account I as told they only did in home consults for higher end homes.  Again without knowing anything about me, this pompous man even suggested that my lighting came from a discount store.

Right in so many ways. I was hoping for good eats, but wasn't 100% sure what to expect. What I got was a complete treat for all my senses. 

We went for Sunday brunch, and when I walked in, I did think, "Man, this place is loud," but when I saw a live DJ in the corner, I couldn't help but smile. The entire vibe makes you feel like ish is happening here every day. The interior is just perfect with concrete floors, spring-like colors and an open kitchen for you to witness the creation of your eats. We ate at the counter and loved it. 

Service was a little aloof, but I was too distracted by all the tattoos to really care. I think they just really mean business. 

The menu itself is a work of art worth reading down to every last bite. The dishes are creative and well-thought out. You know there is a real love of food just by reading the possibilities. We ordered the Huevos Motulenos, Turkey Benedict (only available during weekend brunch) and a short stack of pancakes ($5!!). The Motulenos features a mind-dizzying array of ingredients, including sauteed bananas! Mixed in with two chilis and a variety of beans, it turned out to be a delicious dish of sweet and spicy. And, the breakfast potatoes were legit. Basically, chop up a potato and make it sizzle. A true tater. The Benedict with turkey bacon and spinach was also a winning combination of flavors. I swear I tasted basil, but whatever I tasted, I approve. The only slight complaint there was that it came out lukewarm. 

Now, the pancakes deserve their own paragraph, but can be best summarized with one word: perfect! They managed to have crispy, but not burnt, edges and a soft, milky center. They were the perfect thinness, making it all too easy to devour a short stack all by your lonesome. 

Worth noting: While the weekday menu includes tofu scramble and a tofu banh mi, I didn't notice any vegan options on the brunch menu. Might be worth calling if you're a vegan headed there for a weekend brunch.  

My only other minor complaint is that I thought the coffee was a little weak. However, that in no way prevents me from respecting this culinary gem. It's just so cool, a true Vegas original.
Usually well stocked, busy.  Only down side is long line to check out

Food was actually good if you ignore the hair I found in there. Perhaps it would have been better if they gave me what I ordered. Usually I would let them know it was wrong but it was a lost cause. Everyone there is too busy to care. At least I finally got my water after I finished my entire meal and right before I left?

This place is beautiful, from the furniture to the arrangement of the food. There quality of the food is great but i unfortunately feel like there isnt a huge diversity in the selections. Theres chinese, italian, american, mexican and seafood. For what they have for those categories theyre great choices but mainly the price and the tiny need to expand their selection a bit are the things that keep this from being a five star in my eyes.

Put in a call early evening YESTERDAY. I was told that dispatch would get back with me. I've called several times now. It's now 2 am.  No call back - nothing.  Apparently there aren't many - if any - people ahead of us and no good reason could be provided as to why we have not received at least a call back.  The owner has been notified of our calls, which haven't been many but enough to make sure we're still on the radar. It's triple digit weather - letting us know up front that they couldn't look at the a/c in a timely manner would have been along the line of ACTUAL 'service'.
I have been to CB three times. Twice for brunch and once for dinner. Each time food and service have been top notch. A great central Phoenix eatery. I highly recommend.
They have great Churros here and their ice cream sundae was delicious. You must visit this place for Churros!!
Excellent lunch! LOTS of fresh choices to build your own burrito or tacos. Sooo good. Wish they had one in KC.

I miss this place sooooo much! It's honestly deliciousness in the best way! The Kashmiri naan filled with dates cannot be rivaled! And the veggie dishes are ridiculous! I'm so happy to see this place thriving! It's quaint atmosphere and mood lighting on a Friday night is perfect! And I'm excited to enjoy this wonderful place again!

Went in a week or so ago, I'm very excited to have a new brunch spot nearby our home as it's my favorite meal!  Small place but very cute, once the weather isn't staggeringly hot and they are able to utilize the garage doors out to the patio it will create a ton of additional eating space. Our server was friendly and attentive, food came out in a reasonable amount of time. The food was pretty good, I had the Eggs Benedict and the eggs were overcooked, the yolks were completely solid which is a huge peeve of mine with benny's as the runny yolk is the best part!  All of the food at the other tables looked great, and although we were not drinking alcoholic beverages this day, I LOVE that they have a full bar and plan to take advantage of it someday soon. Overall I would totally suggest this restaurant to friends to give it a try!

Food is really good. I've had the deep dish pizza and meat tortellini with tomato cream sauce. I gave one less star because the last two times they wouldn't deliver (once they said they were short staffed and once they had a big catering order and fell behind). Also they close soooo early for a pizza place. If they stayed open later and hired another delivery person I'd give five stars.

This is the first year I've attended the Olympia expo- I had my reservations about attending, as I am obviously not a body builder and worried that I'd feel uncomfortable among all of these fitness pros for whom crafting a killer bod is their career. That fear was completely unwarranted and there are attendees at all stages of their fitness journey here, and everyone was friendly.

The obvious perks for attendees are the freebies and the opportunity to meet pros you've only seen on TV or followed on IG- and they're typically enthusiastic about talking to and meeting fans, and taking photos, which was cool to see. There are many brands present to try new supplements, pre-workouts, or BCAAs, or just to stock up on your usual stuff with a discount (and no shipping fees!), along with some apparel brands and fitness publications (M&F is a sponsor). The freebies alone more than make up your ticket cost ($30/day or $50/weekend). If shopping and samples aren't your thing, try your hand at one of the many competitions- or just watch!

More than anything else though, it's fascinating people watching and a weirdly energizing atmosphere- I'm tempted to make a Bingo card for next year to catch all of the bizarre photo ops, long mens room lines, women in stage makeup and tans, random mascots, and the insane amount of implants and accents. 

TIP: Go early to avoid crowds and experience short lines, but stay late to get the lowest price deals. Also, The Rock made a last-minute surprise appearance for the final hour, which more than made the six hour day on my feet worth it!

The delivery driver was awesome! I accidentally gave him $60 for a $20 order an he brought the money back saying that a paid him incorrectly. That was amazing! 

The meal however was really greasy and they forgot the sweet and sour sauce.

Wow, I was here last Friday ( really Saturday by then) but I don't remember a thing.  I heard something about the roof opening and I still don't get it.  I sort of remember some sic views.  I really wished I didn't pre-partied so hard.   I sobered up at Seamless.  What a place to sober up at.

Regardless, we were taken care of at Moon so I'm sure I had a better time that your average lady.

Jazmin and Vince are nothing short of amazing! I had my wedding on Oct. 20th, 2016. Jazmin took the time to meet with me weeks before my wedding to help me finalize details and make sure my day ran smoothly. During our meeting she paid very close attention to detail and took notes. Her calm demeanor and "I got this" attitude is what eased my mind and made me feel better about the wedding planning process. On the day of my wedding Jazmin and Vince did an amazing job of coordinating our ceremony and making it stress free and fun! I would highly recommend this dynamic duo! 
-Brianna and Javier Hernandez

Worth the wait! Its probably not a good place for a first date, because you can expect to wait about 45 minutes to an hour to get a table, and another 30 to 45 minutes for your food (if you get their Chicago style crust) however, it is totally worth it if you enjoy the company of those you go with. Their pizza is wonderful, and a trip to Oregano's is simply incomplete without a pizzoki. If you enjoy drinks, their peach belini is great as well. I've never had something from Oregano's that I wouldn't advise someone else to order.

Okay place for the beers and burgers. They seem to have a little trouble cooking Burgers to temperature. Only 4 ppl eating food in the entire place, would hate to see what happens when they are busy. Our food came out about 10 minutes apart and we both had burgers?? Plus the French fries oil really needed to changed days ago. Tasted and smelled stale. Gross. The food would be a 2 star n the service was good but combined no more than a lucky 3 for them. The management knew there were problems and took care of our meal.

We have used this company many times to trim our very large palms. They always do a great job. They clean everything up and then grind up all the fronds so there is nothing left. Eddie was very professional and personable. And the whole crew worked very hard to make sure the job was done to our specifications. Highly recommend!

I mean, I'm not expecting much but...

1. Ask for honey bbq sauce, they gave me buffalo.  
2. Ask for extra gravy, didn't get any.
3. The wings were UNCOOKED  on the inside!!

Feel like I need to spend hundreds  of dollars on doctor bills to check for salmonella after $15 meal.

Oh haaky, I wanted so badly for this to be as off-the - charts awesome as in the past ..... But you let me down.  What started off as a strong start ended dismally.  I am originally from Las Vegas and very familiar with the restaurants high level of customer service and have had incredible meals at haakasan in the past, so I was of course disappointed this ended weakly.  
I made the reservation for 7.15pm through Takoda, who has made my reservations in the past .  He is always a pleasure to work with and answers promptly .  We were greeted by a couple very sweet and beautiful hostesses and actually decided to sit at the bar and have a more causal dinner that way.  The bar was completely empty, score right ? The bartender was cool and helped us out right away .  We ordered a cocktail , Budda's Palm ($22 cocktail!) which was amazing as usual then we ordered food ... Food came out quick ! The ribeye stir fry was so delicious and melted in your mouth!! We had a small bite , bacon, bean something roll , which was great at first bite ... The second bite I had was surprisingly crunchy, so much so , I couldn't actually bite through the green bean, odd right ? Well of course it was difficult as it wasn't a bean at all , it was a toothpick !!! I would have mentioned it to the bartender ; however , she was gone and the other 2 behind the bar were conversing.  Our bartender pretty much disappeared after that and the other bartender was focusing on another couple... 10 minutes later he finally comes over and we order dessert, chocolate mint and espresso .. Cake comes out no espresso no bartender .  The service started out strong but ended so weak and on top of that I had a toothpick baked into my very expensive small dish! Bummed out !

This hotel is simply ok. I was actually a little disappointed in our stay to be honest. Check in was a breeze, although we did it late at night. Service at the front desk was fast, friendly and efficient. The lobby decor is ok. Nothing super fancy but nothing terrible either. 

We were given  a room on the "concierge" floor. I have no idea what that means and frankly I don't think our room was better than anyone else's. It seems like that title is simply a gimmick to make gold and platinum members feel like they are being taken care of. 

Rooms are in need of remodeling...or maybe they are just not decorated in my style. I dunno...the rooms seemed outdated. There was no safe, which was extremely disappointing. You can lock your things in a box at the front desk but they can't accommodate computers or purses. 

We had an incident where we had a dirty bed. The situation was immediately rectified by the manager and he was genuinely concerned about the issue. He fixed it and made sure that others were aware of the situation so it would not happen again to us or any other guest. I appreciated that. 

Fortunately we are gold members so we got fee wi-fi but there is a $9.95 charge if you are not. We were also given tickets to the breakfast buffet which was very good. Service in the dining room was great. 

Overall, I likely would not stay here again. It just was not that great.

This is the newest casino on the strip, and in my opinion one of the best! My wife and myself were treated like royalty and the customer service is outstanding!!! The employees are definitely ontop of their game, and I was impressed every step of the way!! The food is amazing, and the employees treated us like family everywhere we went. I highly recommend this casino, which was very affordale. I was very impressed with the northside cafe, and the cleo restaurant located in the same casino was excellent! If you haven't visited this casino, you must check it out! I love this place and the rooms and rates are amazing!!

There's only about 18 seats at the Oyster Bar, so come early unless you want to wait for a seat to open up.  Not that waiting is an issue with Oyster Bar...waiting is just a necessary prelude for a dynamic finale, namely the food.  Any wait time for good food is excusable.  It's better to wait for good food for an hour or two then to eat at an establishment that serves mediocrity.

My brother found this place on Yelp.  I really want to thank my brother and all the Yelpers that submitted honest reviews of this place to make us come here.  The food is simply...amazing!  Thanks everybody!  I really want to keep this place hush hush but seems like I'm too late, the word has already spread around Yelp that Oyster Bar is the real deal.  Surprise, surprise, we sat next to some Yelpers and people who came because of the Yelp reviews of Oyster Bar, today, during lunch.  It's a small world after all...

First off, do yourself a favor and order the reasonably priced Fanny Bay oysters for $16.99.  It's hard to see that price for Fanny Bay anywhere else.  Secondly, as you're waiting for whatever delicious entree you ordered, munch on that awesome bread they gave you.  Ask for more bread for later to dip on your Palace Pan Roast ($22.99).  They offer you a heat level of 1 through 10.  Don't go showing off now!  A 7 is pretty hot already.  The cook and waiter told us stories of many people who couldn't handle a 10.  Don't be that guy!  We also had the Seafood Jambalaya ($23.99) at a level 6.  Just enough heat without losing the overall flavor.  In a nutshell, the food here is awesome, especially the Palace Pan Roast.  Most people usually lose when going to Las Vegas, don't you lose out by not coming to Oyster Bar!

Pretty good chicken tikka masala!  The wife and I both enjoyed it, we both ordered it mild, I'll probably step up to medium next time because the mild is not spicy at all, but it still has a good flavor.  The naan was hit and fresh and the rice was perfect.  

We'll be back!

Got there10 minutes before my appt time as they requested. Had my " pre exam" which basically was a sales pitch for a more extensive eye exam. Sat in the chair in the Drs office for 45 minutes waiting for him to " get back from lunch ". This was between 3:00 till 3: 45. At that point I left. Also - their "deal" is for basic glasses. Progressive lenses are at least as expensive as anywhere else if not more
Cute little place for breakfast & lunch. I enjoy their avocado toast for breakfast! You can also order & pick up family meals for family's on the go.
Ricardo took very special care and time to cut my daughter's hair.  She won't settle for just anyplace.  She is beaming with excitement about her new hairdo.

Awesome place to get a haircut especially i was from out of town. Guys are from NY state, shop is clean, and doesn't smell like most barbershops i've been to. Had a great time talking sports from the 90's and real hip hop.

I'm originally from the south. Popeye's is one of my favorite fast food restaurants. Imagine my delight to see that they put a new location in this area. I've been to this new location 3 times so far. We have only used the drive thru. The service is polite. The wait times are normal for a Popeye's (maybe even a little faster). The food has been hot and fresh each time with the exception of some french fries that were lukewarm. Most recently we ordered the $20 box of chicken with 2 large sides and 5 biscuits. It was delicious and a good value. My only complaint is that the large mash potatoes had about 2 tablespoons of gravy. 

This location is a welcome addition. They will hopefully be more consistent with corporate standards as time goes on. For a new location they're doing surprising well.

Banks are banks and let's be honest this isn't always your favorite errand to run especially on a lunch break! I very rarely go inside the bank but yesterday I had no choice. I had confirmed fraud on my debit card about two and a half weeks ago and was told that a new card would be sent out to me. Well of course that wasn't the case so I needed a temporary card. I'm VERY familiar with the process of how this transaction should've went and have to leave feedback on what could've been improved. For starters when I walked in there was no visible person to greet and direct the "traffic". I stood at the front kiosk for approximately 7-10 minutes before anybody came over to find out what I needed help with. I then noticed a young Hispanic women who was holding a tablet that was assisting another customer (ok so they did have somebody out there but who was the back-up) I observed 3 other personal banker's whom had no customers at their desk and began to wonder why they didn't feel the need to jump in? Finally I was acknowledged and signed in to see a banker. That wait was less than 5 minutes and got issued my temporary card. Total time with in and out was less than 15 minutes so I guess I'll be fair and give them 3 stars!

Never even got ice cream. We went in on a Monday night at 6 PM with no line at all. We stood at the counter for about ten minutes and were told we would be assisted soon. This is a management problem, the process that Creamistry uses is fun and novel but clearly takes more time. This would be fine if you have a properly staffed counter, but the two people there were totally overwhelmed. There were still four people sitting and waiting for their orders so who knows how much longer it would have been before we actually had the ice cream in our hands. Creamistry, help your employees be good employees, hire more people!!

In a city filled with amazing restaurants Luca is at the tip of the spear. My first experience there was amazing. Beautiful decor with amazing views and a friendly staff. From the warm bread and amazing olive oil dip to the mouth watering dessert, the food was top of the line. I actually had one of the best ribeye steaks of my life followed by hands down the best tiramisu I have ever tasted. If you want a great dining experience in a beautiful space give Luca a go. You will not be disappointed.

Not quite what I had expected based on rave reviews.. I guess the atmosphere was surprising. The waitress was wearing very casual clothing and there were literally boxes of tables stacked in the corner. 
But not to complain about the food because it was not bad. I had the escargots to start which were so garlicky they were almost spicy. Delicious but not served with anything to sop up the lovely juices and break up the strong flavour, but I asked for more of the bread we had to start and the waitress brought some. I had the shrimp and scallop curry which was quite nice and my friend had the beef bourgignon. Only problem is that my friend does not eat pork and there was almost as much bacon as there was beef in her stew. For dessert, she had a raspberry sorbet which was great and I had the lemon tart. Large portion but I personally wasn't a fan of the crust and thought it should have been more lemony.
Overall, it was a nice experience to try a new place but it won't go on my regular rotation.

it was my first time here, i am a Lucille's fan since moving to Vegas almost 5 years ago...I had a brisket sandwich and it was the best brisket I have ever had!! The catfish tenders weren't very good but then again I have never liked cat fish in the first place... my favorite sauce (out of 5!!!) they had to offer was the Georgia kiss or something like that... the other sauces in my opinion were your run of the mill barbecue sauce.... all in all the food was good and the service was excellent... I definitely plan to eat here more often and I have forgotten about the other place

We are not in Thailand to have the best thai food but this restaurant offers very tasty entrees and main dishes , their mango and papaya salads are very good very well spiced and their main curry dishes with coconut sauce are really good , a place to try , I just loved this modern place in quartier dix30 and will sure come back !

New and wonderful! Well designed imaginative space with an 'all piggy' menu. Small space with BIG flavor. I had the 'Cheesy Piglet', grilled cheese and bacon and my companion had the 'Classic BLT'. Both were delicious. The special mayos (there are five) made my friend say "The best BLT in his life!"
I must mention the counter person, Miranda. A personable young woman with a warm welcome. The owners also stopped to chat. Tony and Natalie. Hard work, enthusiasm and much humor. We wish them well in this new endeavor. We will see them again soon...pork your hunger! Thanks.
Horrible service, the staff ignore our request to sit together.Very unpleasant experience

I have only been to the location on Peel, but I' assuming that they are pretty much the same. The menu is extensive and the food is amazing. Well-priced for what you get (which is a lot!) and the service is pretty good for a Montreal restaurant. Highly recommended.

I hardly know where to start!  What a disaster.  We got there when it opened...a little after 11 am .  We had orders from our friends for side orders that were posted on their website but not available in the store.  They had very limited side orders and not even any chicken wings!  We heard the cook in the back say that they were almost out of waffle mix so he would have to stretch it... and this is when the place opened!  After waiting nearly 40 minutes, we finally got our food.  FYI... the fried chicken is nothing special and if you want grilled chicken, you are out of luck.  The sides were all unacceptable.  The coleslaw was watery and tasteless, the mac and cheese was dry, mushy, and tasteless, the potato salad was definitely not homemade, the fries were soggy, and worst of all, the red velvet waffles were nothing more than a regular waffle with added red food color for $3.00 extra.  The place itself was less than charming with a big puddle of water on the floor where the patrons wait..... and wait, and wait.  The girl at the counter was pleasant but not only did she take the orders and handle the money, she dished up food without gloves after she had just handled the money. 
 Did I mention that it was much more expensive than other comparable places??  All in all, a really BAD experience.  I think that Flavor Flav should stick to a business he is familiar with!
Tried to go but place was closed and people were inside! Not sure if it was a problem with yelp or the restaurant. Yelp said they were open but the door was locked!
Quick friendly service, food was great, lots of variety. Price was comparable to most restaurants.
Great ambiance, friendly staff, excellent food, and brew. Love this place. Happy hour until 6:00 weekdays. $1 off brews and appetizers.

I have come to Vegas but have seldom stepped into M&M World. This past February my cousins wanted to go in and get some souvenirs to bring home to friends. M&M World is FOUR FLOORS with different things to look at. You can get things from cups, towels, and bags. You can customize what you want on your M&Ms but it has to be appropriate with no sexual content or explicit language. My favorite portion was the wall of M&Ms where you can create your own bag. I got a mix of mint, pretzel and crispy M&Ms. It is pricey by the pound so be mindful on how much you pack. I think I paid almost $20 for a full bag of M&Ms. Hershey Chocolate World is across the street located in New York New York so it would be good to go to both if you have the time.

Best place to catch a movie in the area. Huge theaters, comfy seats, and tons of showtimes. Yeah, it's pricey sometimes, but we gotta accept that movies aren't 5 bucks anymore. Plus, there's an IMAX theater.

Our first time here & we'll probably try to go somewhere else before coming back here.  They take reservations which was great since we were a party of 7 coming in on a weekend evening.  

The food was delicious.

However, the service was as bad as everyone else on here claims.  We had to ask for water, more kimchi, etc. several times before someone actually came back with our requests.  It seemed like they were understaffed because all of the servers were running around everywhere & we didn't have 1 specific server.  They always came to our table in a blaze & left just the same.

Honestly, the location makes this place. Consistently some of the worst service ever. Whether I have gone for lunch in the summer, a quick drink early on a Friday, or a dinner in the evening, the hostess is wrapped up in other things, the wait staff and bar couldn't care less.  Food is good, not great, but always satisfying. They need customer service training!!
Coffee is yummy but not sure worth more than $7. Did get milk substitute but I always do and never paid so much before.

We went during the day and got tickets without the open bar option for $22 or $25. Yelp said something about $15 tickets, but I wasn't able to find them. They let you bring your own drinks on so that's what we did, and I'm not sure how people can drink several drinks during the ride because we couldn't even finish our drinks that we brought during the ride and we only had one each. It was a fun experience and it was nice that we didn't have to share a pod with strangers and we had one for our group of four. There weren't any lines, but we went during the day and were told that it gets really busy at night.
Dr. marks stuff is exceptional.  Wonderfully polite and Dr. Marks is a wonderful Doctor.  He'll give you all the attention you need and the wait times aren't ridiculous either.
I came to lunch with some friends . Great service food was yummy sushi is very fresh . I will recommend the reasturant
Shruti is my go to for Botox! I followed her from another spa to this one because she is worth it! I haven't had any other services here, but can definitely vouch for the injector!

Wait time quoted: 40 minutes.
In the meanwhile at least 6 tables remained empty.  Under staffed?  Perhaps.  Was watching one server making her way to one section of the restaurant, only to suddenly turn around to go to another section to clear another table.  
Once seated, our server came several times to get our orders, which we weren't ready for.  Food came in a decent time, except my eggs were rather brown from over cooked.
Their potato fries were good.
No one came to refill my glass of water until towards the end of my meal.
Meh.

The food court isn't the best, it doesn't have many choices, it could use a Dairy Queen. It isn't the best mall for kids because of its one floor design, it's a long walk from end to end. The parking is terrible. It doesn't have the best ways off leaving the parking lot. It could use a bit more stores. There is a free young child play area with supervision, which is great. Not the best mall.

Total scam.  Do not use the ATM!!!
I thought the club was pretty crappy.  The best dancers were the black guys (it's about 50/50 black & white dancers).  There were about 10-15 dancers.  $30 to get in.  My diet coke was $10.  Yep.  Not a typo.  $10 for a diet coke.  My beer was the same price.  The service was AWFUL.  Our drinks were empty most of the time.  You have to go up this staircase to get to the men's section that feels like you are walking up the stairwell of a parking garage.  Super creepy.  The dancers are VERY aggressive.
However, I gave the club 1-star (instead of maybe 2) because of "the atm incident".
When I took out money from the atm, I was very surprised that there was no "This machine is going to charge you $3.00 (or $7.00) to take out money.  Do you wish to continue?"  Or something along those lines.  My girlfriend couldn't believe it, so she went and took out money, too.  No mention of any charge.  We thought it was great- the club just wanted to make it easy for us to spend money.  I ended up not spending any of the money I took out- because I couldn't find a stripper I wanted to spend money on.  That should have been the end of it.
Then, we looked at our bank statements and saw the ATM did charge us.  ALOT.  For $200 they charged us $20.  (It turned out to be 10%).  I wouldn't have been so pissed off, if maybe someone had told us that's how much the charge was.  This wasn't a case of I was drunk and don't remember how much I spent.  I was dead sober- hadn't had a drink yet- when I took out that money, and the service was so bad, I only managed to get the two-drink minimum by the time we left.
Called my bank, called the club.  Of course, there's nothing I can do, but warn others.  I don't like being scammed, or taken advantage of.  If you don't either, don't go to this club.

I have nothing but praise for their staff! Amazing massages, acupuncture and chiropractor services. 

Great friendly & professional staff who do magic with their hands.  

Suzana :)

Bottom of the barrel for heath care!!!  This ER sent my husband home with a reptured appendix. He never saw a Doctor. He saw a PA, who said he had the stomach flu. By the time he got back to the hospital, he was on his death bed with 110 temp. His appendix had ruptured into 7 pieces and his entire abdomen was infected. They did exploratory surgery on him because 'the scans were not showing anything'. The surgeon thought he wouldn't make it and he was literally placed on ice (to bring down his body temp) after his surgery. I think she called me back into recovery in case I needed to say goodbye to him. I am grateful for the surgeon, but was unhappy with overall procedures. We are so very lucky he made it out alive.

Food was good, but $24 for lunch is a bit steep.  One burrito al a carte and a lunch special plus a beer and a soda..  

Service was great.  I'll go back and try something else around dinner time..

Fresh salad was just what I needed on that hot day.

I wasn't happy that chicken, and bleu cheese are premium ingredients, and that either was an extra $2.49 (which I didn't get), but meh.

I'd go back, but not often.

I love this convention center! This was the third year I was here for Phoenix Comic Con. It is clean, the staff are friendly, and the location is very convenient right off the light rail stop 3rd Street/Washington or 3rd Street/Jefferson depending on the direction you're coming from. I know people complain that if they drive in they have to pay for parking but I also know that while one nearby garage charges $12 another close by charges $6- so if you really want to save some money just drive around the block. Both those garages are a very quick walk away.

Loved this place!!  Came on a Friday night around 7:30pm w a group of 5...we were seated inside immediately (could have also sat outside).  Both were very busy but we still got a table, which is always nice!  I will say, inside was a bit loud, but we expected that.  Decor is fabulous; trendy, clean, modern.  Service was good, our waitress was very sweet.  Between us all we ordered: charred octopus (my fav of the night...served w a pickled fennel salad), two buckets of balls, one w the truffle sauce and the other w the arrabiata sauce (yum!), the butchers board, a charcuterie board (loved the cheeses and pickled veggies on this board), and a bruschetta board.  Everything was FANTASTIC!!  We also had wine and beer...I felt the prices were incredibly reasonable and even learned every day is happy hour if you sit at the bar ($19 for bottle and board!!) 

By far my favorite new place, locally...less than two miles from my house!!  I will be a regular moving forward!!

The room was nice. That's about the only thing that we enjoyed about our stay at the Bellagio this past weekend. I'm feeling generous today, so I gave them a 2, because the room was nice and the manager, William, was nice (he was the only one).

We received the most horrible customer service from the hotel staff (from the front desk staff all the way up to management). Day 1, the woman who checked us in dropped our credit card down the hole behind the computer. It took 1.5 hours for maintenance to fish it out. The manager who came over during this ordeal blamed us for the incident and told us to just be patient, we'd get the card back eventually. At one point we were told to go to get lunch (difficult without a credit card) and when we asked if lunch would be comped due to the issue at check in, we were initially told NO because it was our fault that the check in lady dropped our credit card. We then declined to get lunch, and said we'd prefer to wait at the desk to get our credit card back. It was clear they wanted us to leave the check in desk (there was a line of people waiting), because they then did offer to comp our lunch. Regardless, we needed our credit card and were afraid that once we were no longer in their sight, they'd get busy and never get the credit card back to us. So we stayed put, and continued to wait as patiently as possible for them to get us our card back.

Day 2, my mom slipped at the pool and hurt herself. When I went to get some ice for her, the life guard was amazingly nice. He was the only one. The manager he called over blamed us, AGAIN. He said that we should know that the pool deck was slippery from sunscreen being dripped on it. This happened at 9am, when it was cloudy out. I guess the other 4 people at the pool that morning had slathered on their sunscreen and dripped it everywhere? Did they not wash the deck the night before? And, really, if it's that big of a problem, they should have put a sign out "Slippery when wet". For the remainder of our vacation, my mom walked with a limp and couldn't navigate stairs-which for anyone who's been to Vegas before, knows is an essential skill to have if you ever want to cross the street! It was Day 4 before we received any follow up from Risk Management about this. While Risk Management was nice to us, the woman we spoke with the first person the entire vacation that was.

Not once did we receive an apology from the staff for any of this. Not once did someone say, "I'm so sorry that your vacation didn't turn out to be awesome." We weren't looking for monetary compensation (though we did get some). We stayed here because it's a beautiful hotel, and I'd read reviews about how nice everything was, but we received the worst service imaginable. The attitude of the managers and other staff, blaming us for everything, really put a bad taste in our mouths. A smile, an apology, and a kind word would have gone a long way.

We had a much different experience than the previous poster.  We wanted to browse, and after being greeted, the sales associate let us wander the store without bothering us. Tremendous selection of feeders to choose from.
We probably asked her a dozen questions over the hour or so we were there, as we were just getting started with bird feeders and we wanted to create our own feed mixes.
