She was super helpful describing what type feeds would attract which type birds and when we made our final selections, she gave us a number of coupons we could use that day and others for subsequent day's purchases.  
Went back the following day to buy more and that associate was just as pleasant.  It was a great experience and we are loving seeing the birds enjoy our feeders off our deck.

Arrived in town on business from Canada and as usual I like to search out a good Mexican restaurant.  Stopped in here on a warm afternoon and was greeted by a huge smile from the waiter, who was just fabulous (others could learn from him!).   

The food - I ordered a Burrito Mexicana, it arrived very quickly and on a nicely warmed plate.  I wouldn't call it large but it was perfect for lunch, and most importantly it was delicious!

A place added you my list :-)

Like many other Yelpers below, I stopped here on a whim while passing through (on a self guided southern Wisconsin wide brewery tour). My bf and I browsed the lunch menu and decided on the 1/2 salad and a cup of soup deal with one of their beers to wash it down. 
Unfortunately, I didn't read the menu more carefully and what should have been a $20 lunch turned into $40 because the salads listed below that deal were not actually included in that deal, only a small house salad. It was too late though, we had both already devoured our soups (the super delicious chicken enchilada soup) and salads (mine was the ensalada fiesta, his was the chicken gorgonzola salad). Either way, for two cups of soup, two salads, and two beers, I would not expect a $40 bill in rural Wisconsin. GIVE ME A BREAK. If not for the unreasonably steep prices, I'd have given this place four stars. The food was pretty good, the beer was different and tasty, and the server was really nice even with the misunderstanding.

Wonderful place! Even water is filtered here! 
Great atmosphere, tasty deserts! 
Prices are moderate.

Sweet Con conned me out of my money!!!

$25 each to get in FOR What?
I could not tell what The $50 my wife and I paid was for?
I've been to free events that are better!
I FEEL REALLY RIPPED OFF
If I could give it ZERO Stars I would....

I have both my ticket reciepts and Want my $50 back.....

I want my $50 back...
(UPDATE)
They ignored and blocked me on Facebook after I asked them for a refund.
I even gave them the transaction number for the cash I gave them...
I Feel like I was robbed....

OMG.. The best atomsphere, the best location, and with the best people, and this is the spot for great french style dinning.  Wait, did I forgot to say the restaurant with some of the cutest and mean hostess on the front that ready to welcome you.  This is the restaurant that highly recommend by our uber drivers.  Try to make reservation early and rush hour start just before 8pm or when sun go down.  A direct veiw to the Bellagio water show : )  I want to give a five stars, but our waiter is just not on top of his game (-1 star).  He needs to do some self-improvement. 
The last and most important is the price.  It is the best most affordable great dinning place on the strip.  You must go.  The french style steak is OK for us. It is worth for a visit.

First of all, the lamb shank, best Ive ever had, period.
Second of all, my waiter Carlos, world class customer service! This guy made me and my friends experience at this place spectacular! This guy is going places in life.. The quality of the food is unreal... Ask for Carlos for your waiter when visiting...

Pace of play was VERY slow, 5 hour round on a very short course.  The holes are close together so keep a lookout for the players on parallel fairways because we were either hit into or had to wait for someone out of the wrong fairway on 25% of the holes.  The front nine is not too challenging, the back is much better...the greens on the back are more challenging.  The staff was friendly and knowledgeable and the surrounding mansions are fun to look at and provide something to look at when you have to wait on every shot but I won't be back.

Upscale, nicely lit, sensual setting serving a variety of interesting small plates. Very big city like space in the west side of Madison.

I enjoyed the Sweet Chile Calamari fries and a long list of their other small plates (memorable ones include the Pheasant, diver scallops, ahi-poke, hanger steak)

Also, amazing cold water lobster bisque (but probably better of sharing it - it is rich and filling)

They also have a long list of wines and drinks including the amazingly dessert-like Peanut Butter Martini or the flaming S'mores martini! 

They have really nice desserts as well  - with a hearty chocolate fondue included (it is large -- good for 3 people) as well as a molten lava cake and a great creme brulee!

Note -- it can get a bit pricey as the tapas add up, so be warned! :-)

Bon appetit!

Always clean.  Staff is great and helpful.  Usually do my own laundry, but used the laundry sevice once, and they were prompt, and my laundry was nicely folded and waiting for me when I returned.  I love this laundry!

We ordered our Thanksgiving dinner & it was divine. So easy, delicious & convenient! We called the store & did not have to leave our name or a card number to hold anything, nor pay in advance. They just ask you what you want, what day you are picking up & give you a confirmation number. I recommend going early if your pick up day is the day before T-GIving. Not that they aren't fast & efficient there. The staff was courteous & they even show you your ham before you take it out of the store. The sweet potato casserole was so good, I wanted to get a spoon & hoard it in the corner. The green bean casserole was flavorful, but I think I will get another side next time. We also got the turkey breast which was great for turkey sandwiches the next day. The turkey kind of tasted like the ham with the same glaze so if you're looking for something different, keep that in mind. The pecan pie was very tasty as well. I guarantee you wont be disappointed with the price either, well worth the money & not at all expensive.

We had our Bischon groomed here today for the first time.  He looked amazing.  We have had him groomed at many place, but he never looked so good.   The groomers were professional, the facility very clean and they have separate kennels for each dog.  I would highly recommend them.

What a disappointing experience. We had wanted to get into this place after experiencing their craft cocktails at a local festival. After always trying to get a reservation on open table but it showing it was booked we decided to call. As it turns out they only take reservations for parties of 6 or more. We went and waited at the bar for a table. The cocktails were great although my drink was about 3 sips so not great for the price. At our table we were served one by one. My friends husbands meal came out first then my husbands came out cold and without chicken as requested then my friends came out steaming hot. My food came out so late everyone was nearly done with their food. My husband told them he was missing his chicken and he received it after finishing his meal. Our servers switched during the meal and when asking for our bill they asked us if we had a bottle of wine (which we didn't). They also took away our heat lamp during our meal for another table. We asked that we keep it as it was cold and they said they would bring another which they weren't able to light. It seemed as if they knew they missed the mark when we left but in no way offers to come anything (even the chicken my husband didn't eat because it came out so late). The service was really poor and the food was not amazing. Maybe it is an okay place for a drink but don't waste your time on a meal.

Drove 30 minutes to purchase shoes. Not concerned about price but looking for a brand (Johnston and Murphy) specifically carried by Macy's. Clerk in shoes walked off didn't offer help. Went to customer service with styles I liked both stating available in wide. Customer service rep says no only option is larger sizes no wides only medium. Wasted trip. Rude service.

Had dinner here last night. Very good. Their signature nachos were unusually hot last night. Tasted like someone spilled a jar of jalapeños. Not usually that hot. I would recommend this place for a taste of something different in southwestern, Mexican style food. We will definitely go back.

Another classic college town coffee shop on State Street, this one is part of a small local chain that has a special devotion to their wide variety of exotic coffees.  Long and narrow, you step up to a smaller split-level room in the back hung with paintings by local artists.

I don't personally love chain restaurants, but at least it's always consistent. Tonight we had avocado egg rolls (not as good as Cheesecake Factory) and an individual sized hand tossed pizza. They let us do half BBQ chicken and half spicy meatball. Some places don't let you do half and half if there are two different sauce bases (which is ridiculous, but I appreciate it even more when they do it).  Both were good, but the best thing is that we got Happy Hour prices even though we showed up at around 7:15! Our waitress told us that if the game is still on (its Thursday night football), the HH prices continue. Sweet!

Since this mall is closeby this is the easiest one to go to- not so busy, and it's located in the lonely wing- a ghost town in the Boulevard Mall (kinda sad, really). Been here many times. The helpful and nice sales people are always changing- fast turnover. The store is well-stocked, organized, clean, and smells really good (you will smell it from a ways away, but it's not sneeze-inducing). The promotions (e-mail list, mailed coupons, specials like Buy 2 get 1 free, etc.) are inviting. But the star here is the twice-yearly sales- when prices are really low. I really like the True Blue spa products with catchy names like "Be More Pacific" (manoi balm- smells like paradise- we love anything that conjures up memories of Hawaii). I also really like the pump antibacterial soaps with scents to match their lotions (Moonlight Path, Japanese Cherry Blossom, etc.) and  others like Kitchen Lemon. For years, I stocked up on their products for gifts year-round (& the holidays for that matter) for my friends and family. Be sure to stop there after the hoidays. I also go to the outlet store in Primm/Stateline (about 4x year).

Several websites had mentioned that this restaurant was one of the best Pho spots in Toronto. While visiting, it was within walking distance of our hostel. We were seated quite quickly and was surprised that there were S, L and XL pho options. Both my boyfriend and I ordered the #1, I ordered the large, while my boyfriend ordered the XL bowl. The XL bowl is priced at 9 CAD, which is about the standard price for a large sized bowl in NYC. 

When the XL bowl arrived, I was amazed. It was gigantic! The broth was delicious and the servings were decent, although there was a lot more noodles then I would have preferred. 

On our last day in Toronto with only about 10 CAD each to spare, we headed back here and it was also, a good experience, but a lot more crowded. 

The seating is pretty packed, but if you're looking for a quick and tasty bite to eat, check out Pho Hung.

Ok, I must start this review with a question; How the devil did I go this long without reviewing one of the premier joints in Las Vegas? (all answers are quite welcome). This is one of the swankiest places on the famous Las Vegas Strip. So let me start with this, most places after ten years or without a major renovation look dingy and decrepit. Not so with the Bellagio, this place always looks tops o the pops. Don't be intimidated by they seemingly snobby exterior, come on in and bask in the class act that is the Bellagio! Live it up, you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!

I have used Orchid Florist twice now and both have been good experiences. Today I use them and it was cutting it close on delivery time but arrived there and the flowers were beautiful. Excellent customer service from Nancy and Orchid Florists. I will definitely be repeating my business with them. :)

I had a very traumatizing experience at the Steak N Shake in Robinson Town Centre 1951 Park Manor Blvd, Pittsburgh, PA 15205. I had ordered 2 milkshakes via the drive thru and was told to pull up and wait for them. 20 minutes went by and I still had not received my milkshakes. I went into the restaurant to discover the cashier had "lost" my credit card. They said they couldn't find it anywhere (this was an hour ordeal). So I had to cancel my card. Next day they found it but didn't even have the courtesy to inform me. What a big headache and hassle. I had called corporate immediately on Sunday night but it's been past 48 hours and they STILL HAVE YET TO RESPOND TO SITUATION. POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE. I will never step foot in a Steak and Shake again!!!

This is a great example of a typical 'local color' Wisconsin tavern/grill ! Friday fish,reasonable beer/drink prices,and outstanding service. Fish was exceptional ,both perch and cod.Slight personal preference to cod.  Owner  is cook,he hand breads every piece of fish and keeps things running smoothly.....A solid 4-5 star for sure.

I've been here several times with Travelzoo vouchers. They consisted of a massage and a mini treatment, and I've had both the mini pedi and mini facial. 

Booking via Travelzoo is easy and I like their deals. 
They currently do not have an app so you would need to print the voucher and give to the establishment to redeem. 

Reservations were straight forward and nothing eventful. 

On the day of my spa days, I greeted by the two reception people and they were very personable and friendly. I was instructed to go the the ladies gym area, where I was greet by the ladies' area attendant.  The attendant will give you a tour if you ask. 

The ladies' area has all the usual amenities, such as lockers, showers, toiletries, steam, sauna, sitting area. All amenities were great and nothing too complain about. 

The treatments: 
The massages I received were amazing. Sometimes I doubt the skill of hotel therapists but I've been impressed with theirs. I like deep tissue so when the therapists found my knots, they worked it out a little.  

The mini facial was also relaxing and was pretty much a long face wash with mask and massage. 

The mini-pedi was disappointing because it was like a foot wash with 1 coat of polish  at the end. 

I would definitely come back.

I've always stayed at the Hilton Menona Terrace until this week.... This is my new hotel in Madison.  The Hilton was booked so I stayed at the DT.  They give you warm cookies on arrival (I guess this is commonly known but it was a nice surprise).  A hand written note from the manager was placed under my door an hour or so after my arrival.  It thanked me for staying at the hotel and gave me free breakfast for the length of my stay.  This is where things got really good... I got the flu from somewhere while on business and was confined to my room for two days.  The staff was incredible. They moved me to a larger room so my family could come to town and help me.  They moved all my stuff, gave me free movies, and brought sprite, ginger ale, and crackers.  They wouldn't accept any tips and beleive me we tried.  The staff is the friendliest and most accommodating I've ever seen and I stay in hotels 30-40 nights a year.

To the staff of the Doubletree in Madison - my sincerest thank you!

Absolutely FANTASTIC. Best steakhouse I have ever been to. Thanks to Yelp, I decided to take my boyfriend here last night for his birthday. I called to make reservations in the morning and wasn't able to get in until 8pm (fine by me). First off, the bread was delicious (came with 2 types of butters). For appetizer, we had the carpaccio-it was a full plate of it with pieces of toasted bread on top! For the entree, we both had filet mignon. Mine came with the Fleming's potatoes (A MUST TRY). His came with crab stuffed shrimp and asparagus. For dessert we ordered the chocolate lava cake! OMG this was sooo good. I'm so glad we ordered this and it definitely satisfied my sweet tooth!! This place also has a large wine list--bottle prices were from  the $30's to $600's. If you don't finish it, they cork it and seal it in a bag for you to take home. Because it was my boyfriend's birthday, the manager gave him a $25 giftcard for next time. In addition, every staff member we talked to said happy birthday to him (I mentioned it was his birthday when I made the reservation over the phone). Our waitress was very nice and knowledgeable on the food & wine as well. What amazing service and staff! The only negative thing for me would be the noise-but it was only because it was so busy!

Overall, this place is worth every penny! Thank you Fleming's...we will be back again!

We contacted this company after reading the reviews here on Yelp.   The two gentlemen that did the move were very nice.   We had moved all breakable items, boxes, and small items beforehand ourselves.   Unfortunately for the guys doing the move it was over 120 degrees that day, and as such the move took longer then originally quoted.   Brad Olson was very good about only charging us for the agreed amount of time quoted.    I would certainly recommend this company based upon their customer service.

We had our car oil changed at this location at the endof august. The same day after the service, we started hearing an intermittent dragging sound coming from under the car. We thought we had just driven over some junk on the road and it was making the tire sound weird. A few days later, the splash guard under the front of our car came down almost totally while my spouse was driving to work. We had a mechanic friend take it down fully - he said that there were multiple screws missing and the tabs weren't inserted properly to hold it up. The piece is now ruined from dragging and we have to spend $250 at the dealership to get it replaced. We can't prove it was the oil change that did it, but given the timing, it seems highly likely that the technician didn't replace that splash guard properly when they did our oil change. The kicker? Our mechanic friend who helped us take the splash guard down when it was dragging said that the exact same thing had happened to him on two different cars at the same location we went to. Our car has less than 15,000 miles on it, so it definitely wasn't normal wear and tear. What was a cheap and easy oil change has turned into hundreds of dollars and frustration of time off work, etc. Avoid this location at all costs.
Good place to eat. Had the fish and chips. Not greasy at all and home made french fries.

We are thrilled to have a new neighborhood place. First time last night. Best calamari I've ever had. Husband had the Italian Stallion panini - loved it - and those Parmesan Frites are definitely habit forming. I went for the Gusto Bolognese and it was delicious. Plenty of take home for a second meal of both. Family friendly, staff and owners are wonderful. Red Sangria was delicious and light. We are planning on making this a weekly go-to. Have to say it was fun watching a couple cute little boys watching the pizza making process!

Fine food but slow service. Had Sat brunch here and the waitress seemed to have been fired after taking our orders as she was never seen again. Coffees came 10min after ordering and worst was having to ask for the bill thrice.

I had a burger and VooDoo Fries my wife had their Cobb salad to go.  It was ok, I'm not a fan of charbroiled meat if it's grilled at home it doesn't have that Burger King (fake) taste.  Sorry BK.
It was a nice size and cooked just like I asked for but for an hour all I could taste was that fake charcoal taste. 

I'm a fan of burgers on the grill either gas or charcoal, this was disappointing!  

My wife loved her salad, guess I shoulda followed her lead! LoL 

Ben

Closed escrow on our new house and wanted to have all the locks rekeyed ASAP. I looked on Yelp and came across West Valley Lock & Key. I decided to give them a try based on all the five-star reviews. Was not disappointed. 
Called on a Sunday night- call was answered right away and I was able to get an appointment the next day. Great start.  I received a call on Monday morning confirming Bo was on the way. Thirteen rekeyed cylinders later and I'm a happy customer.  The locks work smoothly and the keys (master and copies all work perfectly).  Reasonable price. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend and will be using them again.

Had a great time here. The lasagna is very good and the drinks are made well which taste great. Be prepared to stay awhile and enjoy the total experience. They serve traditional menu and family style options.
It was $14.00 round trip but dang it took almost an hour to get picked up outside & loaded. We will see if the return is any better.
Cant think of better way to spend some family time in the Tremont area of Cleveland.  Perfect happy hour with welcoming bar staff.
I was not dazzled by the food.  The place is quaint for an uptown spot.  The food is definitely overpriced. I will not return on my dime, it would have to be someone else's.

My mom and I have been going every other day since they opened almost 2 weeks ago.  We are addicted!!  Love the workout, love the trainers!  Perfect workout for all ages and abilities.  Bust butt and get sore, but it's not a bad sore that lasts long.  I've never liked going to a gym, staring at the machines, wondering what to do and how long??  This is not like that....it's all over within 60 minutes and they tell you what to do.  It's like having a personal trainer.  The only reason it got 4 stars instead of 5 is because they don't have the exact time that works best for me, and they don't offer kid care.

Delicious and very fresh sushi. Generous pieces! They do use a lot of rice; really good all the same. We had the mango and green tea ice cream to finish and both were very good.  The service was efficient - they did forget my tea - but brought it as soon as I reminded them. Get ready for a little weight lifting because the teapot was pretty heavy.

I was completely shocked with this restaurant. When we pulled in the parking lot I didn't even want to go in, glad we did. Extremely clean and quaint, great customer service, now let's get to the food. It was beyond delicious. I couldn't stop eating! I ordered the Arroz con Mariscos and I almost licked the plate. The seafood tasted fresh and not rubbery. I never, ever, ever eat dessert, but I couldn't pass up lucuma ice cream. It seems so simple, but again, I wanted to lick the dish. 

It's a BYOB so we brought a nice bottle of wine with us and they were more than happy to open it. There was a $5 cork fee, which is extremely reasonable. I don't know if this is traditional Peruvian fare, but it's yummy and we'll be back.

I love uptown farmers market! They support local business from sheets with Zen to Vegan food at Whyld Ass organic eatery. There are meat vendor but I highly recommend the Sol cheese and the juice food truck rocks. This farmers market is open Wednesday and Saturday until June then it moves indoors.

It's a nice lunch spot in Uptown Charlotte. Has really good hibatchi at reasonable lunch prices. The sushi however is something to be desired. The prices are kinda high for the portion sizes and and are much smaller in comaparison to places like Sushi 101. Overall its a good spot for lunch to get in and out quickly. The decor is nice and the service is decent.
They are amazing here, they go above and beyond to make sure you and your pet get the care you need.

Interesting ambiance inside and ok sidewalk seating street presence but it was John the outside waiter who makes being there worthwhile. We ordered the mussels and clams in the garlic wine sauce - very well cooked and tasty and paired well with my glass of Chianti. Next the strands and meatballs - light tomato sauce with an interesting flavor, not your Italian Gramma's recipe but it was tasty. Entrees are served with bread and a chilled avocado pesto blend sauce that was tasty as well. Don't bother with the blackberry lemon vodka drink unless you like Koolaid. John did his best to make the drink more palatable by adding limoncello and more vodka but it just made it taste more alcoholic rather than a nice blend of tasty. If this place upped its specialty drinks game and perhaps added veal to the menu it might be a 4 star establishment, but there's something about the place that just doesn't hit the mark. Can't put our fingers on it. I mean, it wasn't bad at all, but it wasn't terrific either. Very sad.

Great location, good view, a bit chilly this time of the year so bring a blanket or longer coat.  The food was good.  We started with the pierogi appetizer (get the additional bacon and sour cream) and then ended with burgers and panini.  Burgers were nicely grilled with extra toppings.  The fries were the best!  A bit spicy with seasoning salt and the fry was a good shape and size with a nice crispy crunch. Can't wait to return at our next Pittsburgh visit in the summer.

Flew from LA to go to this venue for a family wedding. Quick summary: beautiful golf course and banquet hall. Decent but not fantastic food. Service was average. Parking isn't a hassle

I've been to multiple country clubs in LA, but the scenery at this golf club really stands out. Conditions were perfect: grass was well kept, a lake overlooking the sunset mixed with bunkers, hills and a few trees made this course a unique blend of British links golf and Canadian wilderness. The scenery is the highlight of this establishment.

Interior of the banquet hall was modern and beautiful. Bathrooms were clean and had mouthwash and lotion- typical fancy amenities. 

Food was okay. We got a three course meal. Garden salad, steak and salmon, creme brûlée and cake. Salad wasn't anything special, no dressing just some walnuts and strawberries. Steak was a bit overcooked. Salmon was okay but lacked flavor. Best part was the dessert. Creme brûlée was my favorite and I would highly recommend it for anyone who decides to do an event here. They also served an odd red velvet cake which was uneven, some parts were salty and others were sour (I don't know if that was a Canadian thing). 

Service was okay. Everyone was accommodating but they were understaffed. Had to wait a while to get orders in.

Overall, you really pay for the scenery at this place. The food was pretty mediocre but you get to take some awesome pictures
Amazing Scallop Ceviche. Love the interpretation of Paiella. Friendly service. Great experience!

Super yummy noodles! But the seasoning and sauces lacked depth and were a tad heavy.  I got the Shrimp and Corn Curry Noodles, the sauce was good but was super super heavy.  Also got the XO Spicy noodles, I liked how they're were an assortment of veggies in them, but the sauce was lacking flavor.  I do like how you get 5 noodle types to choose from!

I love Wimpy's diner.  I love diners to begin with, but Wimpy's is my fave.  It's nearby, so we go there at least once a week.  Service is friendly, food is good comforting diner food, prices are right.  Everybody should have a neighbourhood place that feels like home.
The food was great and the taste was right at the $ buttttt the line was super long and took us a long time just to get the meat or seafood.

This place was such a great find!!  No wait due to weekday, and we arrived early, around 9am or so.  Even with it not being busy, they put 6 of us at a small table, that was irritating. They did get busy later, but I felt they didn't care much about our comfort since they knew the rush was coming.  Ehh.  Back to the food.  It was really delicious!!  My son's pancakes were SLAMMIN and I had chilaquiles.  Red sauce was different, but still good.  No espresso, but had coffee instead and it was ok (not my style but the waitress said it was good and strong).  We all loved our meals.  Our meal was pricey so heads up!  My son's apple juice was $4!  If you're prepared with the cost, the wait or small table, then you'll be able to better enjoy the service and great food.    Great find in downtown vegas, I'll be back!!

I love this place.  Great food at affordable prices. I only wish they had more seating.

They have a nice, diverse menu.  Ive tried many things here and have been very satisfied with every dish that I have ordered.
Very good burgers.  Excellent service.  Skip the 'organic' coffee -- it's gross.  Sorry I can't tell you what I ordered. I tried accessing the menu, but their web site isn't cooperating.

Edible Arrangements seems to be unaware they are working with food. We have had two bad experiences with no satisfactory resolution from the company. In short, avoid this service and buy flowers. Here's the long version:

Experience #1: I ordered an arrangement for my wife on the morning of her birthday. After placing the delivery order online I called in to ask for an approximate delivery time. They told me they can't provide estimates. So I asked what would happen if my wife wasn't there when they delivered, which was going to be fairly likely if it was before 4:00. They told me it would likely be later so it shouldn't be an issue. When I got home around 5:00 there was nothing there so I called in. They claimed to have tried twice to deliver, even tried neighbors (see next experience) but had to bring the order back to the store. So I had to drive over to the store to pick it up. I asked for a refund of the very high delivery fee but they refused even though I did everything I could to avoid the situation that took place. I went home noticeably unhappy with my "fresh" fruit arrangement.

Experience #2: Despite refusing to use EA again, a family member sent us an arrangement two days ago. Again, they showed up in the middle of the day when no one was home. Then they tried the neighbors who were home this time. Unfortunately, after over 24 hours we still didn't have our arrangement. Maybe the neighbors ate it? Or maybe it's in their fridge still. Who knows, EA certainly doesn't, even though they entrusted these strangers with the delivery, and quality, of their product. We called back in and told them about our still-missing arrangement and they basically told us tough luck, it's our policy to leave it with the neighbors. The policy of a food delivery company is to leave "fresh" food with a stranger? We don't know if they're storing it properly. We barely know these people other than a friendly hello once in a while. And given that almost 24 hours had passed, why do we still want it? We asked EA to refund the sender but they refused. They finally agreed to send a new one but it's hardly a good resolution when we had to argue about it. The sender called the EA head office and was informed that leaving the delivery with neighbors is no longer their policy and hasn't been for a long time, guess this shawnessy location didn't get the memo. It is now 48 hours later and we haven't heard from the neighbors. 

If EA wants to ensure quality and satisfaction, they should allow for some selection around delivery times. Better yet, hire a delivery person for the hours that people are typically at home instead of delivering when people are at work or school. Or accept that the ridiculously high delivery fee should cover for these issues instead of completely ignoring customer complaints.

It is ok, but not really special. I would love it if they had organic lettuce & tomatoes. If they had grass fed no HMO, no hormone no antibiotic high quality beef... It would be a much better experience.  It is ok but could be so much better! The cashier etc. We're all very friendly.

My wife and I moved into a new, semi-custom home with a pool in late November of 1997. Although we were recently retired (i.e., retired at age 50), this was our first pool. We didn't realize that it was akin to adopting and raising a child - been there, done that. My wife and I are both engineers and at first, had no problem with performing the weekly maintenance. After about 5 years, key elements of the pool's waterworks begin to wear out as did our enthusiasm for the "care and feeding" of a big hole full of water in our backyard. This is when we got lucky and discovered Splash Pools and Scott Thomas.
 
Over the years we've engaged Scott and his crew to perform a number of major tasks pertaining to the pool - draining and acid washing, replacing bulbs in underwater lights and maintaining a somewhat complex automated cleaning system. We've never regretted this choice. The work has always been performed in a professional and timely manner at a fair price.
 
Our pool celebrated its 16th birthday last year, and we decided in early summer to replace all of the equipment (electrical panel, pumps, filters, heater, actuator valves, blowers, and control system) with "state of the art" hardware. Elements of our old system were wearing out and selective replacement and repair was proving to be less than cost effective. Also, we wanted to take advantage of sophisticated, Wi-Fi based controls and multi-speed, energy efficient  pumps.  The project took about three weeks and is now complete - we couldn't be happier. If you are considering any mechanical and/or electrical work for your pool, give Splash Pool an opportunity to bid the job. I think you'll be happy with the results.

We recently went to Mac Shack again after visiting in December.  This time the food was much better than our first visit.  I had the Asiago Blue mac and cheese.  I added mushrooms and olives to it.  It was very tasty.  Nice and creamy.  Not a strong blue cheese flavor but just enough.  My mom had rigatoni with meat sauce and the chicken soup.  The soup was really good.  Lots of veggies and pieces of chicken.  A bit spicy.  The rigatoni had a nice sauce.  And plenty for leftovers the next day.

Our dog got suddenly ill and had to be put down the next day. The staff here was amazing, answered all my questions, helped us make a very hard decision and was there with us through the whole thing. Very compassionate and understanding! Highly recommended!

This place has amazing ambience as you get to look out towards the waterfall in the Wynn. They have amazing steaks as well! This is probably one of the most top notch steaks I've ever had. The highlights were:

- Truffled cream corn (delish!!)
- rib eye (medium rare): shared this dish with a friend and it was tender and juicy
- Funnel cakes with strawberries and chocolate, creme fraiche and salted caramel 
- pretzel bread and salted butter

Would definitely come back again. A great place to celebrate a special occasion.
最愛飲茶地方之一！食物新鮮，環境懷舊feel！不過就坐得唔係好舒服，廁所衛生一般，成日都冇抹手紙，一係抹手紙一卷放係洗手盆側邊，而不是在紙巾機度！有待改善！
Quick and friendly! I love the new menu and the Mediterranean breakfast is delicious.

I wish I could give more stars!! Dr. March is so fantastic. I was referred to her by a friend and took my recent adoption rescue dog, Georgia, there to get her rabies vaccine and her heartguard. Dr. March was so fantastic!! I was more aware of the vaccination than Georgia was. I will also be taking my cat to her from now on!! She is now our family vet and her prices for her services are way beyond reasonable!! I am very happy!!

When I arrived I was greeted by a wonderful smile. However when i entered my room there was weird a smell. I inspected the room and realized my room was half cleaned !! I found crumbs on the counters and the floor was not vacuum. The bathroom was old, small and out of date. The mini refrigerator had a very fishy smell. There was loud talking outside my window during the night . I complained to the front desk but the loud talking continued. Overall I was not happy. I would NOT stay at this hotel again.
Best low country food. This place did it right.  Sides were made so well and the meats were insane.  Cornbread sweet as the tea. Loved it.
So good!!! Never disappoints. Thought it would be a boring salad place and was reluctant to go but honestly now I crave it.

WORST SERVICE. I ordered 2 cheese enchiladas combination. I waited around 30 minutes for my food and i understand some thing take longer to cook than others, but i saw people walking in and out the door. I went up to the counter to ask how long it would be and then they proceed to hand me my food. I check it and it turns out they're 2 cheese quesadillas. First of all, I never ordered the quesadillas. Secondly, it doesn't take 30 minutes to even make quesadillas? I begin to tell the girl that this is wrong and she argues with me and says she heard quesadilla, which doesnt add up because my boyfriend was with me and heard me say enchilada clearly. People make mistakes I get it, but she didn't want to fix the problem. I'm willing to pay the difference, but then she starts speaking bad about me in spanish to the chef? I know that I appear caucasian, but I am actually hispanic myself and speak spanish fluently. Then they throw together 2 cold enchiladas in less than a minute and i didn't even get the combo which I asked for in the first place. I left unsatisfied with nasty food. Never coming back again. Ever since they changed owners this place has gone down hill.
Excellent service and a developed food menu! Everything a coffee and tea spot should have, with an elegant, windowy, and outdoorsy atmosphere
This place is awesome! The waffle with bacon in it is so inventive and tastes amazing. I will forever stop for breakfast when near here. Great Job!

This place is out of this world! I have been there 3 times and have never been dissatisfied. Also, I never leave hungry. The variety and options leaves you wondering what you're going to devour next. I stuff burgers at home with go at cheese and some basil but it can never compare to their burgers! Will be coming back more often.
They have lots of organic options and gluten free at reasonable prices. Unlike Organic Roots, they're consistent in what they carry and do not tend to run out of our favorite brands!
I always have a great massage and everyone here is so polite. Highly recommend this place to anyone looking to relax!

I had an ex-girlfriend going to school at U of I who used to always talk about this place, but I never got a chance to go. But I went there with my girlfriend (now wife) around October/November of 2007. 

First, the wait staff: These people are always great to deal with. They're nice and friendly and always seem so upbeat. Makes the whole dining experience that much better. 

The drinks: I'm a Jameson fan, so there's really not much you can mess up on there, but my wife seems to love the wine so I'll take her word for it. Haven't tried anytihng else though.

The food: One word, GREAT. Obviously, being an italian restaurant, I expected the food to be bland, but oh my god, was it good! Its got flavor and they'll go out of their way to change the dishes to your tastes (in my case, SPICY). 

Great place overall, but what makes it so good is the wait staff. I can't tell you how important this small thing is for me because it can seriously make or break a lot of restaurants. 

I believe there is a Biaggi's in Naperville also, although I haven't tried them out yet so I really can't say much, but one day (I mean hell, it is a lot closer than Champaign!).

Their food is out-of-this-world good, full stop, and plentiful too. I can't think of anywhere else in Toronto I've eaten this fabulously at this price point, other than the doubles at Caribbean Roti Palace. We feasted on the chicken adobo, which was four pieces of pure heaven. I could have eaten fourteen. The Shanghai lumpia (6) were delicious, came with a great vinegary dipping sauce, and were very generously portioned for a $6 appetizer. The pancit came with a precious little yellow-green calamansi lime sliced in half to squeeze on top. We got more chicken on top, which melted in my mouth a lot like the adobo had. The noodles and toppings were a bit fancier than what I've made at home, tossed with artful sprigs of greens and long strips of lightly charred cabbage. It had all the crunch, rich oiliness, and tang that you hope for in great pancit. With tax and tip we paid $20 each for a lot of food. 

Even the little things were great - a bowl of garlic rice we tacked on as a side dish was so, so garlicky in the best way, and quite large. 

I am already strategizing excuses to come up to St. Clair to eat here repeatedly. Oh, and their space is super cute, spacious, airy, bright and soothing. They do orders at a counter and deliver to the table. Seating for 16 at four tables and for 8 more at counters.

They take a while to get the food out (made fresh every time) but it's worth the wait. Order the meat patties, super delicious. A real gem off Indian school and 7th street.


Every time we order it takes an hour plus to get our food. I just ordered 2 entrees and it took over an hour and a half. Seemed like they were just hanging out. Not going back.

Though I only had two appetizers, this place really hit the spot!
 Came here after searchin for a place to grab a lite bite to eat. And needless to say, it was right on! 
 The bartender was quick to rush me my tab after ordering my drink, until I asked if I could eat at the bar. She quickly obliged. 
 I asked her how the pate was and she said most like the chicken since it has a smoother consistency, and the meat was a little too chunky for most. 
 Meat pate it is! Good. Full of flavor. Nice texture. Not really like a true pate though. Still enjoyable. Came with cornichons, cocktail onions, grain mustard n toasted bread. 
 The frisee and bacon salad with fried egg was delish! The egg was cooked perfectly with a nice runny yolk! 
 The overall menu looks impressive, which I look forward to conquering in the future. And the prices are quite reasonable. 
 Nice wine list.

One of the worst meals we've had in Las Vegas in 6 years living here. Onion soup was very bland. Fries tasted like they were from frozen. The shepherds pie was an extremely salty soup with potatoes on top that tasted and felt like instant. And all this was after waiting nearly 45 mins for the food to arrive (after watching two other tables seated after us be served). Would never recommend it to anyone - and am very disappointed with Mr. Ramsey for putting his name on the place.

Looking for something to grill, we checked out 3 of the highest Yelp rated markets in Kensington  and decided on Hooked for 3 reasons: no fishy odor, fresh looking fish, and friendliness of staff. Being from the States (West Coast specifically), we're not accustomed to seeing Pickerel or Sea Bream looking back at us from the case. After inquiring about both, we decided to grill them up. The Pickerel (filet) was white, flakey, and mild - delish! The Bream (whole fish) was more robust, but equally delish! Spot on recommendations by the staff at Hooked!

I'll be back...

Made an appointment for a couple hours after I called. Nail techs were very sweet and accommodating. Got my eyebrows and lip wax, gel manicure and pedicure for $75 (after the 20% off pedicure). I would come back.

This place is amazing, Wisconsin at its best! If you want delicious not overly greasy cheese curds please come here ! The beer is place has a great Wisconsin burger and steak sandwich ! Two thumbs up along the way around !

I'm not sure why this place is called the oyster bar because the oysters are definitely not the highlight at this restaurant. They serve one type, which were bland and just ok.  My advice ... Skip the oysters and save your appetite for the soups.  Because their soups are SO SO good! I understand why people will wait -sometimes up to 3 hours - for their favorite dish.  

I had the combo pan roast, which consisted of lots of crab meat, shrimp, and large chunks of lobster. The soup base was one of the best tomato bisque soups I've had. It's served with a scoop of rice and sourdough bread.  I had a spicy level 5 which was perfect. 

I tasted the gumbo, which hubby ordered.  Different flavor profile from mine, but packed with a lot of strong flavors. He ate it all up and said he would order it again.

My friend had the  bouillabaisse, which I loved, except she ordered a spicy level 8 which I couldn't handle. She even regretted it too, saying the temperature heat and spicy heat was more than she is typically use to.

My advice for this place: (1) come at least 2 hours before prime lunch or dinner times start. Your wait might only be an hour - an hour and one half (I arrived at10:30am, and was seated at 11:45am); (2) try not to come with a large group (4-5 max) because with only a few seats at the bar, it will take a while for a large group to be seated; (3) be careful not to order your soups with more than a level 5 spice (they use red cracked pepper and habeneros as their spices), and (4) don't waste your time or money on their oysters.

Overall great food and service. I'll be back next time I'm in Vegas!
Fantastic place! Can't hate anything about it! But get there before the early bird because the line is killer for this place; and for good reason.

I guess seafood at Seafood City was fine; but I tried their cross-cut ribs and ended up embarassing myself to friends. I've been cooking Korean BBQ all my life but the ones I got from Seafood City were very  tough meat - honestly, you couldn't chew them and I was afraid that someone would choke on them so I put them away.

Greetings,
  I have been working on my dream pool project now for the last 2 years and have to say where other pool builders would literally walk away with no further communication, Tribal Waters took on the challenge and has been exceptional in many ways.
I have learned a great deal about the Pool process -- and perhaps many take it the wrong way as it is not "cookie cutter"  or even as traditional as building a house -- there is a great deal of decisions.   Unless these are really discussed and confimed, it can lead to dis-satisfaction.  Over the years, I have seen the various trades/sub crafts move in/out of Tribal, so that is something that is central to all business processes -- including home building, where you have work that needs to be done by a given specialist -- and different levels of abilities.  

And unlike other contractors -- they have been fantastic to correct any/all problems with equipment or issues that arise.  This is something that many other trades, simply do not do.

 Tribal Waters focuses on custom jobs and remodels -- they have been wonderful at bringing my ultimate dream to light -- It is the World's FIRST EVER SOLAR POWERED SURF PARK.

  Yes, literally, I surf in my backyard, and with the updates in the coming months, I will be able to handle up to 225 lbs per person.  Enclosed are some pictures - AND  Google the following:
  "  Surfing Middle Desert"   [the first version done 2 years ago]
 or feel free to ask more questions of me, directly. 

 Sure, it might be cheaper to fly/Drive to San Diego, but now, with the swipe of my fingers on my smartphone, I can surf in my backyard, with a nearly zero electric bill, year round, and share this experience with my clients and friends.  The pool itself looks beautiful with numerous fountains and waterfalls, even at night, rivaling Las Vegas!  

Ultimately-- instead of a dirt backyard or simple kidney pool, Tribal Waters has enabled me to come home to a resort experience that rivals the best destinations in the world.

Will update more when I finish the project this year!

Easy to get to, right off the 215 (across the fwy from GVR) Go hungry. Some portions are large (dont be a goofball, ask for a take-a-way) I have found the whisky apple chicken, country fried steak and rib-eye to be tasty. Decor is rustic and comfortable. Good happy hours specials.

I had a regular pedi from Wendy, a month later my toes still look amazing! I haven't ever had a non- gel last this long! I also get ingrown toes nails and she used a special file that has continued to keep me pain free, thank you Wendy!

DO NOT, I repeat, DO NOT ever go to any Western Dental office for orthodontia or dental treatment.  I had braces put on in like 2012 or so, and I had dental coverage with  $5,000.00 of orthodontia coverage for which I paid extra, through work.  I signed a contract that showed what my portion of the bill would be, and what my insurance coverage would pay.  I paid my portion of the bill every month, using either my debit card or my healthcare spending account.  Midway through the process, I asked the billing office why it showed my insurance hadn't paid anything, and was told they paid at the end of each year, and then paid the final amount, at the end of treatment or, at the end of the second year.  Mid treatment, my dental provider changed, when we signed up for benefits each year through my employer.  The coverage, however, did not change, and there was no lapse in coverage.  I, then, changed jobs, and provided my new information to the office.  That has now been over two years ago.  When I was last in the office, in July 2015, I purchase a retainer, paid $98 for it, and got the bill. The bill still showed that I owed about $200 for my end of the balance, and that the insurance company, after all this time, still hadn't paid anything towards their part of the bill.  I spoke with somebody again, after discussing this with them on multiple occasions, and explained that no payment had been paid.  I called my ex-employer and found out that nobody had ever billed the insurance company for the orthodontia services.  When I asked about it, the dental office told me that I was marked as being "self pay."  If that was the case, why does the bill show a portion still due from my insurance company, and why do I have a contract showing what my portion of the bill would be, and  also showing insurance responsibility?  I tried to explain this to them.  They didn't quite get it.  When I finally got ahold of somebody who understood what I was saying, they tried to bill my insurance company again, almost 16 months after the fact.  The insurance company will pay claims submitted up to a year late, so they denied the claim.  I've explained this to Western Dental multiple times... And explained that they did not submit the claim in a timely manner, and that, because of their failure to do so, they didn't get paid.  After discussing this with them several times, over and over again, and spending hours and hours on the phone with them, they said they would look into it, and call me back.  I never heard a thing back from them since July of last year.  No billing statement.  No calls.  Nothing.  I assumed that, after a year, they'd caught their mistake, and that they'd simply written it off.  Nope.  I called to get a receipt for the retainer I'd bought back in July of last year,  and found out my account had been sent to collections for the entire amount my insurance never paid.  To top it off, the office, when it submitted the bill some 16 months late, billed the insurance for the total cost of the bill which was over $5,500.00.  They not only billed late, but they over-billed as well.  Now, I'm sitting here with an account in collections, and Western Dental won't even discuss it with me.  The collection company wanted to offer me a settlement, allowing me to pay a smaller amount, but I told them they could take me to court.  I confirmed, again, that I was covered, in every way, with the insurance company, and that the claim was submitted 16 or more months after the date of service.  I'm getting a lawyer.

The Starbucks has the friendliest barista's in town! They're always smiling, always wishing you a good day and always seem happy. I wish The place was a little bit bigger as it does get packed at times.

I have to agree with people on the bad service there!
I have had brunch there once and the sandwich I had was good, but options are small and portions, too. Especially for a brunch place. 

Today I went there, to inquire something about the menue and the waiter was so unfriendly! Unbelievable. Why do those people work in service? I dont understand. 
Going to a restaurant should be a pleasent experience, but not with bad service like in the federal.

If you like tiny overpriced portions, unfriendly waiters and unnecessary waiting hours - thats the place for you!

Best Lasagna I have ever tasted, it melted in my mouth.  It was a special but I hope they put on the menu, it was heavenly!!  An observation:  bar area was cluttered with boxes, maybe they should be stored somewhere else.  Staff was excellent.
Great place to go with friends late at night, I had a burger which was okay except it was very overcooked and the edges were burnt. The home fries were amazing though!
The Taco Bell is the foods okay and it is not that good like other fast food restaurant, but it is alright stop by try something different from other fast food places.

This was the place to stop by after that late or tweener flight into vegas.  It was nice to go somewhere casual after getting in, have a bowl of noodles.  Yes.... it was a bit expensive, but for "strip" eating, its about par.... par meaning about 40% high, but with good service to match.

I am very specific about my massage. I like a deep tissue and a firm massage. Peter at Sunshine relaxation has given me the best massage that i've been looking forward from a long dreading work week. He is very strong, very experienced, and very professional. My first time going to this place. The place is very clean and very relaxing. Mynga the manager there was helpful and friendly. This is my go to massage from now on. I left with a happy face and I will definitely come back here again. Thank you Peter and Sunshine Relaxation.

Meh it was ok street tacos are not street tacos now my co worker ordered tacos Jesus and those looked good and looked like street tacos, someone needs to send cooks to East LA to see what street tacos look and taste like now the tamale was ok but you can tell they did an southwest mex twist in it as well, please stop messing with legit Mexican food just make it the way it should be.

If you are looking for a casual spot in Scottsdale for a pint of beer or a glass of wine, this might be a good spot to try. A nice selection of 64 craft beers and fair wine list. The food menu is limited to items, like paninis and pizza, that can be cooked in a food fire oven. I had the steak and cheese panini and it was pretty good. My partner had the Italian panini (with pepperoni and sausage) and he enjoyed it. The big downfall here, though, is the slow and inattentive service. If you want to place your order or get another beer, water or your check, you'll need to track your server down. Just too relaxed in this regard.

The was a great meal to end a great family trip. It was such a delight to get a decent meal after being confined to the hotel returants (or lack there of) during my sister's AAU Basketball Tourney. 

The place was nice, a little too romantic for a family meal though, and the service/food was great. We all enjoed our meals and tasted one another's. I am sure this will be a spot to always visit when we return to Sin City!!!

Never had a bad experience and food has always been fresh. Luckily,  they arent like other Taco Hells that leave you with explosive . 

I will state that tonight they forgot my drink so I bumped down the 5 stars to 4.

I've used these guys 3 times now for electrical issues in my old home and new home and each time they are courteous, professional and accommodating. On top of that they have gone the extra mile and advised me on other issues that aren't related to why I hired them. That is great service! I can confidently say that if you decide to use them you will not regret that decision.

Desoto Market has an awesome atmosphere and provides a good space for grabbing a drink with friends. If one wants a kombucha and another a beer, the options are there! Cool concept and it has always been a chill place to hang.

I don't love the food here though. For me (and I will admit I'm cheap), the price point nfortunately doesn't match the flavor.

I've only been here once on a weeknight but the ambiance was very cozy and the drinks were pretty good. I had a Mint Julep and the Dark and Stormy and both were made well. The bill wasn't too high which is also always a nice thing. 

In the summer there is a terrace outside and there's also a second floor (which was closed on the weeknight). Nice music inside as well. I'll be back for sure.
The food was incredible and so is the service. If you have not tried this restaurant yet, you definitely should. The smoked salmon starter was one of the best dishes I have had in a long time.

I picked aspen because they had night and weekend hours.. What a mistake that was... They gave me one price.. Paid in full that day $1500 dollars.. Only you get a surprise bill in the mail a few weeks later for another $500.00 . they also gave me a bag to take home after I was put out.... The bag had a electric toothbrush in it and I was charged $160.00 for that without my permission...... Tooth brush broke after 6 months...I will never go to any aspen dental ever again.. I would rather have no teeth then to return to them

Excellent service, the lobster shrimp roll and the calamari were tasty starters .
 The salmon dish, the fish and chips and the short rib dinners were all excellent.
The desserts were the bomb, loved the potted chocolate trifle and the stickey toffee pudding.
Drinks were pretty decent too.
The music is loud but creates a nice energy.

LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!!   Finally, a business that actually gets the concept of FANTASTIC CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!!    Pain free laser hair removal!!!!   awesome!
The SPA810 staff could not have been nicer from the second I walked in the door to the professional and fabulous skin therapists.   Gorgeous, relaxing decor.  The girl at the front  who likes EXACTLY like Kelly Ripa, was so sweet and kind to me, she really made me feel welcome and answered all of my questions.
I had a custom facial too, and felt as though I was at a five star resort-  Katelyn treated me and my skin like a I was a rock star!!!!!!!!  She explained all the products she used and how they will help my skin in the future and in in between my treatments.

Prices are so affordable-   it really is affordable luxury!!!   Spa810 told me about their  membership club, I can go every month for my treatment  AND I got six discount coupons for my friends and family to come get treatments!  I love being a member  at this spa and can not wait to go back!!!  

SPA810 is onto to something, this place is great! !!!!!!!!!

OKAy so I came here totally excited and it was just...okay.  I do love the multi color m&ms cuz that means I can piss off my bff and get all variations of PINK m&ms.  (she ABHORS pink...sucker) and I do love the lil m&m trinkets here and there.  The elevator even has M&ms drawn everywhere!  The cutest thing I found were m&ms in a crayon wrapper in ur fav colors.  It's really cute so I bought a purple one for my little pink hater.

The owner called us at 1:00 the day of our move (which was supposed to be anywhere from 12:00-4:00) stated that they would not be able to make it and were booked until Monday. While the guy over the phone was really nice they left us out to dry, needing to move, and no other options. We ended up finding another company that can actually show-up and they were able to help. 

While I understand that they were in a situation without having enough drivers, a company that could just leave you out to dry like that is not one that I would put my trust in.

Impressive menu, nice concept but some disappointment. I got the spinach veggie wrap which I envisioned being a yummy melty wrap with warm cooked veggies as was hinted in the menu saying it came in a toasted organic wheat wrap. However the insides were all raw. I expected cooked spinach & mushrooms.   Hubby got the Reuben lighter portion. The sour kraut to meat ratio was ridiculous and he has to remove the excess kraut. The remaining meat was still filling. 

On the plus side we enjoyed the free soft serve and will probably still be back since it's a cheaper and quicker alternative to standard sit down restaurants. Maybe something else on the menu will impress us.

Having been a former employee here I must say that the food is of the upmost quality. The customer service aspect is always great and the maintenance of the facility is usually impeccable. Thank you Sababa for my time here. I'll be coming back for some of that shawarma when I go back to Vegas. Shoutout to Juanita who, without her, the restaurant would sink faster then the Titanic.
this place is close to work so i ordered pizza for work and a salad for me.  the pizza is fine and the salad just ok.  they deliver so thats a plus.  price is reasonable.

I was worried my phone would not be saved after I accidentally threw my water bottle in my bag while my phone was in there. My iPhone 6 didn't turn on for three days! I finally took it to CPR South Mountain which is conveniently 5 minutes from my house. I didn't want to go to the mall in fear I would get higher pricing. I'm glad I went to CPR-SM. I explained my tragic story to Joey. He helped me right away and gave me all the details for the repair. He was able to work on my phone assuring me he'd be able to fix it since bottled water didn't have that many minerals and salts that could damage the phone. Sure enough the next day I got my phone and works 100%! Thanks Joey!
Okay so this place is great! I am so happy I found this dentist the staff is very nice and polite and their prices are reasonable . I will be back for my check up

Fantastic food. It's really hard to find high quality family owned Chinese food and this place has it. I called ahead for takeout and they had it ready in 15 mins during dinner rush. It all tasted great. 

To the 1 star reviewers below - a restaurant gets busy when lots of people like it. If your obese body can't wait 10 minutes to ingest more calories then maybe try the Taco Bell drive thru next time.

My girlfriend and I decided to come here for lunch on her birthday and we were not disappointed. We arrived at the Cromwell and were greeted at Valet by the nicest Valets I have ever experienced in Vegas. We made our way upstairs to the hostess station at the restaurant and were told our table would be ready in a couple of minutes. To pass the time we went into the photo booth and took some photos to remember the day by. Just as we were done in the photo booth, our table was ready. The restaurant itself is large and very open. It is beautifully decorated with huge movie posters of movies that Dino De Laurentiis produced in his amazing career. Next time we go however we will try to get a seat by the window as it is an amazing view. But enough of the stuff no one cares about, lets get to the food. 

We had the wood roasted mushrooms, the baby sweet peppers, the sweet ricotta pizza, and the muffuletta. We loved every single one of them. Basically this was one of the best overall meals I have had in a restaurant in a very long time. 

Also the service was great and Giada herself was in the restaurant going to some tables and talking to them. Although we didn't get to meet her we love that she is there talking to her fans.

I came from out of state for vacation and i really needed my nails done for New Years. The guy that did our nails was very nice however my cousin and i were not very pleased with the work. He started my cousins nails while i waited. There was a girl doing a pedicure on another client so i just sat there. When the girl was done she just sat there reading a magazine while i was still waiting. More people came in after us and they all got attended first.

My cousin got short white tip full set and they left the corner edges of the nails super sharp. You could also see so many tiny white bubbles on her nail beds. They charged her $45.

As of me i asked for almond full set. My nails came sooo thick, bumpy and poorly shaped. The nail polish job was horrible! My nails were longer and took more time and was charged $5 less then my cousin. 
I would not recommend this place.

UPDATE:
Its only been a week and i have lifting because he did my nails over my cuticles.

I tried to visit.  The restaurant is closed on Mondays.  Totally ok with me.   As I was searching on my mobile phone for an alternative destination, I was verbally abused by the "Parking Lot Manager". I tried to explain, but he said he was going to call the police if I didn't leave the parking lot.    Amazingly awful experience.  (Parking lot was nearly empty!  I wasn't in anyone's way! I'm a neighbor! )

Floyd Lamb State Park is the perfect place to hang out, enjoy a good walk/run, and chill with the ducks.  And if you're lucky, you may even spot a few peacocks and bunny rabbits too.  People also fish or at least, try to fish here.  Just watch your step when you're at the park or on any of the trails.  Be cautious of loose rock and poop that can easily become trip hazards.  

I've been to Floyd Lamb State Park a handful of times.  The park is huge and the trails are long.  The trails are great for running or walking.  If you happen to spot me here, I warn you don't follow me because I tend to get lost.  It cost $6 to park inside or free if you decide to park at one of the side streets and walk.

I'm a pretty big fan of Atomic. The bartenders know what's up. The menu is pretty straight forward, nothing fancy. They have a good selection of craft beer on tap featuring several local brews and they mix up a decent cocktail too. The prices are reasonable, not cheap but not overly expensive either. There is no happy hour and they really don't need one to draw people in. They have a pretty good following as is, mostly locals, mostly laid-back. I've never seen it get too rowdy even when the place was packed. The patio is a nice, spacious option, especially if it's smoky inside. If you hangout long enough there will eventually be a bum or two on the sidewalk. No big deal, they just add to the charm of this place. And, yes, it is quite charming.

Most of the time I'm a little hesitant having sushi at a buffet.  Much less a Chinese buffet lol.  I had some sushi here anyway and everything seemed fine.  No one got sick so that's always a bonus.  And they have a big sushi section. 

They also have a lot of crab legs but I didn't get any of that.  I got a lot of their dim sum/dumplings, chicken, and a few other things.

I liked that they had some ube rolls.  I'm not sure what it's called but it's a purple bun.  That was yummy.  

I would come back!

This place was great! Huge portions and very high-quality food! The only problem is, they have no list of sides. Waiter got a little snarky when we asked what our choices were. For such a nice establishment, they really need to list the side choices. You should go! It's worth every penny!

Totally redid their menu and now the prices really are outrageous. Decent sushi that used to be worth it during happy hour until they raised their prices. I tried using a coupon the last time I went and the waitress overcharged me by $18 saying it was just how the computer system worked with the coupons. She took 10 minutes to "fix" it, and still overcharged me by $14 and some change. Not impressed. If the coupons aren't going to work with your system, then don't send them out.

I tried Empowering Punch for a month with my neighbor and a Groupon. It was nice to try something different. Although very intimidated at first, the staff are very gracious to help you feel at ease. What I appreciated most was that the instructors have an excellent gauge of each person's ability, and a great knack for meeting you where you are and challenging you just enough. During the boxing classes, everyone is divided into rotating groups. While you are in the ring, the instructor prompts you to throw certain punches by number. That's where the expertise comes in with challenging each person at his/her level. All of the classes are an amazing workout. I really liked the Kettlebells class. I think the Bosu Step was a bit beyond me; that one was really hard. It is a little weird when the old men Mall walkers occasionally stop to gawk. But, if you ignore that, it's not a big deal. The only down side that I experienced, beyond this type of exercise just not being my 'cup of tea', was the really stinky gloves. Each person sprays Lysol into the gloves after class, but they still leave your hands ultra-stencho pretty much for the remainder of the day. I would recommend buying your own gloves. The monthly cost was also a bit prohibitive for me, although not completely outrageous.

This place is so cute!! I absolutely love it~ 

They have a variety of coffees, teas, & juices! I ordered the macha latte & my friend ordered the mocha latte. Both were delicious. We also ordered the tiramisu. So good!! 

It's located in a shopping complex so there's tons of parking. There's seating both indoor and outdoor. The staff is friendly and love the decor!

What a fantastic Cheeseburger Joint!!

You'd never expect to walk into a pink neon-lit 50's diner from the outside.  This restaurant is part of a new little center wtih a "lodge" theme - river rocks, the whole deal.  But once inside the door, you're back at the malt shop of your parent's teens.

The hostess sat us quickly on a Saturday afternoon and briefly explained the menu to us.  Burgers, fries, rings, salads and shakes - the menu isn't complex, but it's loaded with choices.  40-something flavors to mix and create your favorite combination of shake.  (I can't recommend the Chocolate Peanut Butter Banana highly enough!)  The burgers are straightforward, just choose the size (quarter through full pound!) and choose your cheese and toppings.

The french fries and onion rings are absolutley amazing.  Fresh made right there, never frozen.  We ordered a full size "half and half" (fries and rings) and it was too much for the three of us.  The optional dipping suaces were really tasty too - we got cheese, habenaro jelly and creamy jalepeno.  (The spicy sounding ones were not as hot as you'd expect - just super yummy.)

They do to-go orders, and you can place your order over the internet.  Personally, I think this place is best suited for pulling up a chair and enjoying a fresh-made, juicy burger and a tall, creamy malt.  (I do mean juicy on the burgers - the rolls of paper towels on the table got used a lot by my brother and husband.)  Cheeburger Cheeburger will be our new favorite burger joint - a wonderful (and much cheaper) replacement for Burger Bar.  No, it's not as FAB-U-LOUS as Burger Bar (at Mandalay Place) but at half the cost, I'll happliy lose the opportunity for foie gras on my burger.

One note on the wait for your meal: the menu asks for patience as they make everything to order - so expect to wait about 15 minutes.  Honestly, between our milkshakes and the trivia cards on the table, the time went quickly.  And don't be afriad to be adventurous with your milkshake.  My brother's Reese's Pieces shake was a bit bland, so they happily added peanut butter and re-blended it when he asked.  Great service!!

We're looking forward to going back and trying new burger and shake combos!  (and OMG, more of those onion rings!)

I want to highly recommend Rhonda Forsberg for the family law work that she recently completed for my family. She is extremely profession, knowledgeable and explains everything to you in easy to understand language.  Rhonda works hard for you and gets the job done to your satisfaction. Las Vegas and Henderson people looking for an outstanding family law attorney should look no further. Great job!
Hands down the best second hand kids store I've had the pleasure of coming across. I'm pretty picky so I think says enough about the quality and selection that they take in.

I have a large window with the frame separating from the glass and tried hiring handymen to repair, but they did not want to touch it.  Luckily I found Eddie and son to help me out with short notice.  They were one of the few companies open on Saturday and I'm glad I went with them.  They handled the problem like pros and at a very reasonable price.  Eddie's son even cleaned the glass inside and out for me.  Great guys, don't hesitate to hire Eddie, he's a licensed glazier!

lovely kimchi ramen nice and spicy i think people are being too severe rating this place! i myself is a ramen fan and ramen comes from different regions in Japan this is why some places have a specific taste so it is a very personal taste and there isnt the best ramen place they are all different. this place is a bit fusion since kimchi is korean but they excelled at the presentation and taste of it bravo.

Quite a fine establishment!
I liked this place for many reasons, 
but right off the bat, 
I'll tell you why they lost one star for me.
It's a little pricey.
Just a tad.
Not enough to turn me away though.
The store itself is nice looking, 
with a wood cabin, sort of rustic feel.
Pick your poison, there's quite a selection for everyone.
I was here for beer and was pleased
with the variety I had to choose from.
I really liked that you could build your own 6 packs here.
I like to experiment with new beer,
so this is something fun for me, 
because you could grab a few bottles of something new
without having to buy a whole 6 or 12 pack of a new beer you might not like.
I'm not much of a wino, 
but if I was, I'm sure I'd be all over this place.
The guy that was working was really nice.
Good customer service goes a long way for me.

We walked out of our way for this place because of the great reviews. It's been a while since I was so disappointed. 

We were greeted by a very nice gentleman who took our order. He suggested the chicken for my wife, as it is made fresh and not from a can, like the tuna. I got the ham cheese and spinach crepe. Both could be summed up in one word: bland. So bland that neither of us wanted to waste the calories on it. We ate a polite amount, asked for a box, and gave the box to a homeless person. 

I hate to be harsh, mostly because the server was very nice, which is why I'll give it two stars. But I honestly can't understand why this place is so highly rated. Maybe the sweet crepes are better?

We just stopped  in this Denny's to have breakfast ... We were not seated for a couple minutes ..... Once seated we noticed there was only one waitress working ... The manager was walking around not helping her  ....No one took our drink order for almost 5 minutes .. A lady walks in sits down and the waitress took her drink order neither her nor the manager still would even acknowledge us .. This has got to be the worst service I have ever seen .. We will never visit this location ever again !!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Poolside breakfast at The Bellagio in Las Vegas is like a fantasy come true!
*
The fresh fruit served with our breakfast tastes like it came directly from the farm  It's the perfection you see & taste in the little details that make you trust in all the details you can't see.
*
The Bellagio is all about putting passion into the guest experience. Their attention to detail is beautifully obvious!
*
You can rent private cabanas that included poolside service

Happy hour is everyday from 3-6.  Drink and food specials. Food specials were $6.00 for Happy hour.  We had the chips and guacamole for $6.00 for HH.  It was good but don't think it would be worth more than that.  I had the pizza for $6.00 on HH special and it was good, pepperoni, jalapeno and cheese.   My friend had the burger and it looked amazing. Next time I would order the burger.  Service was great.

I've been living at this building for almost 4 years now, and after aspen square management took over about a year ago, the building is longer a suitable place to live.  This company lacks the simple understanding that poor customer service = loss of customers.  I would not recommend this building to anyone until a new management is in place.
Great lunch and dinner! The lunch menu has great prices and comes with soup. My favorite dinner dish is the chicken with green beans. Portion is large and delicious!

It's been one month and we are yet to receive all of our items!  Jeff came through in a pinch to accommodate our time schuedule, Robert and his crew were efficient & courteous BUT... Isn't the point of a move to get ALL of your items from point A to point B ????  We paid top dollar roughly 7500$ and are yet to get our items which are waylaid in Idaho . I'm extremely disappointed to not have this problem ironed out and each time I call, either Ron or someone else gives us the run around ... I have been extremely patient and not having our items has been a great inconvienance .
Great bbq, brisket, and chicken wings, but the sides were underwhelming.

Walgreens is usually the place you go when nothing else is open (Hello Christmas day.), but this location closes too early for any late night grabs. Their items are over-priced unless you catch a sale.  I like their seasonal sales.  You can find some really cute things.  I found some awesome Nightmare Before Christmas knick knacks, like a snow globe, for a fairly good price. 

I use Walgreens for my all of my printed photo needs.  Upload photos at home via computer or iPhone app and they're always ready on time, as promised in the store.  

I've never had any issues with this store.  (Knock on wood.)

FYI - They sell reduced-priced bus passes for the youngsters, just ask an employee.

The service is horrible, other than spitting in your food it can't get worse. I went in with my wife on a weeknight and we sat at the bar, and sat and sat and sat. The bartender seemed preoccupied with some buddies. There were four or five waitresses standing around doing nothing, after almost ten minutes I asked one of them if she could get us menus and water, she did. This seemed to awaken some sort of primal response in the barman who suddenly realized he had a job to do. We asked some questions about the beers he literally threw a menu at us and said "you can read can't you?" OK everyone has an off day so we ordered some appetizers and a flight. Surprisingly the food came before the beer! (Remember we were seated AT THE BAR). The place was nearly empty so again I got an idle waitresses to refill our waters which again awakened the barman who wordlessly shoved our appetizers aside and very rudely put our flight down and walked away. I called him back and asked him to explain the beer. He couldn't be bothered pointed to the menu and walked away. We were done. I left a twenty on the bar and walked out food uneaten and beer untouched. Interestingly not one staff person said a word to us.

So I'm a sucker for breweries. I went back, this time with my son, mid day on a Saturday again at the bar, different barman, no crowd, same ten minute wait for someone to catch my eye, this time we didn't bother to order. We just left. Mike's down the street is way too good to put up with this place.

Don't try calling your order in, I live 10 minutes away from Burrito Express, they put me on hold, when I got to Burrito Express, I was still on hold, no line, young kid working, no personality, the girl that's supposed to be the manager is rude and obnoxious! Wait time for the food is ridiculous and you get your food cold! If I could give it zero star I would.
