When this place first opened up, it was amazing, great food, great customer service and all around a great place! Now, it's just like another burrito pace, dirty, scummy and not worth the time. And a 25 minute wait time for food!

waiting is 1-2 hours, but you know what, totally worth it! Love the combo pan roast the most, very flavorful, lots of seafood, and the rice to mix with it was properly cooked. Linguine with clam was good but not outstanding. will go back to again for the pan roast even have to stand in line for another 1 hour or longer
This is the best Asian food we ever had. The portions are so generous and delicious. We will be back since there are so many more entrees we want to try. Service was very friendly and fast.

I like how this little shop is a bit rough around the edges. Like others have mentioned, it's tiny and only takes cash. It was super busy and our order took a good 25 minutes for the portobello mushroom burger and the double up ( two patties). 
The ladies who took our order were very friendly. The owner was being a nicer version of the soup nazi, telling people to take their food and "be gone", or would wonder aloud why they were back already, when they were just served their order 5 min ago. 
None the less, it adds to their down home charm. 
While my mushroom burger was on the small side for $11, it was nice to have a different veggie burger option than the standard soy/ oats and bean type. 
My bf's double burger more than filled him up. I enjoy the soft, homemade buns. Being white, they were not doughy and easy to bite through along with the burger. 
The fries were cooked fresh to order and are done shoestring style. It could have had a bit more Parm and aioli on it, but over all I liked the way they serve theirs on the crispy side.

This place is a restaurant serving alcohol in the guise of a bar serving food.  
The menu extends beyond the normal burgers and fried stuff to include salmon and several other less common/healthier alternatives.
My wife got a Gyro with fries, and I got a steak salad.  I was surprised at the generous number of slices of gyro meat that were in her gyro and the fries were fresh cut and tasted as though they were fried in peanut oil.
Exceptional for a bar....er.... restaurant!  
The steak on my enormous salad was PERFECTLY  done, something that half the steak houses out there seem unable to execute.  
The salad greens were iceberg, but not from a "Bag-o-lettuce", with a generous amount of cucumber and tomato along with a fair amount of finely shredded colby cheese.  
They brew their iced tea, but had not yet done so for the day, so sodas around.
Service was spot on!
The waitress could walk by our booth at full speed, grab an empty cup without slowing one iota, and have it back filled in under 30 seconds!  
And the empties never sat for long!  
Even the water glasses which seem to become invisible to most waitstaff once they hit the table!
Where's my cloning machine when I need one?
Although we didn't try them, they have  a " one from column a one from column b" luncheon combo selection with a nice variety in both columns for $6.99, guaranteed ready in 15 minutes on weekdays for the work-a-day crew.  
Beats the begeesus out of
any place sporting a drive-thru window for value, and one gets table service thrown in as well! 
There are several locations..probably one near you....try 'em!
Wednesdays are $3.00 martini nights for the ladies.
Too bad Halloween falls on Friday as a little trans-gender dressing might otherwise be on the table!

Get ready to wait. I would bring a book or movie to watch.   You probably have time to watch the Lord of the Rings trilogy while waiting behind two people.  Next time I will wait for my doctors office to open Monday. Last time going to fast-med.

If you have any other choice, do NOT use this company and that lady, they will lie on the paper and I end up lost my case, they stated on the court paper that they did serve the paper to my ex and even said they talked to her, but my ex had 7x24 camera and it did show they even showed up on that day/time on theri paper, in order to collect the money, they will LIE!!!!

Had the chili burrito and my boyfriend had the ultimate burrito. Yum!  The chili burrito has fries and chili sauce making it the best "chili" I've had since switching to vegan. I wish I had gotten the salad, next time!  The ultimate burrito was the perfect blend of flavors.  Loved the decor too. Will definitely be back!

Had a facial done tonight by Amanda, and it was great! She is very sweet and helpful and my skin looks and feels fantastic. She is very good with skincare product knowledge. Definitely recommend her. You also receive 25% off if it is your first time. The only change I would make is the facial booth setting; I wish it were a private room as opposed to a small kiosk in the back of the store. I would prefer this because you can still hear the busyness and upbeat music inside the store and it's harder to relax. That's my one complaint, although doesn't bother me enough to not want to return. I'm happy with my service and will be returning :)

HORRIBLE SERVICE!! Went to this Econo Lube N' Tune based on location and giant advertising they have for a $9.95 oil change. First, the oil change is STARTING at $9.95 for 10 W oil only. I suppose we're supposed to be able to read the fine print as we're driving by. I can handle the sneaky advertising because it's how they reel people in, I get it. But, to top it with a very sarcastic, unprofessional customer service rep (Alex), it was a horrible experience. So far my car hasn't exploded so I guess they did the job correctly. But, trust me, I will NEVER go back and I'm telling everyone I know about my experience here.  Alex may have been having a bad day.  Alex may hate his job.  Alex may just be a jerk.  Regardless, you should NEVER treat customers like they're morons.  There is NO EXCEPTION to this.  Very inappropriate.
Very bad service..if you sit in the drive through for 10 min in front of the speaker and no one takes your order while employees look right at you something isn't right..

We went to this restaurant last night for the first time. We waited at the entrance for about 5 minutes when a tall young man wearing makeup finally came out to set us. And SET we did, it took another 15 minutes to get bread and water. The SET we did again, our waiter apologized and when he walked up in broken english asked if we were ready? Ready oh yes by this time we had been there over 40 minutes.  We ordered pasta dishes and both were very acidic, the salads were not tossed, you get a small plate of lettuce and you are supposed to somehow toss the salad yourself on this small plate.  The pasta itself was cooked right. After they placed each thing on the table a woman who barely speaks english walks up and asks you if it is "good". The building itself is beautiful and even though they have gaming it is not smokey.  I just think they need better pasta sauces and better management. Obviously more or better servers as it was not busy but we kept waiting. In all we were there over 2 hours and we did not linger. We won't be giving it another try.

Went here with my family because Le Fripon wasn't open. Sad to say that the trade off wasn't great. Service was adequate. And my veggie burger was pretty good. But $16 is overpriced, even for a tourist spot. Add to that the $4 sodas--and a beer menu that was apparently drawn up by someone who either hates or doesn't understand beer--and you make this reviewer very sad. This is 2017 and adjunct lagers and Murphy's do not a draft list make. Probably one of the worst values for money deals to be had in Old Montreal.

I got a good laugh out of reading the Yelp reviews for this "business."  I thought I would recount my experience in the summer of 2013 just to add some additional information about what consumers can expect if they choose Payless Car Rental at the Las Vegas McCarran airport. 

The day before I flew in to Las Vegas from San Diego I called Payless to reserve my rental car. My car got reserved and the price I was to going to pay was quoted and locked in with Payless over the phone (or so I thought). 

When I got to the airport's rental car area after getting off my flight I noticed that every car rental company's counter had a long line except Payless. I stepped up to their counter and gave the attendant my reservation information. He generated the paperwork and I noticed the price was around 50% higher than what Payless and I had agreed to on the phone less than 24 hours earlier. 

"What they told you on the phone was just an estimate" he told me. I held my ground and started going back and forth with him. I had Home Depot showing up at my condo in less than two hours to install a new carpet and I had to get my car and get out of there but without getting ripped-off.

He was holding his ground as well, and in order to wear me down he started asking me irrelevant questions of a personal nature, one of which was "Why did you come to Las Vegas today?" Here's how the rest of the exchange went:

Me: "I came to Las Vegas because I'm going to install new carpet in my condo."

Him: "Oh then you should call my friend Paul. He's runs a carpet business here in Vegas."

Me: "Really? That would be awesome. What is Paul's phone number?"

Him: "[Gives me his friend's number]. Paul will take care of you. And I think we can get this rental car price down a ways for you too."

The price then went back down to about 5% higher than the price I had been quoted by the Payless person on the phone the day before. I carefully checked and signed the papers, grabbed the keys, and got the heck out of there, never to return to Payless Car Rental.

We were given a voucher to spend after staying a few nights at Paris, so I had lots of fun pretending to be a Parisian for a morning. The cafe has seating that lets you have a complete view of the casino, so people watching is a must. The menu does not have that many French options besides crepes; they have mostly steak and eggs, omelette dishes, etc.

I had the eggs benedict ($17), which came with canadian bacon and potatoes. The potatoes were well seasoned, but could have been crispier. I'm not a huge fan of hollandaise sauce (all that butter, no thank you), so I wasn't pleased when my eggs were drowned in it. I loved how the English muffin tasted more like a biscuit, since it was dense and savory. Portions were really good and everyone was stuffed after leaving. We also shared a croissant, which wasn't anything special in my opinion and not worth $6.

I didn't notice that my food was cold or that service was slow. The line to get in at 10 AM was about a ten minute wait. Price is a bit expensive, so if you wanted to eat at Paris, I would recommend the creperie.

Someone else said it best - this gym was amazing when it was Hard Candy, and has been through too many changes and had too many downgrades to be considered "a great gym" at this point. I almost joined the new LA Fitness in the Junction and ended up changing my mind because the limited amount of functional training equipment is kept behind a personal training barrier and the rest of the gym was extremely basic. So, after visiting HC/Aura a few times, I decided to go back last night and find out about memberships.

Now it's Crunch Fitness. Their "Premium membership" includes scratchy, small towels that cover about 30% of my body (I'm 5'8) for a shower. Also includes their classes - most of which I like and are basically the only good thing left over from Hard Candy. You can get unlimited guest passes which is cool but doesn't really matter to me. Same annoying sign up fees that you see elsewhere - $90 initiation, $20 "card fee", and $70/month after that. I was a bit surprised at the cost and thought Aura's prices of $49 were much more reasonable. I was still considering joining because I LOVE the functional training area there, and love to use the heavy bag (I am an ex boxer), Free Motion equipment, box jump platforms, sled, etc. 

So I walk by on the way to my class and I see a big sign posted saying "NEW POLICY - functional training zone only to be used by personal trainers/clients between 4-8pm, Monday-Thursday". MOTHER. F@#$@#^$@'s. So, the one area that I wanted to use and the only reason why I wanted to sign up, taken away completely as those are the exact hours that I would be exercising there. I am so frustrated with gyms in Toronto. Forcing you into basic memberships where you will probably stop going out of sheer boredom, or pay up the a%@ and get access to the beneficial parts of the gym. And still charging $70 per month while restricting access to the only part of the gym that would be worth that cost. So, I won't be going back.

They have also removed all of the products from the bathrooms, using some sort of cheap shampoo or soap (couldn't even tell what it was) that made my skin break out in hives.

Crunch, thanks for killing the vibe.

Chapen is a cute little ma & pop type Thai place. I was staying at a hotel by the airport and was in dire need of a restaurant for dinner and i found Chapen on Yelp with 5 star reviews.  You wouldn't expect it to be a restaurant, it looks like it should be a house. There are only 6 tables and the whole family works the restaurant and the food is excellent. I ordered the Massaman Curry and it was great. They have us complimentary green tea ice cream at the end of the meal and even a free bottle of water while we waited for our cab to pick us up.

The guys at the shop are amazing!!!  Probably the best service I've received in a very long time.  

Friendly and helpful while being professional.  

I'll be back for more items.   Thanks so much.

Been to a few different Brazilian places, don't really care to compare one to the other, would rather speak on what I enjoy. Went with a party of 8 6 adults and 2 kids. 
First let me say the service here is OUTSTANDING, I have not received service like this in a long time if ever. Our server Thompson, was Johnny on the spot with everything, while not being intrusive. One of the adults was just about to eat some food with his hands due to a dropped silverware by his son. When Thompson hands him some more without ever being asked, again awesome service. 
Food was all absolutely delicious, the filet mignon was about the only thing I didn't care for. My favorites were the flank steak followed by the house special with the garlic steak right behind it. As far as the salad bar, if you need a bigger one go find a sizzlers or souplantation. This place is for carnivores! 
In my opinion the best Brazillian Steakhouse I have ever been to. I now have a added spot when visiting Vegas. Well done to all the staff there.

Great food in Pittsburgh's Market Square! Had dinner with my kids here before a show at Heinz Hall. Easy walking distance of Pittsburgh's theatre district and the PPG Place ice rink. Reasonable prices and possibly the best pierogies I've ever had in Pittsburgh, where pierogies are a tradition. Get the "grandpa style" with bacon and fried onions - you won't be disappointed (and they are made fresh in-house daily). My daughter ordered the grandma's mac and cheese. Despite a warning on the menu that it would take extra time, we were served within 20 minutes. They don't use microwaves or freezers in the restaurant - everything is freshly made. The crust on their pizzas is amazing, and my son loved his "hula burger" with pineapple and other toppings. If you eat upstairs, try to snag a table with a view of Market Square - or eat outside on the balcony if the weather allows.

I was excited to see this opened up as I'm a fan of Terrible's carwashes. I stopped by on my way home from work and was in and out in about 15 minutes total. 

The attendant asked me if there was anything in particular I needed him to focus on, which I've never been asked before and was glad he did.

They weren't super busy when I went so I had 3 people vacuuming, drying and wiping down my car all at once.

When my car was done, the same attendant asked me if he had addressed everything I needed. I didn't catch his name but will be sure to do so next time. Super positive and polite guy.

It is not a detail shop level carwash, but for the price, location and good service, I'll definitely go back.
I think this is about the best cupcakes in vegas no joke they also have a location on Lakemead love both places there cupcakes are delicious little expensive but worth every penny

I went to Terror Town yesterday night. First off, the admission was $18.00, we had a coupon so we only paid $16.00. We got there at 9:30 and didn't actually get into the actual haunted house until 1145..yes, the wait was 2 hours and 15 min. We were all excited when we first got there and the line didn't seem too bad, they usually seem to go pretty fast and the line can be part of the fun in most cases, well not this one. This was way too long of a wait. They were letting each group go in separate by themselves whether it was a group of 2 or 6...I do like that each group gets to experience their own experience without a group of strangers with you, however in this case you just couldn't do that...everyone was getting frustrated from waiting. There was a VIP line which some people were getting out of the regular line and going to VIP. VIP saved you waiting time, but it didn't seem as quick or such special treatment. They still had to wait 15 maybe 20 minutes at the most. The haunted house itself was pretty good but It wasn't worth it for the wait. I heard the one actor who was walking around tell someone, you may have to wait longer but that means the quality of the scare is better. The actors in the haunted house were interactive. I wouldn't go back to Terror Town!

Delicious! Their boba is done perfect. This is the only place where I found cantelope green tea. It was delicious and none of the super sugary syrups. Everybody is very friendly and they will tell you that they will make it right if you didn't like the taste or the amount of sugar in it. Which is awesome customer service! Definitely my go-to place when I am in the SW or Henderson area.
Probably the best buffet in Vegas.  Not really a big fan for buffet but then if I going to, this would be the one.
Old school Italian deli.  Good meatball parmesan sandwich - yummy meatballs, melty cheese, and a generous amount of overflowing sauce.  Deliciously messy.

Great place to enjoy great desserts and coffee!
As someone who lives in Las Vegas I don't make a habit of spending much time on the strip but if you are in "The Cromwell" I would highly recommend stopping in and staying a bit.
Molly was our server at the counter we were greeted with a smile and very attentive service! She is A-1!
Can you say SALTY?! I thought it was just the salsa that was too salty. But the food was mostly salt. Price is fair.

It is Asian fusion and bold--be prepared for heavy cream and guilt. Go there for lunch for the best prices and bang for your buck. You will not be disappointed. I know, I know. It is part of a mall. You wouldn't know it once you get inside.

I would have never known this place even served food had a relative not taken my husband and I. His recommendation was either the Ping Gai or Pad Thai. I've had my share of Pad Thai back at home, so I figured why not? Ping Gai it is!! And YES it was! It was very very good and loved the light crispiness of the chicken when it came out.

I also had the Crispy Calamari. Ok, now I've eaten fried calamari EVERYWHERE. This is by far THE BEST! It's not hard, it's not dry, it's not chewy. The exterior has a nice crisp (not crunch) and the inside is so soft and melts in your mouth!! That's right! Calamari that melts in your mouth...is that EVEN possible?? YES IT IS! This appetizer will SERIOUSLY not disappoint.

Check out my pics!
http://what2eatz.blogspot.com/2011/09/queen-mother-queen-west.html
Just so happen to walk by and see the sign for this expo. It is a nice little area to see the art. And best of all its free!

This is the worst event I have ever attended. They completely ripped everyone off and didn't follow through with anything that was advertised. 1st off there were only about 8 vendors (they promoted hundreds) which included lularoe and lipsense.... at a dessert expo. There was no kids fun zone. There were no demonstrations. There were hardly any samples. Tickets were $25 each and $50 each for VIP. The VIP ticket holders were ripped off even more. They were promised a nice lunch and goodie bag. Instead they were served $5 hot n ready Little Cesaers pizza. Most of the desserts were sitting out, uncovered in the Arizona sun. The event was suppose to last until 5pm, but they closed it at 3pm. Everyone deserves a refund, including the vendors!!

These guys are amazing! and the only place I'll ever let work on my car ever again. 

I had gotten a pretty nasty dent in my passenger side door while living in LA, but decided to wait to get it fixed once I had shipped it back to NC. I contacted the dealer at the Mercedes dealership, who recommended Manpower over all of the Mercedes Certified collision centers in the area. 

I had previously gotten a quote for the dent at one of the aforementioned certified collision centers and almost passed on even getting it fixed because of the outrageous price ($2400) and 7 day repair time.

I took it to Manpower, who quoted me a price 1/4 of that, and told me it would be ready in 3 days. Tim explained to me exactly how they'd fix it and even sent over pictures during the repair process.

I picked my car up yesterday and it look absolutely amazing [they even detailed it for me :) ]. My dad, who is the most meticulous human being alive and can spot a scratch on my car from a mile away, was absolutely amazed and could not even tell that there had ever been a dent there.

Tim and the guys truly know their business, cars, and what they're doing; when I picked my car up yesterday, a salesman from a nearby, reputable, dealership had brought in a brand new car to get a dent fixed on it's bumper, before putting it back on the lot- that's how good they are.

One last thing, ladies, something we've all fallen victim to before, these guys didn't try to price gauge me and convince me that I needed to replace the entire door, along with dozens of other adjustments (aforementioned body shop did- literally the guy told me it would cost extra money to replace the glue on the back of the silver trim that they would have to remove.)

Manpower has gained a family of customers for life and I still can't get over how amazing my car looks.

Hidden off the 51 & Glendale. Big place & big patio. Meh food. Chips & salsa ok. Skip the queso. Vegetarians BEWARE everything is made w/ meat. Beans AND noodle stuff. Ugh. Safe w/ grilled veggies. :(
Kevin really listened to me re: my rib pain, which I appreciated! The wait was short and the staff was great.

Usually this restaurant is great. The food tastes fine and it's an okay price, but they have a hard time following instructions with orders. You can give the same order a million times like I have but they never get it right. EVER. I can over look that for so long, but yesterday I found a HAIR in the pico de gallo that was on the salsa bar by the register. The manager apologized and replaced the batch but it was too late. That hair was -deep- in there. Three people that were near me put their pico in the garbage after they saw the dyed reddish-brown hair I found in my pico. Not sure when I'm gonna be back at this restaurant..

After my first visit last August, I immediately fell in love with this place.The food, the drinks, the wacky decor, the atmosphere, I had finally found my "spot". I have periodically frequented Krazy Fish since then and after each visit in the recent months I must say my opinion has changed dramatically. Although the atmosphere lately is anything but fun and upbeat and downright uncomfortable at times, I find myself returning for the simple fact that the food is always delicious. As for the drinks, I have to say it's hit or miss, most of the time it seems the person behind the bar is basically "winging it". They have a decent wine and beer selection and always have beer specials so I would recommend going that route considering it's hard to screw that up. The service has never been over the top great which I have to sum up to poor management and lots of yelling going on (even with a full dining room) and at times looks to be down right nasty. I have personally witnessed servers on the verge of tears which would explain new faces just about every time I have dined here. Such a shame that this place has so much potential but who wants to dine at a place where it seems that there is always some sort of turmoil brewing behind the scenes? I would definitely recommend the food, however, let me suggest you call in your order and eat it in the comfort of your own home so that you can fully enjoy your meal. The Salmon Tacos are the best and will not disappoint.
So worth it. Better than any of the other magic shows with all the special effects. He's the real deal.  Ok for all ages and sensibilities.

Really good pizza, and fast service too!  
My pizza was ready to eat five minutes after I ordered it.

Best buying experience ever .. I do not like dealerships and the whole buying experience, but this dealership is awesome.  After getting burned trying to buy a outback in California I reached out to these guys.  Kim was my sales person and Mike the sales Mgr. Great team you will not go wrong, look them up please.

I got a better deal here than in California. I was initially looking at the Outback Limited and was dealing with this dealership and two others in California. After looking at the car in person I couldn't pull the trigger. Then I saw a Touring model someone had ordered. That was the car I wanted. Galpin Subaru had one, I gave them a deposit over the phone, 3 hrs later they sold it to someone else. DO NOT DO BUSINESS WITH THEM.  I reached out to Mike and Kim again, I knew they had this same car. Mike offered me a great price, put a deposit down and flew out to get it 3 days later.  

I cant not review on the service dept. but as for my buying experience it was great. If your looking for a great deal, a great salesperson, contact Kim at this Subaru dealership.

Thanks Again !!

Linda

Rugelach: Double Chocolate Chip, Apricot, Raspberry w/ Raisins
Lobster Tail ($5.95)
Cream Puffs ($2.50)
Hazelnut Cream Puffs ($2.50)
Strawberry Tart ($2.50)
Cannoli (sm; $2.50)
Raspberry Linzer Tart ($3.50)

Yeah, GOOD STUFF. I enjoyed everything in my box. The cream puffs are delicious and I loved the tarts. The cannoli was also good, though not my favorite pastry. The BEST pastry was absolutely the Lobster Tail. WOW. This was my first lobster tail experience and it blew me away. I loooove the layer after layer after layer of flaky pastry and the French cream was so scrumptious (they put a touch of Bailey's Irish Cream in it!). This is my kind of pastry!

The line can get long, but when I visited, it moved REALLY quickly. Come early for fresh pastries and to, hopefully, beat some of the crowd.
I went in for a highlight touch up and a trim and The manager Tiffany did an amazing job! I've been coming here for about a year now and have never been disappointed! I highly recommend Tiffany

I have been an advocate of Banker Insulation since 2007 when they did some insulation work for my Garage in Surprise. Did a great job and couldn't be happier. In 2011, they did it again to our home in Goodyear. Great job again. Decided to use them at our business location in Goodyear, why wouldn't we. The actual job of removing the old insulation and installing the new looks great. But prior to the insulation job, we had the epoxy floors done so keeping them nice was critical. The sales manager suggested some boots for the lift so that the lift didn't cause issues with the floor. Sounds great to me. After the job was done, the floors were scraped and scratched and it did not look like either of the lifts had any boots on them. I do not know how they got scraped up, whether is what the lifts supports, staples on the floors and turning on them, I really don't care what did it. I just wanted them to be exactly how they were. Come to find out, that boots/diapers are for the bottom of the lifts, not for the tires, so that the lifts do not leak oil on the floors. That was not made known until after we were trying to come to problem solving answer. My $10,000+ epoxy floors don't look like $10,000+ floors any longer. They would rather say that it was not their fault when no one else is in the shop while they are working then keep a continued customer happy. $750 out of a $6000+ invoice, It is really sad. Am I an advocate now? I can't. If they come back and offer to fix the floor, I would say that they did the right thing and would become an advocate for them again.
There dogs and burgers are so gooood  me and my bf also love the tots! Food always taste great :) our fave is the holy aioli burger !

Returned for late breakfast few weeks ago but had a terrible experience. We waited for close to an hour for our food. The were a few tables of people left because they got so pissed from waiting. We had a few kids with us so we didn't have a choice but to stay since Congee Queen next door was busy. My dad ordered lunch cause he came late. We were told that the soup came with the combo was not ready! I felt that they were so unprepared... Although the food was not bad, I don't think I will go back unless I have 2 hours for lunch time.

We reserved a room here for 2 nights and left after 1.  There was no fitted sheet over the mattress and the sheet they threw untucked over the mattress had holes in it.  They also left a room service cart in our hallway for an entire day and the smell of rotting food wafted about.  I would not recommend anyone stay here - there are plenty of good deals about in other higher quality casinos.
The staff here is amazing! This DD girl had exceptional service and a great attitude! But sadly, the food took 30 minutes. Very upsetting. Great food though!

Had such a great first experience at Maggiano's!! Our server Nicole was amazing. We wanted to eat somewhere before our show at the Wynn. We knew that it was our own fault for running a little behind, but when Nicole found out that we were on a time limit, she made sure that they had everything out for us in a timely manner without us having to ask her. We were not expecting that at all. She gave us suggestions on what to order and what not to order since certain items take longer to make. She kept checking up on us and our waters were always filled. Portions are big (family style is an option as well) so we ended up ordering an appetizer, one pasta dish, and then dessert. Soooo good! We will be back

I have been to the Rehab in Scottsdale and found myself in Tempe so I was more than happy to be able to get my fix. I love the Mac Gnarly burger.  The burger proportions are huge, and by huge I mean split with the family huge.  I am no small eater and can maybe get through 3/4 of the relapse size.  The chili con fritos are also excellent and brings me back to my Texas days.
The service is good and the wait staff provides great recommendations. The noise level is a little loud but you can still have a conversation.  But the taste and food quality is what sets this place apart.  I would say it is one of the best burgers I have had.

I love coming here, plus on these days when it gets dark at 5 It is bright yellow and sunny inside :)  There are so many options to choose from and the cashier is always willing to make suggestions for you or can create your own.  The hummingbird is my favorite.  

I haven't tried any of the food options that they have because the smoothie is a meal in itself. 

Don't forget to get a frequent customer punch card!

My family has been going here for 20+years even when they were at their first location. Tonight was the only time I can say I was extremely disapointed. Food always awesome! But the Organist was a jerk and unprofessional. We've always brought our kids year after year and we have kids(2) with Autism. My kids were dancing to the wonderful music and having fun with their cousins. They were a little hyper but I was reminding them to calm down,(part of the Autism behaviors). Honestly they were being kids.  And their were many other kids than just our party enjoying the music and dancing. After one of the songs the Organist calls us out over the intercom and then stared us down. So much for our always kid friendly destination. We've NEVER had this issue before in all the time we've visited. And even the staff was super nice.  Sad to have a musician get a power trip.

This is my favorite hotel to stay at in Vegas.  The parking is a breeze right into the hotel, the rooms are spectacular (especially) with a fountain view, service top notch and friendly.  It's a little smaller than most of the high end hotels on the strip, but has a great vibe.  Very elegant.  We have eaten at a couple of their restaurants.  Prime Steakhouse is very good, excellent service.  It is very expensive, not unlike all the other hotel restaurants.  The gym is pretty big and their spa is awesome.  My only complaint is the pool is nothing spectacular.  I recommend staying here and they offer great deals.

Ever since the smoking ban this place has become less of a hipster bar and more of an aging yuppy restaurant, but the food is still good and the service is excellent.  I especially like it that they have every one of my favorite board games that got flooded out of my basement when I was 10.  Ah, memories.

we came here to celebrate my husband's bday and he chose the place.  It was so so.  My steak came too rare and I just gave up eating it and just took home to cook it some more for breakfast the next day.  So it's one of those places that we tried and say "been there, done that."  My husband said his Jambalaya was just ok.
I try to come here every time I am in town on business. The food is great and I love the vibe. I've had Courtney as a server a few times and she is so fun! I will be back!

If there were more stars to give, I'd give them. 

Delivery takes less than an hour and all items arrive warm and ready to eat. 

Pricing is very reasonable given the excellent quality of the food. 

So far we've tried the Stroganoff, Schnitzel, Hummus with Ground Beef, Chicken Salad and Vareniki. Every single dish was AMAZING, perfectly prepared and full flavored, this is the best food I've had in Las Vegas so far. 

Can't say enough nice things about Green Dacha Grill and will definitely be a regular customer for a long time to come !

Nice, old fashioned neighbor sort of place, food is good and nicely done.  We had calamari for our appetizer and it was great, fresh and crispy with a great combo of seasoning.  Dinnerwas great and we really had a chance to relax.

Worst rentalcarcompany ever! 
They just cancelled our 6weeks old reservation the same day as we arrived without notice. They didn't have enough cars, so they canceled 175 bookings that day. We where left behind without help or nothing.  I also in the past had disputes with this company, be aware, stay away!

Update: 
Below I got the message to contact customer service, I did, I still haven't got any answer from them after 3 days. I also visited Sixt rental in Las Vegas yesterday, they could give me a rental, no problem, but not at the same condition that I have booked and to a much higher price... I am a freqent rentalcar user in Europe, and have great conditions trough my Sixt card, those conditions I could not get... Only if I booked online... What I did in the first place, but got cancelled...
What a joke the whole amercan division of Sixt. 

I repeat myself, STAY AWAY from Sixt Las Vegas!

This place is great! I went to Eyebrows R' Us a few times and they just weren't all that good. The treatments were painful and my eyebrows usually came out looking messed up. The ladies at this salon are extremely friendly. I will be returning to this location in the future, this is my new spot. I highly recommend going here!
Not coming back here! Girl on phone was rude, I was overcharged, they forgot my ranch and messed up my order and their wings tasted horrible! Avoid at all costs!

The front desk girl took our name and said it would be 10 mins, she suggested we wait at the bar. 45 minutes later and 4 margaraitas later, we noticed so many more people were being seated. As I walked up to her to see what the deal was, she said she was just coming to get us. Yeah right. Anyway, our waitress was great. Food was typical American Mexican....tacos, burritos, etc. Nothing too fancy, and nothing worth noting here. We were in a hurry so we chose this place on a whim...we will plan better next time.

Pool is fine. This is more a review about the hookah they offer. Because it was terrible. The apple tasted awful and the guy wasn't much help. He initially put too many coals and burnt it so it was super harsh. If you burn something maybe switch it out. Don't take one coal out and try and act like it doesn't taste like garbage. Maybe do anything to stop a customer from leaving upset enough to write an awesome yelp review about it. The girls were nice and one of them was super helpful. Avoid the hookah and it might be ok. Also try not sitting in the chairs, unless you enjoy slowly sliding out of them.

This is the 2nd time we have eaten here when we have come to AZ and it iz amazing! The amount of food you get justifies the price! We have the 3 enchiladas one beef one spinach and one cheese with beans and rice fantastic my fiancee is always afraid to order meat but she loved this! I had the 2 rellenos and beans and rice not knowing what i was in for because it was alot of food! The only thing i would say is to please not over stuff the enchiladas with spinach otherwise a great meal! I finished my food so couldnt get a pic but if your in the tempe area please try this spot you wont be sorry !
Had a fantastic experience here. The entire staff was friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. By far the best experience I've had at any healthcare facility in the valley. Highly recommend!

I finally tried this place after wanting to from their ads. I got a salad to go, the Green Goddess Cobb which is probably not exactly diet fare but hey...sometimes ya gotta live a little. 

I'm a salad junkie - I love a good salad and make them frequently for myself so sometimes, I like someone else to do the work and I was not disappointed. It was delicious!! Unlike most take out salads, it was NOT made up of soggy, wilted iceberg lettuce with a couple of tomato wedges thrown in. The ingredients were fresh and plentiful and the dressing was yummy. It was more than satisfying and filling. 

I only wish we had one of these near me because I would definitely be going there probably more often than I should.
Christiana in reservations was a delight to work with. Smooth and simple and everything explained

This is a good spot to hang out with friends and grab some drinks. They have such a great roof top patio. Service is friendly. Food may take a while when it's busy. Food is a OK, not bad but not amazing either. There's a good selection for everyone to choose from. 
My only complaints are: 1) music is very loud late in the evening, so loud that it's not enjoyable as you can't even hear the person sitting next to you. 2) for the non-patio sections, AC is a bit lacking. It was hot hot.

Awesome hotel and very friendly staff. Parking is great b/c they tell you how many spots are left on each floor. Great shopping in Cosmo and fun gaming all around. There's a shop on the 2nd floor with the best macaroon's ever!!!

This is a cheap Vietnamese eatery. Typical bad Toronto service and disregard for 
health rules. If they cook you a wrong dish, your problem, or they will just remix the wrong dish with something else so that it looks like the dish you ordered, etc.

Thai dishes are really bad here, stick to the Vietnamese ones.

I have tried: 
* appetizers: mostly good, if you know what you want. K10 has a ton of shrimp in it.
* pho -- it is a bit above average for Toronto
* Quail (K17) -- horrible
* Rice with grilled meat (197 and such) -- tolerable
* Stir fry (203-212) -- decent, but stick to beef/shrimp. Chicken is some fake substitute. 
Beef could be fake too, but it tastes better.
* Pad thai -- big no. Go to PAI, Thai Princess, or Khao San Road instead for that.
* Vermicelli dishes (B01-B28) -- below average for Toronto, but passable. 

Overall it is nothing special, and all the other options in the immediate vicinity are worse. 
So it is quite popular for lunch, actually. 

Be careful and do not come when they open (10am), you might get leftovers from yesterday.
Buffet selection is limited but our waiter kept the mimosas pouring in... So for a Sunday brunch, perfecto!

Feeling so blessed to have a delicious lunch and conversation with my delightful friends Magie Stuart, Jerry Stuart, Joan Champagne and Ray Champagne at @Las Vegas Paiute Resort. Jerry treated me to the sight of baby Roadrunner and egg in it's nest near the restaurant (a first for me). The resort is hidden from the highway, has three golf courses and eight spring fed lakes. The.views from the clubhouse and restaurant are as spectacular as they are surprising.
The food and service were yummy. Jerry and I had burgers and cleaned our plates. Joan, Magie and Ray had quesadillas and enjoyed them too. The restaurant is open for brunch and lunch only so come early. Saturday and Sunday brunch as said to be superb. I plan to return with a date.

I go to this Wildflower a few times a month - usually on Sundays with the Husband. We're workaholics, so we pack up the laptops, get lunch and work the day away. There isn't a better atmosphere to work in, and we usually meet some cool people. 
The food is fantastic - definitely try the Potato Cream Cheese soup in the winter, and the Carribean Cobb salad in the summer. FANTASTIC!
Best part : free wifi, and about 6 outlets to plug in and work.
Also, attached to Changing Hands (epic) and across from RedSeven Computers.
I've been to most of the other Wildflowers in town and in Sedona, and this one has the best staff and atmosphere.

Good food, excellent service and nice place! Lots of choices for katsu. I ordered the chicken katsu with cheese and porkloin katsu with cheese.  It comes with free refill of cabbage salad which by the way is really refreshing and I had 2 bowls with their house salad sauce. Also free refill of rice and miso soup. The server recommended the honey butter crispy chicken which is also very good. Taste a little spicy which is  just right for me. 

I will definitely come back. Curious for the ground beef katsu....

"Honey I Shrunk the Lunch Specials and the Restaurant, too!" is more apropos of a name for Thai Basil. Now don't get me wrong, I like Thai Basil.  The food is decent and the interior is nice, but the tables/diners seem to be squished elbow-to-elbow New York style. Spartan, but slightly upscale, this restaurant ALWAYS seems to have a wait.  

The yellow curry here is my favorite with a delicious balance of coconut, spice, carrots chicken and potatoes.  I can't ever seem to get enough, and I really mean that.  The portions here are small, and while lunch portions are expectedly small, portions elsewhere (at Chanpen Thai, for example) are larger and less expensive. Elsewhere the Thai BBQ chicken comes with 1/2 a chicken, but at Thai Basil they give you three lonely strips like cheapos!  The massaman curry and pad thai are pretty good too, but I feel they're just OK.  I've had better.

Service is hit or miss here.  One thing that's consistent: they always seem to be understaffed. Once when I was dining alone (at a 4-person table) they had the nerve to ask me to move while in the middle of eating, to a 2-person table. 

To me, Thai Basil is style over substance.  Not impressed.  Next.

I was super excited they opened this cafe here. The decor is super cute which i love! The service is excellent and when we went, it wasn't overly crowded. I ordered the dessert because it just looks too good! I got the strawberry waffle with the whipped cream. It's soooooooo good! But then again, you can't go wrong with waffle and whipped cream! 

My friend tried the Waffle chicken, which I tried a bit and it was good! 

I would come back to try other food. However, the price is a bit high though.

As a foodie from California, I was searching for a hot pot place to celebrate my monthsary with my girlfriend. We went during lunch and the price was a good deal. Only reasons I can't give a 5 was because they didn't have rice as an option and we couldn't taste/sample the broth before ordering. So we just had to guess which one we would like. Other than that, they had a good selection for the price. I would recommend.

Very good pizza take and bake is great! We have been gong to this location for years and the associates that prepare the pizzas are efficient and friendly. I also like the fact that they have specials and that customers are able to use coupons.

I started buying my juice here when I moved to Vegas last year (and can't believe that I forgot to review before this). Their juice is really top notch and quite inexpensive, and their customer service is first-class!

I used to buy everything online. Some of their prices are as good or better. The rest (for some hardware) is not much more (while still very reasonable) and there is definitely something to be said for buying retail - getting to see and hold the product, no shipping if a return/exchange is needed, etc. I've bought my new vaping rig there and am very happy with it.

I don't look to shop anywhere else for my vaping products. Red Rock Vapor is an excellent retailer that I highly recommend.

My husband bought 4 mini variety cupcakes and a huge lemon cupcake. they were not worth the price he paid for them. Mini cupcakes were dry, only thing delicious was the lemon. Maybe i didn't like the cupcakes because I'm a fan of chiffon. Would not go back again. Smith's has better cupcakes for half the price.

I was tempering my expectations going in, based on previous reviews. I was pleasantly surprised by the customer-first attitude of Steve.  We didn't have an appointment and it was a busy Sunday, but Steve came up with a solution and got my son and I in for haircuts. It was quick, easy and a good haircut. My only complaint would have to be the debit/credit card fee, but it's also hard to argue their logic for having one.
So make an appointment and come enjoy an old-fashioned cut.

Bumpe up to a 4.  this place deserves it!  Tots Fun.  Tots Cool.  Tots The SHIZZLE!

"Dirty Bits... Dirty Bits.."  *singing*  whenever I pass this restaurant, I think of that song by the Blackeyed Peas "The TIme -- Dirty Bits" because this restaurant has these awesome Dirty Chips!   Homemade chips with blue cheese, bacon, cheese... Yums... I usually love them.

I like RnR for 2 reasons... Dirty Chips and Sunday Brunch/Day Party.  When I have friends in town, this is the place we skip church to go to for food and bottomless Mimosa's and Bloody Mary's from 10-3pm.  If you have these type of friends in town, this is a cool place to go for brunch and bypass the snooty brunch locations in Phoenix/Scottsdale.  

RnR has the craziest hours of a restaurant like this... 8am - 2am.  Yes folks... I have gone here after a night out for those Dirty Chips.... Dirty Chips. *singing*

A DJ starts around 10ish.  If you have a large party, make a reservation.  Get there just before 10 to avoid the crowd.

This place calls itself a Gastropub, but I wouldn't.  I think of it as a cool local bar eatery.

Return Factor: 100%.

I had heard good things but even then, I was still impressed. Everything we had was truly amazing! 

Appetizer:
Foie Gras- this was memorable, especially the seared foie gras. I'm thinking about it now and my mouth is watering!

Entree:
Chilean sea bass- the broth was perfect and the sea bass was melt in your mouth delicious

My coworker got the signature lobster pot pie which I tried a few bites of. It was unreal of course, but a bit too rich and creamy for a full entree IMHO.

Dessert: OF COURSE I had to get the root beer float (even though I don't love root beer) and it was the best root beer float I've ever had! The warm cookies were a nice touch and the float was scrumptious. 

Overall, the Michael Mina experience carries weight and albeit a bit pricey, it was worth every penny. You will not be disappointed!

Great Dive Bar, interesting mix of people. Plenty of Beers on tap to choose from, bartenders were really nice, and the smoking in the bar makes me miss the old days of coming home smelling like smoke. We walked here from our Hotel so we didn't have many options, after an hour it could get boring though...

I LOVE THIS PLACE!
I am always satisfied coming here! Soban always has a good selection of cakes, waffles, and drinks to choose from. Their bingsoo Is also very good as well. It's fairly priced and the interior is modern and classy, not to mention a good view of the street. Service is pretty good too! But beware of coming here on weekend or holiday nights, you might not get a table!

I highly recommend you to come here and try the dessert, you won't regret it!

Had a great time here for our last night in Vegas. The bartenders were nice and really attentive. We listened to a DJ who played all the jams and the set would change between him and a live band, which was also really fun to listen to and dance. If you're looking for a chill time and not something crazy hectic then this is the spot to be at.
Great poutine. Vast selection of different toppings. Service was great. Lines were huge outside though.

We switched to Splash a year ago and have found them to be helpful, straightforward, and honest.  They are quick to answer any questions and provide top notch service!  Our family strongly recommends Splash Pool Service!
We loved the food, the service, and the ambience--great views of the Strip. Will definitely come back. Even my non- foodie hubby thought it was great (though the short rib was a bit teensy for him).

The staff here are rude and unprofessional. I always make an appointment but when I arrive I still need to wait at least twenty minutes. Regardless of this I continued to go here because of the SNS until one employee injured my foot during a pedicure. She tried to continue with the service as if nothing happened despite my foot bleeding right in front of her face. I had to demand that she stop and get some sort of bandaid. I got out of that place as soon as I could. The owner and her were completely unprofessional and really didn't even seem to care about this incident. This happened a few months ago and I still have a scar on my foot. I hope nobody else ever had to experience what I went through there. The injury hurt for days and their lack of basic first aid knowledge and complete disregard for my well being was shocking

This place is beautiful. I really wouldn't consider it a pub since that's what it says under category. The decor gives it a very  comfortable lounge feel. It's located in the back of the MGM and the way we walked in was through this looong hallway, kinda creepy looking actually.  Don't go there on Sunday b/c the DJ won't be there. I was heading towards the bathroom and they had these long couch lounge type of seats with a huge plasma in front of. Big enough for 4 people but better for 2. Drinks were about $12. Get there early to get a section for you and your friends to sit. Definitely going back next time I'm in LV!

Century Link SUCKS.
It skips and pixelates constantly and will randomly stop recording episodes, saying "make sure the receiver is plugged in" ???

We switched from DirecTV which we loved, only because Prism was cheaper but we're going back to DirecTV. 

You would think without a dish the picture would be more consistent, but it's not the case. It's always tripping up and when it freezes it sometimes skips ahead like 10 minutes! It's pretty annoying to miss 10 minutes of your program, especially when it's the end of it. 

Bottom line: don't switch to prism unless you like herky jerky tv that is constantly frozen or skipping.

I'd like to thank Doctor Sara and her staff for providing me with outstanding professional service. Doctor Sara in my opinion is a "One of a Kind" dentist and a true professional, and one who truly cares about her patients and their worrisome or fearful thoughts about seeing a dentist. Doctor Sara puts me at ease, and makes me feel extremely comfortable, with her confidence and vast knowledge about dentistry and professional services provided. I just wish all the dentist's were as "High Caliber" as her.

Doctor Sara has raised the bar so high, that it's very difficult for dentist I've ever visited, or any other dentist for that matter that can achieve this level of excellance.

She's a pleasant person to talk to, and is always very genuine while talking about kids or any other topic before she begins her work. She also explains the steps of the procedure and why they are required in a very genuine, informative and positive manner, so you're not in "for the shock of your life" while thinking or expecting whats next. She makes it a point to tell you everything she's doing and why, before and during the procedure.

I've been to Doctor Sara on numerous occassions, and I've always left the office knowing I just had the best procedure / experience no other dentist can offer, and believe me, I've been to several other Dentist's that don't even come close in comparison to Dortors Sara's amazing and talented dental services. 

Dentistry is Doctor Sara's passion, and strives to give each patient the very best she can offer, she's in fact and without a doubt a "Perfectionist," and this reflects well in her work and work ethics.

Thank you Doctor Sara and your wonderful staff for providing me with "Top Notch" dental work and pleasant experience. I wish I would've found you years ago.

I would HIGHLY recommend everyone to visit Doctor Sara, I guarantee you will be more than satisfied with her service.
Bill V
good diner fair..typical not overly creative..pop prices are ridiculous..food prices are quite reasonable...all day breKie available

These brownies are as good as it gets.  As I've stated else where, the best on the planet.  Variety of product and product size is excellent.  The packaging is top as well.  Wouldn't expect anything less from this fine organization, that has earned my business over a dozen years ago.  I hype 'em up any chance I get and refer family/friends/colleagues along the way.  

Trust me...get 'em!

This place has everything to to become your favorite.   Exceeded my expectations.    Food great n large portions.  Bar... That... Fantastic.! Everything you can imagine  love this place.  Definitely will come back

I have now bought 8 vehicles at Bill Luke. Each and every time I shopped there, they have been friendly, respectful, and have gone above and beyond to get me in the vehicle I wished to buy. I bought my first vehicle there in 1995. and through the years I have had different credit ratings and incomes. But they have always treated me respect and really seemed to understand the financial situations I was in at the time. If you you want to by a new vehicle, or a used vehicle and want an honest, no pressure dealership to deal with, go to Bill Luke!

Ordered using Eat24. One of the best places we have ordered from in a long time. Price was good. Delivery was fast just slightly over 30 mins. Food was delicious and most importantly the special requests where actually followed and the order was complete. Had the antipasto salad, the turkey blt and garlic bread. Garlic bread was the standard pizza place garlic bread but not bad. Partner loved his salad. We usually order from another just for that salad but I think we have a new place to order from. Can't wait to try more things from the menu.  


**second time** forgot my salad but delivered the salad dressing. Ordered the chili cheese burger and if you don't like mayo on your burger don't order. Very disappointed. Not listed anywhere that it has mayo. So kind of gross. Hot sausage sub was just so so. Hope it's just a bad day for them but will be awhile before they get another chance.

Dr. Grant is great! He's everything I want in a provider because he actually educates about his practice and why he does what he does. He doesn't just want to treat symptoms but wants to get to the root of the problem and fix it. I really believe in what Greater Lifer Chiropractic is doing, and truly think they are helping provide greater lives to people! Highly recommend for anyone who wants to be completely better and not just concerned about pain relief.

LUXE Destination Weddings helped create my dream wedding!!! The entire preparation process went so incredibly smoothly. I couldn't have asked for a better travel and wedding planner. They were unbelievable. Ashley Patrick was the most amazing travel planner for my group of 100 people, coming from all over the US and Canada. I have received nothing but compliments from my guests about her. I NEVER felt stressed about anything, she took care of it ALL! My wedding planner was Antoinette Camastra and she was a dream come true! She has such a passion for this job and went absolutely above and beyond to make sure I had the most perfect day. She ALWAYS has a smile on her face and always made sure even the smallest details were taken care of and I was stree free!

I seriously couldn't have asked for a better team. Thank you LUXE Destination Weddings. If you are debating on choosing them for your wedding, DO NOT hesitate to go with them. I highly recommend asking for Antoinette and Ashley!!!


- Jonelle Filigno

If you're a fan of Elvis, you'll probably like this show whether its good or not.  Its got everything you'd ever want in an Elvis show (and perhaps some things you don't want or understand, too).

My seats were in the front row of the balcony.  I have to admit I was concerned about being so far away and up high, but with the size of the stage and some of the set pieces, I was happy we sat where we did.  We could see everything from there.

The show is basically the life and times of Elvis, from his discovery to Vegas.  The Colonel guides us through from beginning to end, working the crowd before the show starts by getting them to dance or sing for an Elvis button or picture.  His mic went out a couple of times during this "preview" performance (shows put on before grand opening so they can work out the kinks).

The acts were varied from obvious choices to some weird stuff.  I could, for the most part, follow along even when it was a bit strange (i.e. realize what they were trying to get across), but I can see how a lot of people may not get the ideas being presented.  I have seen KA, O and Believe and Viva Elvis is within the vein of these shows but does make its own mark.  My friend said that Viva Elvis was not as good as LOVE (but he is a huge Beatles fan, too).

I would still recommend going to see KA, O or a non-Cirque but Cirquey "Le Reve" before seeing Viva Elvis.  I did like Viva Elvis, a lot, but for the amount of money being spent on a ticket with the probability you'll be far away from the stage, you can get more bang for your buck with the better KA and O, or spend the same amount of money and be at the maximum 13 rows from stage/water in Le Reve.

Either way, if you see any of these shows, you'll have a good time.

I happened to mention I was having trouble printing in color, which is usually so easy you don't think about it.  Sassan looked at my system, realized I didn't have the right driver, figured out what driver was needed and got the whole thing working in minutes!  He's GREAT :)

Nice atmosphere with the game music playing in the background and all the retro games of yesteryear. The prices are actually really good considering it's a brick and mortar store and the people actually seem to know about and enjoy games which is a big plus! Combined with it being close to where I live and I'll definitely be coming back here more.

Use to come here all the time, it's nearby. Last time we went the food was nothing like it used to be. And the main reason is that I went to the restroom, one of the chef was using the urinal and went back to the kitchen without washing his hands. If he doesn't do it in front of a customer, I can only imagine when he does. Never again.

WOW!  The real deal. Had a mix of Pork and Cabbage and beef and green onion.  1 serving is 16 pieces and perfect for a lunch.  Free hot/cold water so bring a tea bag.  The clerk spoke English but everyone else was speaking another language - a sure sign of authenticity.

Kudos to Frank as he went above and beyond to satisfy my tire needs today.  He exemplifies integrity as stated on the wall sign - thanks again Wayne and Frank!  I recommend this shop and will bring them back my business. Keep up the good work guys.

Far, far too expensive. The food is good, I don't want to mislead you; but at roughly $13 per plate for smallish portions it is incredibly overpriced. Had the martabak (deep fried ground beef and chive pastry) which was delicious. Very crispy exterior with lots of flavor inside. 

The sambal goreng udang was in no way spicy as sambal ought to be, but rather very sweet. The taste was good, just not what was advertised. 

Lumpia are ok and service is friendly, but I felt that the price was too high for the quality and quantity. If money is no object, I'd be here a lot, it's just too hard to justify coming here more than for special occasions.
Best Mexican I've found in Madison. Margaritas are good, service is always friendly and good and the food..... INCREDIBLE.

The staff are very friendly, the place is very clean, the food tastes great.

HOWEVER, in my humble opinion, the place is way too expensive.   I understand the business model, and I very much appreciate going in to a fast food place where the staff is actually friendly, outgoing, helpful, and speak intelligible English.

But about $15 for two grilled-cheese sandwiches, regular order of (Cajun) fries, and a regular drink?   To me, this makes Five Guys more of an occasional, intentional destination rather than a place I might frequent.    You can start to get a decent meal at a more comfortable place for about that same price -- Olive Garden for example.

I know Five Guys isn't McDonald's, but I sure don't think they're better enough to charge about triple the price of McDonald's, or twice the price of In & Out burgers.

I find it incredibly frustrating that the items on view on the web are not available for display at either Madison store. What's the point? I won't buy anything without an in-store test. Will be looking elsewhere.

Five stars for being my go to cheesecake spot. With curbside service, all the selections and close proximity to my house, I go here all the time for desert. Why only 3 stars? Way too many menu items, overpriced dinner menu and execution of their dishes. The pasta is never sauced or buttered and sticks together. The taco's are just OK and none of their other dishes I have tried have impressed, other than the steak and scampi combo (which is garlicky and delicious). With all the other great and unique places to eat in the city, this is my last choice for dinner.

As a woman going in for an oil change they then told me I needed $660 of parts $411 in labour 
Only to take it to my own dealership to be told my car is perfect and nothing wrong with it 
Talk about taking advantage and ripping me off 
Sad part is they didn't even apologize for the staff that wrote up this bull shit list !!!! Never ever again will
 They get my business

Went with a big group of guys. Food was mostly good. Setting is unbeatable. Porchetta sandwich and kale salad were to die for. Chicken sandwich was okay. Lemon lentil soup tasted overwhelmingly of something unpleasant that was neither lemon nor lentil. Disappointed to find they recently switched from Phil and Sebastian coffee to cheaper and lower quality Fratello coffee. Service was great.

I was pleasantly surprised by this place. We sat outside under the misters which was very nice. Our server was great. He helped us narrow down our dish options and made sure we didn't over order. We got the calamari (unique and delicious), burrata prosciutto melon salad (yummy and refreshing), the chicken wings (amazing) and Bloody Mary. I highly recommend this place. Can't wait to try more items on their menu!

I was excited to try Roman Candle because I've heard good things; however, I was underwhelmed.

The pizza was ok. I ordered the Roman Candle, which seemed like a good staple for a first try. The crust wasn't anything to write home about. Bland, no flavor. The fire cracker sauce was decent, but not as spicy as I thought it would be (although, being from Texas, I have a high spice tolerance). The toppings were sparse, only 2 pieces of sausage on average per piece!

Overall, mediocre. Will I ever find a good pizza place in Madison???

I went in looking for some items to decorate my home.  Although I did not buy anything that day, I saw a few large items that I will return for.  The few clothing items I looked at seemed a little pricey, but for home items, this is a great store.
Large, very over-crowded.  very little open space, not dog friendly.  Rude and confrontational management.  Upside...  bathrooms seemed clean.  Can't recommend unless you have no other options

Ok I have been here Four times now. The bagels are good.  But all four times they were out of something (and I don't mind running out of bagels, they only make so many, but tomatoes?) And 3 of the 4 visits the coffee was luke warm.  When all you sell is coffee and bagels.  Here is a tip. Have bagels and hot coffee!  This is an easy fix whoever is running this place.

The fish at Katsuya SLS is not only some of the freshest fish you can get, but without a doubt the highest quality. Do not let price deter you, every bite is worth every penny, over and over again. Stephan, the sushi chef is not only kind and friendly, but so knowledgeable with fish. My two girl friends and I had an amazing experience. And we have our server Ashley and our sushi chef Stephan to thank for a happy and delicious dinner.  It will be impossible to be pleased with sushi anywhere else. If you appreciate flavor,  please try this sushi for your own good.

Mouthfuls of delicious that I will be coming back for. 

Had the seasonal tasting menu. Wish I ordered everything instead. 
Unagi between foie gras? NOM!

Great environment. It's really enjoyable to watch your food being prepared in front of you by People Who Know What's Up. It was like a sushi bar except except without the sushi. Ok, so maybe not like a sushi bar. 

The only thing that I could think of that I didn't like about this place was the cocktail I ordered. It tasted a bit too alcoholic (and I love alcohol). I forgot which one it was (because I was focusing on the aforementioned unagi sandwiched in fois gras .... drool), but it definitely shocked the mouth a bit.

Pretty good Vietnamese place for the area.

I tried the rolls and the spicy pho soup.

Pricing is good with a decent choice of meals. 
Service is good and friendly but could be a little faster :)


The place is new and very clean.

While I like the food, the biggest draw was the sauce dispenser that allowed you to use more sauce on the meat and rice. Well, that is gone and they will only give you one little packet which lasted for two bites.

We tried to get more and were told "we already gave you extra sauce" which was one packet a piece.

The chicken plate was way too dry without the extra sauce and we won't go back.
Incredible customer service and wonderful packages! The coconut pedicure included a glass of wine, and amazing massage.

Stopped in here last week for a drink after work. It was cute & clean. They offer a variety of craft beers, mainly in cans. The bartender was kind of rude in the fact that my husband had to ask 3 times for something before she even acknowledged him. She wasn't busy or talking to anyone, so he wasn't interrupting her. Our first round consisted of a shot of fireball, a corona and a Maui w sprite. It cost $16 which seemed over priced, especially for 1 oz shots. 

I don't know if we will return, but it's possible.
nice place to hangout. you can find everything you want in there starting from restaurants and bars and a lot of shops. Good for families

I was drawn in my the lunch specials and I wasn't disappointed. Great value for the price! The decor is very pretty too. The food itself (at least what we sampled for lunch) wasn't extraordinary, but it was very satisfying. I had a red curry and it was exactly what I expected. The fun thing about the lunch special is that all the components come out at once on a large plate. No waiting for you to finish the app to bring out the main, its all there, artistically arranged. I like it!  

It's bring your own wine, so I'll definitely keep it in mind for a casual dinner out with friends.

We have been to Hobak several times, both by ourselves and with friends.  The reviews are always the same...AWESOME.

The beef and pork is very tasty and of very good quality every time.  That's what I like about this place.  It is very consistent.  Not only with the food, but also with the service and the servers.  Always greeted at the door, and our wait has been very short each time.  This place gets very busy, so do expect to wait for seating.

The only thing we order are the combo dishes.  For our group(s), it is always the way to go, and we have never left still hungry.  For us, the winner is Set 3.  The taste is always good, and like I mentioned consistent every time we have been.  We especially like the salt mixture that they provide.  The side dishes are ok.  For me, meh as far as taste.  It does seem very authentic though.  The dessert, if you have room, is a great ice cream/rice krispy sandwich.  It is light and just right to finish off the meal.  We always order rice bowls and extra sides that we do like, which are all free or included with the combos.  The large runs us $100 plus tip.

The one kinda cool, and at the same time odd thing, is that you can brush your teeth after the meal (in the restrooms.)  Hygiene items provided.

Would definitely recommend, and will of course be back soon!

Honestly, the food here literally tasted like God made it with his own two hands. The customer service was so clutch I actually smiled. However, I'm really upset that one night through the drive-thru, my friend and I wanted to jeep with these cool kids in front of us, and they wouldn't let us jeep with them. I've never been so offended in my life. BUT U KNOW HOW THAT STUFF GOES. GR8 FOOD THO THANKS AGAIN

I came to Montreal with zero experience and quickly found myself lost. I stumbled into what I thought was a bar but enjoyed the BEST French toast and a ridiculous wait staff. They were knowledgeable and friendly. The Bartenders Domenic and Chris are amazing!!! Enjoy
The restaurant looks great but the food was too damn salty and the price was too high

After a return visit to China Mama more than five years since my last review, I was pleased to see that the restaurant's interior had been recently updated and the furniture re-upholstered.  And, without requesting that dishes come in sequential order, at least the soup came out first.

Shanghai Wonton Soup with a few thin noodles was good with empty open cooked wontons that slid off a tablespoon.  Steamed Juicy Pork Buns were as great as ever, releasing vinegary hot liquid into the mouth and throat with each initial bite.  And a seemingly endless vat of Assorted Seafood & Tofu in a Clay Pot served in a ceramic dish that never appeared to lose heat was very pleasant to eat, consisting of large shrimps, small scallops, hunks of well-cooked fish, and a few peas and carrots in a hot and tasty, floury broth.

Service was good but more efficient than friendly.

I still find this to be one of the best authentic Chinese restaurants in Las Vegas, and will be back much sooner the next time I dine here.

Super cute boba cafe. Nice ambiance. Boba is not that bad either! Nice to see more boba places pop up on this side of town. If only we can get more international mom and pop places for food instead of all these chain restaurants and not having to drive to the other side of the state to eat at these places. West valley has so much potential!! Anyways...back to the boba. I would come back and refer to family and friends. It's a great spot to hit up after catching a movie at the Harkins or a dessert drink after eating at one of the many dining options nearby. One thing I did notice was they use powder flavoring with some of their drinks in which I am not a big fan. Still, the drinks the Hubs and I got was delish. Check it out if your in the area :)

Best Vietnamese food ever. I'm so glad my boss recommended this place. It's a small mom and pop shop but their pho, rice dishes and macaroon ice cream sanwhiches are delicious. I am a total regular. Everyone is super friendly. I even call in my orders to go and my order is ready in 10 mins.

We live in a small town in AZ and do not have a Vietnamese restaurant nearby.  This weekend we found ourselves in the Phoenix area and just had to get our Pho fix.  The other reviews all seemed to be very positive, so we stopped into Anise Cafe.

It is a very new restaurant, Dec 2010, very tastefully decorated and extremely clean.  We were greeted by the owner who was friendly and attentive although a bit disappointed that we only wanted Pho.  Water was served with an orange slice.  Nice touch.

We ordered the Pho with rare beef.  It was huge!  In California where we ate much Pho, this would be considered a 'large' and cost ~$2 more per bowl.  It was served traditionally with all of the veggies and sauces.  The broth was very flavorful and not greasy.  The noodles and beef were generous.  It was the first time we couldn't eat all of our Pho!

The only comment I have is that I prefer my rare beef sliced more thinly and set on the very top of the noodles so that I can eat it a little more easily and a little more rare if I please.  Not a complaint, just a note.

We will recommend Anise Cafe to our friends and return ourselves the next time we are in Phoenix.  Good job and good luck to the owners!

Passed by this tiny place a few times either on my way or to lunch or dinner to the numerous great restaurants on East Fremont thinking one day I will try this juice joint out. Well the day finally arrived and did it meet my expectations, after getting over the sticker shock of how expensive juices/smoothies are (they are high priced everywhere) I learned they are worth the pretty penny you pay. The girl there was so informative and excited to educate the newby in front of her, I realized the quality of ingredients and love that goes into every cup of juice/smoothies. I forgot the name of the smoothie I decided on, it was berry based and so full of goodness and yumm! Can't wait to try the juice they will be serving during Life Is Beautiful, it probably has 8+ antioxidant powders to make you really feel healthy and hopefully clean out all the second hand Mary Jane sniffs that will be lingering at the festival.

Loved this place!! I found this salon on here, since I was coming in from out of town. I walked in on a Friday and got serviced right away. They have a great selection of gel colors, and I really love the rock star colors. My tech was very nice, as well as everyone in the salon was nice. My nails came out wonderful! I wish I had a salon like this back home, but this will be the place I visit when I'm in town!

They have the best Biryani in the Valley! Hands down. Authentic Hyderabadi
Their appetizers and curries are delicious.

Stopped in after breakfast to look at guns and camping supplies with my husband. This was my first time at Bass Pro and there's so much to look at. I liked the waterfall and all the stuffed animals everywhere. They had a decent selection of reasonably priced pink, purple, and Tiffany blue guns which I enjoyed because that's the type of woman I am. They also had tons of pink camping supplies ranging in shades from hot pink to pastel. Camping is a big thing in my husband's family so we'll definitely be back to pick up some (pink) stuff before the next big trip.

Excellent service and easy communication from start to finish! So glad I used Vegas club life to get my crew setup, so much easier than going back and forth trying to figure it all out on my own.

I reached out and let them know that we were a group of 6 guys. We wanted to do a day club/pool party one day, a night club the next day, and maybe a strip club that same night after hours. 

Someone reached out to me right away and introduced themselves. I was impressed but still unsure what to expect. They asked me a couple questions and made a few suggestions based on what we wanted. We let them know what our budget was in trying to make the most of our trip and not break the bank or wait in long lines. They let us know if we wanted tables or just a guest list with no lines, they could make it work and get us setup. They also let us know about their promo for hydration IV being provided for free with a booking. Never done this before but cool.

Now I thought maybe because we were using a third party to book, this was going to get pricy due to the convenience, based on pricing minimums I got directly from the venues. We planned for a table at the night club, and guest list or pay cover for the rest. The exact opposite was true allowing us to book a table in the day, and another the next night. 

We reserved a table for Daylight beach club. We arrived and we gave them our name at the front. No line, quick security check, and we were inside walking to our table. Felt super VIP walking in, like they were waiting for us or something haha 

The next night was our main night so we were excited. We had a table at Hakkasan cause there was a dj we wanted to see. Same VIP treatment, gave our name, security check, and walked in to our table. No line or waiting and we didn't ever feel like we needed to tip more or something, they genuinely made us feel welcome. Hakkasan was great in taking care of us and our table wasn't in the back corner, we had a good location with the dance floor being super close. 

After Hakkasan, The guys at Vegas club life had set us up perfect with a limo to take us straight to Sapphires gentlemen's club, on a free guest list. Cabs/Uber after a night club let's out, is a one hour process in itself, having a ride waiting outside for us, was perfect. It again felt super VIP getting there as if they were awaiting our arrival. We got dropped right out front, skipped the line, ID check and we were in. 

Not sure what time we got home but I know it was now morning and tomorrow was going to hurt. I almost forgot that we had a free IV hydration the next day! We had setup the apt for 1pm which was perfect since it was such a late night. I had never done this before and when they arrived and set us up. 5 minutes into it and I was wondering why we didn't do this every day we were there! I felt 110% when they left. Highly recommended!
