Best Thai in Henderson  I have them on speed dial! Don't be influenced by the location or restaurant itself. We always order carry out or delivery and it's always worth it.

Stopped here for brunch a few weeks ago. We had made a reservation but I think we would have been fine without. The restaurant is located right in the lobby, and feels very spacious and cheery. I had the Whitfield breakfast, which was eggs Benedict with a tasty beet and potato hash brown. My eggs were cooked perfectly and I really liked the chimichurri sauce they put on top! I do think their menu is a bit limited and overpriced ($12 for a standard eggs, toast, and bacon breakfast). Still, I would return for brunch or to try out their dinner menu!

Food was so delicious. Generous portions for fine dining. Service was amazing. Ambience was great. Lots of open space yet felt very lively. My husband and I had tons of fun here. We didnt realize there would be a DJ at dinner, and was a very pleasant surprise.

This is one of my favorite go to places for happy hour! They always have a fantastic selection of craft beers on tap and the food is decent. They have a solid selection of burgers, that while not the best in town, they are head and shoulders above the other breweries. They also have one of the best dog friendly patios in town, and it's a great family friendly place with lots of games and space for the kids to run around!

Three stars for the food, five for the customer service!
Stopped here on a hot day, mid bike-ride.
Neither of us had overworked appetites, more so sore butts and parched throats.
Charming appearance outside and in as well.
Greeted inside by the faint but firm presence of wood-smoke, presumably from their fireplace.
Dined on the back patio.
The lady got their hummus appetizer as her entree.
Interesting presentation, cucumbers sliced length-wise, pita, and fried plantain served with it for dipping all quaintly arranged on a sheet of slate.
Nice touch!
The plantain had been fried well in advance of the presentation, and possibly refreigerated.
Not a huge fan of plantain, and certainly not when it is fried ahead of time and resolves to it's tough, crunchy/chewy/banana/potato-hybrid self, but the lady liked it and it was her entree!
The pita either was made on premise or something as it really wasn't pita.
It was thick, refrigerated, pocketless and heavy, and not particularly flavorful.
If it was made onsite, they might either re-think the recipe or skip the effort and buy some from Aladdin's, like everyone else does.
Given a choice between the two, we both would have picked the latter 10 times out of 10.
Realizing this was serving as the lady's entree, the waitress was kind enough to bring extra pita without being requested, although due to the nature of the beast, alas, unnecessary.
In the interest of stumping the kitchen folk, I decided I wanted the greens portion of their chicken breast salad with the salmon of their salmon salad.
Waitress understood and indicated that there would be no problem.
When it came it was chicken.
They offered to swap it out, but in the interest of not having my salmon potentially spit upon by a disgruntled chef, I gratefully declined and kept the chicken.
There was plenty of it, it had been breaded with something and either pan-fried or oven-fried, then refrigerated, ok but nothing extraordinary.  I prefer cooked items to reflect their preparation via their temperature, but chef didn't ask, and neither did I.
Homemade bleu cheese dressing was wonderful, but ungenerously applied.
Got the bill, paid it, then deciding that thirty bucks plus, without tip, for an app and a salad and two iced teas seemed a bit heavy, took a peek at the bill.
What?
They showed the chicken on my salad being swapped for chicken, (not salmon), and sur-charged the swap for $5.00!!!
Unfortunately, the waitress was nowhere to be found as the transaction was complete and the patio was barren of other customers, so brought it to the attention of the lady who had aided in the serving of the meal and after 5 or10 minutes of animated activity at the register with a manager, I was presented with a new bill that comped my salad in it's entirety!
Wow!
The hallmark of good customer service is to do more to rectify a situation than the customer expects.
Burntwood certainly did this!!
Kudos to the management for the graciousness of their response!
In contemplation of what had transpired, I came to the conclusion that the kitchen had interepreted the waitress's instruction as extra chicken rather than substitute salmon for chicken, and billed the extra $5 for extra chcken.
I just thought they were attempting to justify the eleven bucks for a chicken salad with a bit more chicken than average.
Would love to see her handwriting, but a very sweet young lady!

We went here the past Tuesday for lunch and I got what I normally order since I am not a fan of pasta, the salmon entree with spinach and potatoes.  The last time I had this was probably last year.

When my food arrived, I was surprised to find that my potatoes were on a small plate while the nicely cooked salmon, placed on top of bed of spinach topped with capers and lemon and herb butter, was on another.  The salmon was as good as I remembered, but the potatoes weren't the same.  Better!  They used to come on the same plate as the salmon and was plain roasted, nothing unique.  But now, they are nice and crisp and WOW, it adds a different texture as an accompaniment to my fish and I am loving this entree more than ever before!

I usually only finish half of this entree but this time around, I finished the entire meal and yes, I was happily full.

Additionally, our waitress provided our party with exceptional service.  Her service is comparable to that of a waitress at Joel Robuchon (I know, bold statement, but she is that wonderful).

If I could ZERO STARS, I would!! I
Literally just waited for over 45 minutes & in line, THREE SEPARATE TIMES!! There were plenty of pharmacists & I went to the drive through to be told that my prescription would be 10 more minutes. As soon as I pulled one car length away, I got an auto phone call, from CVS, that my prescription WAS ready. Went into the store because now there are 5 cars behind me & waited AGAIN & was made to go to the back of the line TWO MORE TIMES!!???

UNBELIEVABLE!! And the tech who did finally check me out was snippy & short AT BEST!! Horrible & will never go there again!!

This review is long overdue! I have used Sparkle Tech for several years and they are my 'go to' team for window cleaning.  I am an extremely picky customer and do not believe in paying someone to do a job that I can do myself even when I can afford to but I cannot do the job that the SparkleTech team does.  What impressed me the most when I first starting using ST was that it is a family owned business by regular hard working folk and it was father and sons team.  I respect the legacy being built.  There is nothing more American than that and the service is thorough, professional (foot booties!) guaranteed and at the right price.  So worth it!  Screens, tracks and inside and outside and all interior mirrors in my home - done and done.  Thank you to young Jaden and team for once again impressing me!  I for one am a lifelong customer and highly recommend them!

Not sure that this was my favorite buffet, but everything was fine? Nothing really stood out to me. Had the following:
-raw oysters (only comes out at certain times)
-crab legs (cold and hot)
-brisket (terribly salty. almost inedible)
-prime rib (pretty good)
-salmon poke (ok, but small weirdly cut pieces)
-sushi 
-scallop tartare 
-eggs benedict
-and some other stuff that wasn't worth mentioning.

The wait for our party of 17 was initially 30 mins, but then turned into an hour due to everyone needing to be present IN THE LINE. Take this all into perspective from a person who probably doesn't have the metabolism required to eat at buffets anymore and finds more value in an entrée instead of a buffet.
Decent ice cream but what's with attitude each time when inquiring about flavours. I know line is long but I want to know what I am getting.
My husband and I hired this inspector in 2018. We had a negative experience. We would never use them in the future and I would not recommend this company.
David did a fantastic job helping me. He was very fast polite and professional. He saved us from the heat!
Boa buns are my personal favorite. Other dishes are nice but just don't compare to other vegan/vegetarian places around town.

We attended a private event here on the upstairs patio, which they had rented out. My review pertains to this experience, which included drinks and appetizers. I can not comment on actual meals, or wait service. 

The patio itself was cute ,with its own bar upstairs, and the ambiance was lovely at the sunset hour. Everything here is TRENDY and we liked the lollipop chicken, bacon/Ruben melts, and artichoke dip. 

The drinks were great and I liked my margaritas a lot. The bartender was friendly and made drinks quickly. I think this woukld be a great area t consider renting out for a rehearsal dinner or work event.

My husband and I stopped by for lunch after our plane landed in Las Vegas. Since we came in from the east coast, our internal clock is still ahead and when we arrived, we were very hungry as it was way past our lunch time and the places that we tried to go prior to this one had yet to open. 

We both ordered dumpling and egg noodle soup. I thought it was very tasty. They gave us plenty of dumplings and I like the baby bok choi that they put in the soup. The price here is very cheap - $5.95 for a bowl. You can't beat that!
Fair breakfast. Came here because of reviews. Unfortunately, restaurant is 'over' rated.  It was ok. Potatoes a bit salty.
Katie did a ridiculously awesome job on my nails using SNS Nail Systems....there's even sunscreen in the product!  Best French mani I've had in years Thx Katie!!!

I have stayed at Hotel32 several times over the years and am always amazed at the level of customer service that is provided.  There were three of us in our group and we had a Loft Suite and a King Connector which is absolutely perfect for 3 or 4 people.  As always, the rooms, service and the extras that only Hotel32 can provide were top-notch.  We had a problem with the sound system in the Loft and a technician was sent up right away to address the problem.  He was very friendly and was able to correct the problem; however, there remained intermittent issues with the music stopping/starting but it wasn't that big of a deal so we didn't mention it. The fantastic shower in the Loft also had a mechanical issue (I'm 99% sure it was a mechanical problem and not something I was or wasn't doing.) as the regular shower head wouldn't come on independently of the other outlets. I was able to work around the problem so I didn't contact anyone about fixing it.  Between the sound issue and the shower issue, it would seem that maybe there are some mechanical problems that are starting to creep up.  It's really not surprising since there is so much high-tech at play in the suites. The staff are always very accommodating in correcting the problems, but it might be time to evaluate the technology in each room as a quality control measure to ensure good working order and addressing any issues  before new guests arrive.  This is still a 5 star hotel and experience in my book and we look forward to our next visit.

My first sushi burrito experience and I would say it was a delicious burrito but I hated paying extra for avocado but they do give great portions of the raw fish I love. Go right when they open because it gets super busy after that. They were fast and the service was friendly. It's 4 stars because I have only gone once.

Finally, Indian Food on my side of town, and it's actually really really authentically delicious!!! From the Garlic Nana, the chili paneer, and Lamb Rogan Josh, everything I've had on this menu was amazing! Great service, very attentive staff and a full bar :)

Norton my beloved retriever loves this place and the ladies here are always happy to see him walk in the door.  They have great products here carefully selected toys and treats for your dog's health.  I love that it's locally owned and I hope they do well!

They do have gluten free options but for only 10% of the menu. As much GF pasta as there is available in the marketplace why limit it? The toppings are the biggest factor. so what if my GF noodles aren't the right shape for the topping like the wheat ones? I ordered meatballs n gf pasta. Tasted quite plain. I've had better jar sauce from the grocery store. They also forgot to put Bacon on my friends order. Do they know people get shot over forgotten bacon?. The vanilla cupcake (wheat) was on the dry side but ganache filling was delicious! 
As it is a basic chain, I will not be returning. Lots of other tastier options out there.
Tomo always been our favorite place to go for sushi but the portion and services has gone down, but it's still good and close to home

Quite possibly the best club I've ever been to.

Up even higher than I was before, now I'm on the 58th floor! This club has awesome style- the lights, the tables, the bars, and the outside deck area, everything was perfect.

They have an awesome DJ, who took requests- and ACTUALLY played them! The dance floor has more than adequate room, not to mention tons of room for gogo dancers, tables to sit at and standing room. There had to have been five bars, one was in a room I didn't even bother going into.

The restrooms are SUPER clean, and have an awesome attendant. The counters are littered with the best colognes, mints, gum and mouthwash.

I think my favorite part of my experience at Moon was during one song, I had just mentioned to my dance partner that it was getting pretty damn hot inside, and looked up to see the steam of peoples sweat rising to the ceiling, when it started to open! The ceiling is retractable, and opened up to a starlit desert sky overhead. It was probably one of the coolest moments I can remember about Vegas.

80% rock concert 20% broadway show. The boys in the band have got their second wind in life and can really play. I saw Jon Anderson the lead vocalist from YES there doing a few solos and he was very good.
Sound became a little overloaded at times, but perhaps the producers add in a little distortion so it sound like a real rock concert.

Food
Delicious. Lots of variety for a small place.

Service 
Prompt and friendly

Atmosphere
Cozy and comfortable. Hilarious how they have sticky notes randomly.

Price
Cheap. Ayce is well priced.

YUMM! 
they have a special breakfast menu that changes weekly. 
have amazing buttermilk pancakes, french toast.. eggs.. 
arrive early on weekend as the place fills up and they may run out of a few special menu items 

went with a group of 8 so had to wait for a while. but if you go with 2-4 ppl it should not be that long. 

food is very fresh, n delicious.

We LOVED our stay here. I should clarify tho, we might be atypical Vegas visitors. Non-gambling, light drinker and 2 under aged (17 & 20 year old daughters). Also, this trip was a prize won on the Ellen Show so we had a high-end experience at very little cost to us. Beautiful 2-room suite plus en suite bathroom. Larger than usual shampoo/lotion etc. View of the street. The hotel is at the far north end of the strip. (We took the Monorail one day. Turns out Uber/Lyft was a much better way to travel.) 99% of the hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The 1% was just ok, nothing bad. Great food at Umami Burger. Great coffee at Perq. I got a little tired of the minimalist details (few towel racks, hard to locate outlets, no actual closet) but all minor. EXCELLENT place to visit. Wouldn't want to live there, but that's what vacations are for, right?

Hubby and I love this place and a regular haunt for us.  My Hubby's fav: adobo fried rice and spam musubi.  My favorite: pinakbet and Thelma's special.  This is a must try for anyone craving Filipino food.
The service was great even though she was very busy.  We ordered salt-pepper park and Hong Kong pan fried noodles.  I gave it a 4-star rating because our food came warm not hot.   It was delicious.

Based on a friends recommendation we went to  BarBQ Tonite,  ordered a platter which is around $43 to 45 , comes with a variety , like fish kebab, chicken and beef. The beef kebabs were good , fish and chicken were okay !! Nan comes with the platter and yogurt (raita) comes with it too.

I wanted to order chicken biryani, so I asked the server if I could try to sample the biryani because I can't eat very spicy food, she said she will bring it but I guess she forgot.

 Its a bit pricey and the smell of the food and Masalas is overwhelming.

Laurie's thoroughness continues to exceed my expectations. I have worked with other realtors over the years yet never have I encountered one who will go to any length to help me identify what I am seeking. Laurie sold a home of mine several years ago and assisted me in the purchase of my current home. Because she is a professional designer I chose her to oversee the complete renovation and reconfiguration of my new home.  People who visit my home always remark on its design. 

I have recently begun to explore other real estate opportunities. Laurie has been of great assistance in locating and previewing potential homes for me. She has also done an excellent job in pricing my current home to sell expeditiously in the current market. 

If you are seeking a hardworking, honest, real estate or design specialist, I highly recommend Laurie Rummel.

This is one of our favorite (if not our absolute favorite) spots. The food is amazing, but what really makes this place great is the friendly and expeditious service. Richard is one of the best bartenders I've had the pleasure of dealing with. Do yourself a favor, and check this place out if you haven't already.

I love this restaurant. Have a sangria for sure. My wife and I had little peppers with goat cheese, salads, and branzino.  Fantastic. The staff was very attentive and kind. This is one of my favorites.

As far as Targets in the Valley go, this is my 2nd favorite! Target Greatland in Chandler is my favorite, but that is for another review.

While I am sure this is not the fanciest Target in the U.S., I love that it has so much great stuff under one roof. Seriously, I can get my Silk soymilk for $3.15!! The food prices are fantastic, and they have a way better selection than most Targets. I've never checked the produce here, but that is on my list for next time. Plus, here I can get all my toiletries, household items, furniture, organizers, books, and it goes on and on.......  The biggest problem I have here is that I getting shopping ADD, and I buy way more than I should.

SuperTarget, I am a fan, and I will be back! I am just sorry it is so far from my home, otherwise, I'd be here way more.
Management is really bad. Waste of time and money. They tell each customer the food is coming when it's not.

It's 8pm and I'm still thinking about the lunch I had today! It was wonderful! I was beyond impressed with the selection but mostly with the flavors! I am not too familiar with this style cooking or I would give you more details, but I tried a little bit of everything and everything was SO delicious!
Interesting dessert, personally wasn't a big fan of the flavors but it was very creamy and my friend enjoyed it. Other than that, experience was wonderful and customer service was excellent!!!!

My favorite Target! Always clean, always well stocked.
Ample parking and right in my neighborhood.
Love all the green products that Target carries for cleaning.

They have a family restroom and a changing table in the ladies room as well. However, the changing table in the women's rest room is right up against the door, so it's a bit awkward for people walking in to get around you.
This is a food truck on the CMU campus where there are many.  Has quick service and passable food, but I would make the walk to other trucks with better options.  Not my favorite.

Came in for a few drinks with friends and stayed for appetizers and entrees!  Laura's menu recommendations at the bar were perfectly on point. Come with an appetite! The antipasto for two is a great start. Narrowing down an entree choice may prove difficult, so you will have to return. The 1/2 meatball with spaghetti is a delicious traditional start, while the blackened garlic shrimp and sausage is ready to delight a willing palate. Owner Kim is sure to stop by to add a kind, personal touch to the experience. Bring your friends and family, to be spoiled by theirs!

Eat is a neighborhood restaurant tucked away in downtown Vegas with a great, friendly atmosphere.  Some excellent dishes.  Some mediocre dishes.  But it's a little hit or miss on the customer service.  

I love this place and I love that it's located downtown.  Finally, a great brunch and lunch spot in the 89101.  Finally, a neighborhood place not catering to Southern California tourists.  It's awesome.  It's friendly.  And it's become so well-known that it can be tough to get a seat.  

The lunch menu is solid--great sandwiches and salads. The grilled cheese is excellent with thick Texas toast style bread and sharp cheddar.  Simple and awesome.  Nice fresh tomato salad on the side.  The roast beef sandwich is also tasty.  Fresh and thin roast beef with bright blue cheese on perfect bread.

For brunch, there's a lot of excellent options and some that just miss the mark.  The eggs benedict is delicious.  The chicken fried steak was decent, but not brilliant--more of a kitschy choice but not particularly well done.  The main disappointment is 
the huevos rancheros dish.  It's an awkward attempt at culinary creativity with peas and sautéed bananas mixed into the savoriness of eggs and rancheros sauce.

This place has an excellent, inviting atmosphere. In a downtown focused on daytime business and nighttime drinking, it's a nice spot for the locals.  A spot to meet and spend time connecting with people.  And there's a charming porch to sit on when it's not baking hot outside.

If there's a main setback, it's that Eat can't handle the lunch rush that happens Mon-Fri.  There's so few great food options in downtown Vegas that Eat is crowded every day.  If you're coming for lunch, prepare to wait.  And try to keep the number of your party to 2 people.  The hostesses have a hard time figuring out how to seat parties larger than 2 in an efficient way.  Know this going in and you'll have a great time.

Bottom line: 4.5 stars for the excellent atmosphere, friendly service, and generally solid menu.  Minus one star for occasionally cranky customer service, long waits at lunch, and some mediocre dishes.
Dude slayed this haircut. Took his time and made it nice couldn't ask for a better barber for-real I'll defiantly refer people to you.

I chose Studio 67 because of the fact that it advertised itself as an Aveda salon. I dont really know what to say other than this was the single worst color and customer service experience I have ever received. Got home from my highlight appointment with Chris only to discover that the sides of my head were totally covered in multiple bleach lines from his poor highlight work. I called immediately and asked to go back in to have it fixed. After he tried to tone it, the lines were still apparent. At this point I'm irate as I have paid over $300 for what is turning out to be a nightmare color situation. Another stylist came over to look at me and determined the answer was to do more foils and cover up the lines. I sit for another hour while they do extra highlights. When they came out the lines were all still there. I left the salon nearly in tears with wet hair and insisted that a manager call me, as I'm pretty certain at this point I deserve a straight up refund. When my hair dried, one side is so over highlighted it's practically white, while the other side is basically brown with a white bleach stain on it. It's worse than it started. Not only has the owner not called me, but the salon is now screening my calls. I've called multiple times, left 2 messages and no one will pick  up or return. Since a picture is worth 1000 words I'm posting several. I would strongly advise against this salon unless you want to end up looking embarrassingly bad for several hundred dollars.
Well lit. Nice folks. Big lot. It can get crowded if you stop while the boaters are taking up all the space. Still, I go here because the traffic pattern works. Easy in easy out.

I recently visited Gene's to get 2 locks for my work, and encountered a multitasking Ken working solo but was still able to not only help me, but he special ordered what I needed, which arrived the very next day. This is my 2nd experience with Gene's, ( 1st as EGIS), and I would recommend them for this type of need or work anytime. A Henderson Classic.

I came here because a friend from Chicago said I had to try an Italian Beef Sandwich which is comprised of seasoned beef on a long Italian-style roll, soaked in au jus with giardiniera (Italian relish of pickled vegetables in vinegar or oil). So I looked for an Italian Deli on this side of town.

For some reason I just did not like it, I wish there was more giardiniera because all I could taste was the roast beef with the roll. Maybe I should go to a Chicago place that specializes in these types of sandwiches instead, or perhaps they are just not for me.

Next, I tried their baked goods. A peanut butter cookie, a lemon cookie, a chocolate cookie, a rasberry cookie, a sugar cookie dipped in chocolate and sprinkles, and a coconut cookie. The only cookie I liked was the coconut cookie. I ended up ordering 3 more! The rest simply tasted like shortbread cookies with mild flavoring, the flavors were far too subtle. Some almost tasted the same.

Overall everything was just okay, but the coconut cookies are worth a visit. The staff was friendly and helpful and the bathroom and store was clean.
I heard this place had the best Bubba drinks and they didn't disappoint!  all the workers were super professional and very generous.  I'll def be coming back again

I'm a huge fan of Crawfish Boil with a Vietnamese take, and Charlotte surprisingly lacks in the crawfish boil department in general. So when I saw a picture on instagram about this place even before it opened, I was really looking forward to checking it out. Turned out I was not happy with my experience! The combo A was definitely not 3 pounds! Or they probably weighted the corns and potatoes and sausages in that 3 pounds too because I had the same combo at Boiling Crab and Kicking Crab all the time and definitely had a lot more than what I got here. The crawfish was probably the size of your thumbs, why is that though, we are not that far away from Louisiana! Most of the clams were just empty shells. I asked for substitution (what we always do at BC and KC) but they didn't have that option. The bag needed more sauce for sure as well. All and all I wasn't impressed, and didn't feel like I got my money worth. It is a new establishment so I hope they will get better, but i don't see myself coming back.

Over priced...$19 for 2 burgers, fries and a drink.

The burger was served in a brown bag, wrapped in foil. the bun was soggy and not very good. The meat in the burger has no flavor. Very disappointing.

The fries, again, soggy and no flavor.

For the money, I would go the the Burger Bar instead. 

I still love IN-N-Out burger. Great food, great price.

BTW, 5 guys has posters about them being the "Best Bang For The Buck"  Not even close. 

We will not be going back.

Each team member at Hillside Unleashed is top-notch.  You can't find a better group of people to work with and care for your dogs.  Our 4 dogs ended up spending  22 days with them.  As much as we missed them the staff of Unleashed kept us updated.  We knew they had the best possible care and they were having fun each day!  Our minds were at ease and we were able to concentrate on moving to our new home.

I've been going her for 2 years now. Always see Ben and have never had an issues. Everyone there is friendly. I usually have to call ahead to get my name on the list as there's always people waiting. Great place and a great cut.

My experience was August 2015 but after getting a quote from another company, I realize just how cheated we were by Desert. I was quoted $180 to clean an empty 2800 square foot house and expected to pay $300 after upsells. Appointment was at 2 and the tech arrived at 8:30pm obviously mad he had to work late. The price shot up to $500 to use cleaning solution and not just water. It was finished in an hour and my carpets were soaking wet for our move in day and several days after.
The food was good but Vegas overpriced. That is to be expected, I suppose. Overall we enjoyed the quick dinner we had before the show we were going to see. The service was excellent!

So my experience coming to Las Vegas was great my driver was nice she was so sweet. Forgot her name starts with a T. But coming back I had the round trip so I had a 10:40 pick up and was outside at 10:20 saw a shuttle sitting there so knock on door and ask was he here to pick me up. He said no and drove off. So I waited in the front of the lobby and was not infom that shuttle pick ups are on the side of the building. I missed my shuttle and I was outside. I called and they place me on another bus. Told me the bus number. As I curb side  I saw that bus pass me by. So I called back this time I spoke with Frankie she was sweet and kind and I know I was getting on her nervous calling every min . Two more shuttles pass and I'm stuck  my plane leaves at 1:35 and it's now 12:00 . So finally they send a shuttle the guy was sweet and he talk to me and got me there on time.  I forgot his name as well but I tip him and ran towards airport in the pouring rain . Never again will I

Just had an outstanding meal at this restaurant in Las Vegas. Everything was delicious and I would recommend this to anybody. Definitely will come back if the opportunity presents itself. Our waiter Cipriani knew all of the menu items and his recommendations were spot on.

The food was ok. The beef and broccoli was salty. The wonton soup was ok. The egg rolls were ok. The waitress took a long time for our check a d there was like no one in there. The food was just ok. The food was pretty salty but I got the family dinner with my family. Sometimes I would go back but not often or everyday.
Had an awesome first experience here!! Dodd was amazing and we ended up getting free fries since they made extra

The entire experience that I had with Cortez Visual Communications was OUTSTANDING!!  I was amazed at how they were able to take a vision, revise it to make it better and then allow it to come to fruition in an amazing vehicle wrap.  Everyone that I worked with at Cortez (from the receptionist, the sales staff, the designers, and the installation staff) was extremely easy to work with and very professional.  If you want the best in all aspects of a vehicle wrap, go with Cortez.

Recommended by HRH Staff and specifically Cab Driver to munch on some very good pizza. Slice is large per piece and flavor is phenomenal.  Visit late night when the buzz is killing you too bc it's delish! Staff is friendly and very attentive.  Kudos!

I was a 1-2x per week regular for almost 3 years. Until today. I called my order in like any other day. I'm told 20-25 minutes and my order will be done. Cool. I arrive exactly 20 mins later and pay. I'm told 10 more minutes, due to there only being 2 sushi chefs on staff tonight. Meh, ok fine. 15 mins go by and nothing. I ask the ETA and am told "a couple more minutes." After 5 minutes i see my order getting bagged up...but no...one of the rolls is missing. 10 minutes later i stand up and go to the counter. "Mom" as the staff calls her goes to the chefs to inquire about my missing roll. 5 minutes later it still isnt out. I ask for a discount on the order due to the time. Short staffed? Ok, but don't tell me my order will be done in 20-25 minutes and almost an hour later it still isn't done. Three tables worth of people walked in, sat doen and got their food. I ordered my food to go 20 minutes before I even got there and this happened? Mind you, i come to this place so often that the veteran staff knows my order just by my voice. "Mom" gave me $4 for the inconvenience, but I am so disappointed. 

Food is good. Prices are ok and the wait staff is hit and miss. If you go and get CeCe as your waitress, tip her well. She bends over backwards for her customers. Anyone else is a box of rocks. And apparently being a regular doesnt mean much.

I use to go there but but their manager was rude and obviously mad because  I brought the food back,order was wrong and I wanted both items remade...besides the fact I drove 10 miles to go there, 5 miles 2 trips ended up with my money back and no food so I won't be going back there!

Just go! 
Perfect service, excellent meat quality, taste and selection. 
Side dishes are exquisite!

This shawarma place isn't eyecatching but I was surprised to get a decent chicken shawarma (with meat cut from the spit) at Saturday midnight. The chicken Shawarma ($5~) was cooked to a crispy outer layer that's golden and tastes savory. The Wrap is pretty solid and well composed. Not much leakage while I was eating it, and not deformed like a folded omelette.There was also a TV in there playing top 40 vevo music videos.

Craving some meat and remember Booker has good ribs and brisket. Came here with my family of 4 and we shared two large entrees. One full rack of rib and one select two meat. Each dish came with two sides. We got Caesar salad, mac n cheese, chili, and yam fries. We added the calamari as an appetizer. The calamari has a light batter and the squid was perfect. I believe they pan fry with onion and pepper as well, and that made the dish even better. The dip for the calamari was amazing.

For the meat we got brisket, pull pork, and rib. The rib was the best out of all the meat, it was not dry and pack a lot of smoke flavour. Brisket was good but would recommend getting half fatty and lean... fatty was too fatty but lean was a bit to dry. Pull pork was good but just overshadowed by the rib.

Service was amazing, and they were quick!

This place is a joke.

Seen it was a newer gym that opened up in Brampton, we checked out the website quickly and it said free 7 day trial was available. We figured we'd just go in and get it at the same time we'd be able to check out the facilities.

We walk in, receptionist and another guy is standing there talking. It was a bit awkward, we let them know that we were interested in the gym.

The guy who was standing there talking to the receptionist took us to the back. We tell him we're interested in checking out the gym and trying out the trial. He still made us fill out a bunch of paper work, then takes us on a tour of the gym.

We then asked for a trial on the gym, he suggested signing up and if we don't like it we can cancel, we have 10 days. We said the website offers a 7 day trial, he said that expires today (which it doesn't because it's still live right now) and he gives us a 3 day trial.

Also during our conversation, he answers his mobile phone without pardoning himself and he talks for roughly a minute while I'm there waiting for him. Then we just left after that, to be honest this place needs to hire people with some actual customer service skills because it goes a long way.

Centurylink has the WORST customer service help! They are a internet provider but yet they linked my account to an account that has been closed for 10 months and that also has an outstanding balance....WHAT KIND OF CRAP IS THAT!!!  Oh and they have this "wonderful" "chat line" that is suppose to solve your problem, yet an hour and a half later not a damn thing was solved!!!!  So guess what.....Yes I had to call in to try and get this problem resolved but then again and hour later NOTHING was resolved BUT I will get a call in the next few days with a resolution....WHICH DID NOT HAPPEN!!!!!!  So here I go AGAIN calling them up but now with an ATTITUDE. I WISHED I WOULD HAVE NEVER SIGNED UP CENTURYLINK!!!!!!!!

Another big soul food spot downtown. If you are looking for chicken, ribs, and other down south delights you are in the right place. The restaurant Is on the small side so there is usually await. But the cornbread is defiantly worth the wait outside if the door. I usually get the fried chicken wings and Mac and cheese.

Good spot to grab dinner, casual, will fill you up.
Hands down the BEST pad thai in town. It's perfectly made and the delivery speed is unbeatable. Bravo to Ping Pong thai...you have a loyal customer for life!!!!

Me and my family love coming here! The breakfast burritos are to die for and the service is top notch. We always come Thursdays and love the personal experience with the owner. They take the time to get to know there customers!

One of the worst massages I have ever had.  The Therapist did not listen to what I wanted worked on and instead decided to do what she wanted to do.  I complained to the front desk about the situation and they said "oh well" and still took my money.  Worse experience of my life.  Avoid this massage envy at all costs!!!!!
Some of the freshest and most amazing seafood you'll have. Book it now and go try out either the seafood platter or the other steamed platter. You won't be disappointed.

Unlike anything else in Charlotte!! Real BBQ, real ribs and damn good desserts!! 
I got the BBQ platter .. Awesome!! Almost too much food to eat. My date got a plate of ribs... We sucked the bones dry!!! 
Double chocolate fudge brownie for dessert...very good!!
Great service and reasonable priced!!

I hesitate giving a 3, but as almost everyone has said for some reason the customer service is really lacking here, especially when there is another bowl place less than a half a mile up the street. I really like their bowls and I'm a pretty picky açaí bowl eater. However, when I pay extra ($.75) for add ins I should get a little more than a swirl. But really why does it take so long when there are 3 people in the back making stuff? And to be told, "just so you know the wait is at least 25 minutes" before you order may not be the best wording to use to tell people your running way behind either. There may need to be some proper customer service language training done as well. 

Now I go to Vitality 1. because it's close,  2. because I don't think they add liquid to their base, and 3. because I've met the owner he is very nice, is military and supports young adults of the military, but something needs to change.  I will drive the distance to another bowl place if I have to, great tasting bowls or not.  I'm not sure if the owner reads these reviews, but someone should.  4 less than 5 stars in the last 2 months isn't good. :(
My meal looks like something I threw together in a rush at home. The meal wasn't even hot and the service is horrible. Very disappointing.

Cici, Sam, Roxi, and Chanel are some of the greatest workers here at Paradise nails. They not only did an amazing job but they had fun conversations with us and treated us like we were queens. This place is so high quality I might just move to Vegas so I can come to this salon every day.

Good pizza and junk...

THE UP-SIDE: Good pizza.

THE DOWN-SIDE:  Typical corner restuarant.  No great shakes.  (Except for the pizza.)

THE SUM-IT-UP: Go here for good pizza.
The location at Windsor and Duncan is my favorite. The flavored coffee they brew is the best flavored coffee in town.

I have been getting my nails done by Lam & his team on and off for the past few years since moving to the West Valley. I am always welcomed with friendly smiles and I have never once had a bad experience. The male tech that did my SNS dip powder full set was kind and fast pace and I am very pleased with how they turned out. The color is spot on, the coffin shape and length is always what I like, and I always leave feeling pleased with the results. See you in a few weeks for a fill!
I usually go here for lunch. Great service. Love the hostes Claudia! :) Great place.

Recently took my car repair in on an extremely busy day.  I was greeted promptly, Heidi approached with a cheery smile and upbeat disposition.  A shuttle was provided so that I did not have to wait at the dealership, which was fantastic.  The shuttle driver, Maria, was friendly and knowledgeable.  I love this entire organization.

My husband and I have both purchased and leased cars from this dealership because the Ben Brown Team goes above and beyond, every day, all of the time.  They always exceed our expectations and we strongly recommend them to all of our family and friends.

The owner LuLu is very nice, the salon is very cute, the champagne is wonderful, and my nails look great! But unfortunately, that's if and when you can actually book an appointment. It's hard to get a call back or for someone to answer the phone. Both of my appointments were 30-35 minutes late and always because of "another client." The mani-pedi took three hours due to her squeezing in other clients. My time is important too :( I sorry, but I won't be back. If she hired an assistant to manage her time and said no to late clients, this place would be on FIRE! She's adorable and has a heart of gold while trying to accommodate everyone, but it leads to unhappy customers. I wish her the best!

OMG!!!!
Cauliflower gratin! You must get this. It is just a wonderful and yummy dish! The sauce is amazing! Cauliflower is wonderfully roasted! I also indulged with the Mac and cheese sandwich. Delish! This place has been here for years and we just found out about this place thanks to Groupon! We will be back! We will make this a regular stop anytime we are in Vegas!

Called atlas plumbing for a leaking tankless water heater. Spoke to vicky and she was very nice to deal with. Called 2 other companies to check my problem out but Atlas price is unbeatable. Sean came on time and worked on my heater in less than an hour while others were gonna charging me double. Im so happy i found my company for all my plumbing needs thank u vicky and sean from atlas!

Great vibe!! I'm not a beer drinker but I went here with friends. The atmosphere is SUPER fun. The good vibes are infectious!! We ordered the pretzel board, crab wontons, salmon, and a brisket sandwich. The food was delicious. The wait staff was incredibly attentive! Overall great place!!

I go here sometimes to get certain items that I can't get at MEC.  My wife bought a winter jacket here recently and we had great service. The other day I stopped in and had this misfortune of dealing with the general manager.  Within 30 seconds of our conversation I felt rather put off.  Some of the sales people are really cool. However the GM made me not want to every spend another dime in this store.
This place is the best.  I am tired of going to places that charge a lot and never do as good of a job as I do.  No more, as I'm going here now!!

I've been going here for 5 years!  I've tried Beef teriyaki, shrimp/veggie tempura, orange chicken, and beef broccoli..all are goood!!!!! For 4 yrs I was only ordering the beef teriyaki bowl. I've only tried the other stuff this year and I'm planning to try the other stuff on the menu. My bf always gets the obento which he loves. I'm not a big fan of katsu that's why I dnt usually get that. 
The man that owns it (I think his name is Mr. Wong) is super duper nice! I love coming here after a long and frustrating dat at work bc he's soo cheerful, positive and peaceful person that makes my frustration go away.
Screw 100.5! I don't care if they bring back Jack or not...I will always hold a grudge against them for hosting right wing radical shows.....

Professional, super friendly and they also reminded me of my appointment 3 times upon my request :) .made me feel good about going to the dentist. Dr. Lee called me a day after to make sure I was doing okay. Super awesome staff!!

Service here is terrible. I guess I should have looked at previous reviews first. We went in with our three kids. My wife started by ordering "Two kid bean and cheese burrito meals". Without hesitation the guy grabs two full size adult tortillas and starts to put in beans. I asked him, "those are kids bean and cheese burritos?" he responded with a short, Yeah. We ordered the kid quesadilla as well and that was a tiny little tortilla with some cheese and folded in half. We get to pay and I told the cashier we had the three kids meals and she informed me that the burritos were not kids items. Kids can only order tacos or a quesadilla. Are you kidding me? Could any one of the three people we were ordering from clarified this when we asked twice about what we were ordering? She did inform me that they could throw the burritos in the trash and make the tacos if that was what we wanted. I know it's just kids meals but I don't appreciate being treated like a moron.

We were hungry, and we had just spent a ton of money shopping at the Miracle Mile mall.  So we wanted something cheap.

iPhone + Yelp + one $ sign + Planet Hollywood = Earl of Sandwich

It was the highest rated one dollar sign restaurant in the area, and it definitely deserves it.  I had "the Original," which is simply a roast beef sandwich.  However, their execution is perfect.  The fresh baked bread is soft and delicious.  The cheese and horseradish sauce perfectly accompany the juicy roast beef.  Dip a little mustard or steak sauce if you like, and BAM... perfection.  DAMN, I could eat another one of those right now!

Froze today cause we got there right after they opened & no heat yet!!!! Talked  to the waiter about it being freezing & he didn't understand what i was saying. Chips tasted slightly rancid which is not the norm...I hate when the waiter can't understand a word you say to him... Helllllloooo, this is America not Mexico, I want the wait staff to understand me & speak English to me!!!!!

Talk about going over and above! I love this location by far my fav one in Toronto! I either go eat at that location with my friends or family or we order it via UberEats or DoorDash. This time I did it via DoorDash. My fav things to order from there is the High Priest and the Stern fries!!! The stern fries are out of this world! Now they only had one of the two fav things on the DoorDash menu so I called the store and spoke to a Corey! Now this is an awesome person, he figured out a solution so that we could get me the stern fries even though they are not on the menu and because of the trouble he gave me a cookie! Really can't do better than that customer service! So thank you that location, thank you for always being great, from the front line girls who take the orders and fill up the pop in the fridge to the cooks who have to yell out names and surprisingly got my name right!! Thank you! Side note, momma bear orders, the Priest with the Option but does well done on the Portobello mushroom and burger, and my brother orders the Cali Classic! All great options but like I said my fav is the high priest with extra pickles! oh and the cookies are on point too!

I went back awhile ago and continue to be disappointment.  I recall when they opened up and it sounds like the management had changed the quality of the food and overall service went down hill from there.   I'd recommend folks avoid this place and look for alternatives.

WORST service possible. I will never stop by here in the morning. Especially in the morning, because apart from there only being two people working (on a very busy intersection which guarantees customers) the people working there have NO SENSE OF URGENCY!!! I like other people stop by there on our way to work, Work! Which means I don't have all the time in the world to be waiting while there's 5 or more people still waiting to be served. I have been working at my job for 10 plus years which means I have seen employees come and go at this Starbucks and their service right now really sucks! It horrible. So if your in a hurry or at least trying to get to work on time DO NOT STOP HERE!

The people here offer super service!  Our experience has been that they are happy to go above and beyond expectations to keep customers happy.  It helps that they have a useful supply of spare parts and are more than willing to use these parts (free of charge) to keep our glasses in perfect condition.  We highly recommend this shop for all glasses and sunglasses needs!

This place looks and feels like a fake Cheesecake Factory with no Cheesecakes and a menu that unlike the cheesecake factory, does not have many reliable choices.
The Pizza is actually pretty decent, but I would not recommend much else.
The drinks are over-priced and not nearly as special as they may appear.
Decent location for groups; otherwise, this is just one in the many traps in the Richmond St. area.

At first, I thought this place would be wonderful. I should have known right away it would be awful from how unorganized and incapable the office employees where. I really wanted to like this place. But I can always smell weed outside and nothing is ever done about it when I've mentioned it before both to security and management, the gate is always broken, I can hear every single move the people above me make and the ceiling squeaks when they do so badly that I cannot even hear myself think, there is always trash everywhere, the hot water doesn't last long, I could go on. They can renovate all they want but the buildings themselves are just awful quality, the employees incapable, and the majority of people renting just disrespectful and rude.

We were looking to carb-load the night before the marathon, so we took a vote, and noodles it was. It's this weird veneer of vegas flash over Chinese dive, you know, one of those places where there's a secret menu and the server wants to know if you can REALLY handle spicy. 
One of the gals tried to order the beef flank steak with noodle soup (essentially mi with tendon), and was immediately and strongly discouraged by the waiter.

The soups were the strong point -- broths were good, the wonton soup with a boatload of wontons and noodles is a Vegas steal at $10 for a huge bowl. The more generic dishes, like beef with broccoli, etc, were just gummy and salty and AWFUL.

In all my travels I have never experienced the level of service I received from this bartender. She definitely should have called in sick today, she hates her job. I saw besides me great at least 10 other customers terribly. Multiple people left, she squirted beer from the tap on someone and basically threw napkins at him as her apology. I will NEVER eat here again along with telling people at the airport not too. You have to ask for things at least 4 times and even then it's with disgust. Stay away.

First time in Phoenix friend took us there. Very nice, some traditional Italian dishes. I had the Chicken Alfredo. My wife had Chicken Marsala. Our server was Adrianna and did a great job. Would go there again.

This restaurant is absolutely amazing. It's tucked away, but this place is the perfect little go to spot for mexican food. 
It's family owned, so the genuine kindness of the staff is so welcoming. 
The food..... Omg the food.....!!!!! I got an iced coffee with a chicken taco. And they were to DIE FOR.! 
10/10 would recommend. I will definitely be going there more often!

Where should I start. Bad on every level, bitter coffee served by snarky,bitter hipsters with incredible chips on their shoulders. If I could give no stars I would. They won't last long. Don't waste your time or money, walk over to Starbucks and get treated like a person.
I ate here on Mother's day. It was a little bit wait but food is good. Reminds me the Korean BBQ restaurant I ate in Seoul. Food quality is good
In love with the ambiance of this place! Such a cute little cafe. Good crepes and DELICIOUS hot chocolate! I come here all the time in the winter.

Extremely friendly and helpful throughout the entire process; from the first phone call to pulling out of the shop with a new window tint. Not to mention that the ceramic tint looks amazing from the outside and feels noticeably cooler on the inside. They also have a lifetime warranty but I doubt that I'll need it.

Compared to other buffets that we went, desert selection was great. You won't be able to find such delicacies in a speciality bakery. However, the rest of the food was ordinary and the selection was limited. Highly recommend the brisket carve station.

Great food, drinks and service though the shop is small and dark. It was very packed and every table was filled, though it wasn't that hard to catch a table, just had to wait for someone to leave. They should open another location or get a bigger shop. I definitely recommend just be prepared

Although the place was not full to the brim busy, service was incredibly slow.  Close to an hour slow.
 Two of us ordered the West of the Andes which were reported as good.  One had the eggs and salmon which would have been better if it had arrived while the Bloody Mary still had ice.  Incidentally, poached eggs are not available probably because they might have fossilized before serving.  My Ace Burger was pretty good but not worth the wait.  There's a chance we might return but not a great one.
O-M-G!!! If you like breakfast, go to Oink. If you like bacon, go to Oink. If you like Cuban sandwiches, go to Oink. Just remember that their hours are limited!

I decided to try out a new nail salon and based on the reviews I read on Yelp, I gave this place a try.  I cannot be more disappointed with this decision.  All these 5-star reviews confuse and blows my mind. 


When we first walked in, everything was good. We were greeted by a gentleman and promptly seated at 2 stations next to each other. They asked what service we were in here for and we responded with Gel manicures. So then they took out the colors for us to chose from; my friend that I went with initially chose a pink color but when the female technician returned with the color, she changed her mind because it looks different than the display. She then asked for a light baby blue color, the technician rolled her eyes and went back to get the different color. In my opinion, changing your mind about your color selection is the least of problems. She did a less than mediocre job and obviously rushed through it. The edges of the nail were not smooth and clumpy. 

As for my experience with this place- 
I also wanted a Gel manicure, I walked in already having an idea of what I want because I am getting my nails done specifically for a wedding I am attending and I have to match it with the dress I have. I wanted white- not french tips but just plain white. The WHOLE SALON, every technician literally looked at me like I was crazy. The gentleman that was working on my nails said to me "you really want white?" It was extremely rude and everything just went downhill from there. I can understand if they wanted to suggest something better or had an valid opinion about my color selection but all they did was speak in Vietnamese about it and gave us rude looks the whole time. I may not understand the Vietnamese language, but I do understand facial expressions. Initially it made me doubt what color I wanted but it's what I wanted and it matched the wedding. Anyways, they sent me over to a different station with a women to paint my nails. She also did a below average job. As she was painting my nails, I kid you not, 4 different technicians walked by and watched and as they walked away they were speaking in Vietnamese about my white color selection. I only know this because although they were speaking in Vietnamese, they said "white" in English. An older lady said to me as she was staring at my nails being painted, "Do you know this color is very hard to do?" Which I found really rude. The lady that painted my nails didn't say one word to me nor did she even flash a smile and acted like she liked being there. 


This was a horrid experience and there is no doubt that we will not return. I should have listed to Lisa C.'s review and not go here. Do yourself a favor and go elsewhere, there are too many other options nearby than to go to a salon that seems to not care about your business.

It was my first time coming to this place and last time. Some staff members acted like the didn't want to be there. There was only one samosa option which was vegetarian and it sucked. The filling was mushed lentils and a couple pieces of potato. There was so flavour to it but I have to say the egg roll wrapping was delicious. 

For the Roti it self. I had the lamb curry roti and honestly it was ok. The lamb was great, not over cooked and I could taste it. But the spiciness of a medium was way too much. I couldn't enjoy tasting my food cuz my mouth was on fire. Even though I like spicy that was no fun. 

I might comeback to try it again but other then that nothing special about it.

An absolute amazing friendly and professional cleaning crew. Not once did I have to point out something they might have missed nor did they leave anything uncleaned. They even went the extra mile to clean stuff I didn't expect from them. Like the coffee pot! The trash cans and thoroughly dusted knickknacks.  

The house is absolutely spotless. Appliances look completely new. Our shower shines as bright as it did the first day. Every inch of the house shines. Highly highly recommend this amazing company. 

They took a little longer than expected but it was worth every dollar more. They worked their butts off and never once complained. 

Thank you busy bee!!

Bought 4 subs the topping looked dry &old ask the worker she just said wasn't busy today ask why don't you put covers over the toppings she said too busy even thou she said not busy today. I wouldn't come back here l would drive a bit further to get something fresher than this place.

Definitely a place to seat down and have your family dinner. Service is great, weekly dinner with husband and kids. Look for waiter Toshi or waitress Pink they will guide you in ordering exactly what you like and you'll have no regrets :)

For the foodies out there. This place is a 3. The quality if food is decent, but it's layered in fat and carbs that scream to expand in your belly.

For the drunks, this is a 5. Order the unlimited beer/wine/mimosas for $15 and just get wasted for 70 bucks.

Split the difference for 4 stars and a good time, if overpriced.

Very convenient if you're already at Yorkdale Mall and want to avoid the food court.

Last time we came here, it was during their peak lunch hours. Upon entering, we actually waited a good 8-10 minutes for the hostess to finish her phone call before she greeted us and found a table. We also had 3 different waitresses during that one seating. We were both not impressed especially since it was our first time at this location. 

Our second time at this Joey's location. We got better service this time around - but we also came in at 3pm on a Sunday. Food is always delicious!! I'm a huge fan of their tuna!! Ahi Tuna Club and the Sashimi Tuna Salad are always a great try.

... Sadly they burnt the bun for the spicy-bar-b-q chicken sandwich. But still great!

I read some reviews for the best pizza in AZ, and stumbled across this place, which is the closest to home.  My friend and I decided to man-date it here one night.  Got there right at the dinner rush to see this place severely under staffed.  I guess a bunch of the wait staff had called in.  We were seated promptly despite this and ordered up some of the venerated bread appetizer.  The bread was really good, i don't know if it warranted all the praise it gets but... its some pretty good bread.  I ordered the prosciutto pie and my friend ordered an eggplant parm pie (no idea how we are still friends).  They do have an interesting beer list, mostly international brews, but very good.  The prosciutto pizza was amazing; light, thin crispy.  Even the Eggplant Parmesan pizza was really good (Side Note: Eggplant Parm pizza was not good as a leftover. The eggplant turned into rubbery tires, not a problem from the restaurant, just a tip.)  

Overall: great pizza, pretty good appetizers, good service.  But its pretty pricey.

I came for my birthday and loved it. I love that whole Goodfellas vibe. I felt it walking in. I felt history and class. And I loved the simplicity. The way it's supposed to be.

We were seated in the Marilyn Monroe booth which I was delighted to be in since she's my girl! Btw they have an amazing shrimp cocktail here. So fresh and beautiful. I love having my horseradish raw where I can see it.

The Ribeye was good. It was juicy. Not one of my tops, but very good. I really liked their chicken parm which is weird Bc I went in wanting meat and then I got the parm and was able to have both! Their Caesar Salad is seriously the best I've ever had. EVER. OMG. 

The service was wonderful and the staff is so accommodating and amazing. I would definitely come back!

Good music on the weekends and it's free. However they have the worst bar service in town. You can literally stand there for 20 minutes while the bartender walks past and says "I'll get you in a minute". If they have waitress service it's much better.

I really do like the atmosphere here but right now I have been standing at the bar for 20 minutes trying to get a beer. Have been told be right with you 5 times
Pretty much what i expected.  Average service and food slow coming out of the kitchen.  Probably not gonna go back unless i have time to wait for average food.

If you are looking for a fancy hotel with a fabulous pool, gym, spa and night club, this isn't the hotel for you. 

If you are looking for an economical place to stay, that has comfortable beds, FREE parking and a $5 resort fee, this is your place. 

It's family friendly, there was a grassy lounge area where kids can run around, a gated pool (that we didn't use) and a few tables that can be used for eating food or having a few drinks. We stayed in the inner area of the hotel near the casino. It was quiet and I didn't hear people next door or outside. 

There was plenty of close parking available.  The A/C worked great, and the mini fridge was ok. It kept our drinks cold in the freezer section. 

The breakfast buffet was very convenient and was a great value for what we got.  Hotel is walking distance from the Convention center and monorail.  They have a free shuttle that takes you to Bally's on the hour, but we didn't use it because we have a child with a car seat. 

Cons: the casino smelled really bad. I went in to the bar to grab a drink and was coughing while I was waiting. The gas station up the street had questionable people hanging out outside that may question the security of this hotel, but I never felt unsafe. There was security in the entrance and I saw several staff members walking g around the hotel at all times.  They advertise free WiFi, but I wasn't able to connect. It wasn't a big deal because my phone had good enough service to stream on Netflix.
I can always rely on smiles and great food in a hurry from this location. The owner is so nice and every employee I've encountered here has been positive and professional.

Quoted me a sky high price for a repair needed on my SUV. I called around to other auto repair shops and was given a quote of $300 dollars less than what Pep Boys was telling me. They will also charge you $100 just to diagnose a problem. Don't go here unless you want to be ripped off. The place was much better when it was Just Brakes.

Central Phoenix. CenPho. Cennypoo. What am I going to do with you? Every time I think I can't possibly fall any harder for you, you surprise me with something new and unexpected that blows my mind. No, you don't have the stereotypically sexy look at first glance that Manhattan or San Francisco or Chicago do. To be honest I can barely remember our first date, which I think was when I stopped at Majerles in '98 before walking on to Bank One Ballpark to watch the fledgling Dbacks. Admit it, you weren't even trying to impress me back then, were you? I walked you back to my car hoping for a lil' somethin' after the game, but you barely even looked at me and I had nowhere to go. So back home I went, to that hot sexy young thing I was with at the time. What was her name? Oh yeah. Tempe. Wow. She was something. Back in the day, all the other cities would see me with her and glare with envy at how good she looked strutting her stuff on Mill Ave on a Friday night. 

Slowly but surely, you began to wage your subtle campaign of charm on me. Even a jaded guy like me began to notice all the little things that really matter in life. I woke up one morning and there you were with a tray in hand and, on it, Matt's Big Breakfast. I'll never forget that other time when you tricked me into wandering up Central Ave and "accidentally" stumbling across Lux. Need I go on? It seems like every other time I'm with you, I make a new discovery. The more I get to know you, the more tiny bursts of elegance and grace and uniqueness shower my senses. No, not all of them are on one street tightly bunched together like those snooty runway models New York or San Francisco, which are so uppity that I'd have to be a multimillionaire to even have a chance to really enjoy them anyway, much less afford property. No, you make me dig a little deeper, look a little closer, and do a little exploring before I'm rewarded with your precious gems. A good seductress knows how to maintain an aura of mystery about her. And you, darling, are good. 

So here I am, already having developed a pretty huge crush on you. And then you up the ante by another notch. Cafe Barrio. Barely visible, in a nondescript strip mall by 16th Street and Thomas. On a Wednesday night I walked past a crackhead through the run-down parking lot to enter through a backdoor, my suspicious mom in tow. And once again, you blow me away. The place is packed. I hear laughter, engaged conversation, people with grins on their faces, people on dates, another dude also with his mom (who actually smiled knowingly at my mom as we walked by). An entire world of urban happiness that's invisible to the commuters whizzing by outside on 16th street. What is this food? It's not traditional Sonoran, that's for sure. Ohhhh, I see: it's "modern Mexican with a heavy French influence," as your waitress put it. Sure. Find two of the kinds of cuisine I love most, and somehow find a way to combine them in one, all in an unpretentious setting 6 minutes away from my house. Damn, woman, you are good. 

I don't say this lightly. When you came out with a tray, cut open that avocado, and mixed up various fresh ingredients in front of our very eyes to make the tastiest guacamole me or my mom have ever tasted in our life, I knew the moment had arrived. I'm ready to take the plunge. I'm ready to say that I don't want to ever live anywhere else, because there is no way I could get to know someone as intimately, as closely, as sweetly as I do you. Yeah yeah, there are other fish in the sea. I know that. But you're my fish, Cennypoo.

We LOVED this place. Excellent customer service from the beginning. We were greeted and walked through the menu and ordering for our first visit. They even gave us samples of the steak and chicken. The food was DELICIOUS! The steak meat was so tender and fresh. The plate came with rice and salad and it was a very filling meal for $8!
I was apprehensive by the curb appeal.. Glad I went in. The food is very good and prices are very reasonable. I have been back many times! Great breakfast and lunch!

My juice was expired. After apologies the server replaced it (and charged me for it!!) My eggs were left under the heat lamp so they were really dry. We had to remind the server like five times for things we were missing (napkins, sides we'd ordered...) Had to ask for the bill twice and then it wasn't itemized so we could divide the bill. Also, cash only is a pain in the ass especially when you have more than 4ppl. 

It was extremely busy, but we were first to be seated (I got there early and waited in line) and we were not the first served food. 

We'd been to this location before and had a great meal. I won't likely go back.
Truly a culturally classic staple of Montreal they have amazing service and amazing service 10/10

I became a regular the first night I visited this restaurant. The Arabian platter was always my favorite go-to, it offers a great sampler of different flavors. Tonight I tried the chicken jalfrezi, and sweet mother of Abraham Lincoln,  it was a life-changing experience.   Spicy, creamy sauce,  huge tender lumps of chicken,  onions and yellow peppers. I mixed in some rice and a drizzle of lemon yogurt, and it was eye-rollingly, mind-blowingly spectacular. I am ruined.

This is a nice-casual place for breakfast or lunch with a great view of the Belagio & fountain across the street. Had eggs Benedict for breakfast & it was tasty. Not exceptional, but enjoyable. They also offered a gluten free eggs Benedict option which was nice. Service was good but not great. Good coffee!

I love this place and my wife and I eat here all the time. The service is always really good and very friendly. The food is awesome.  I would rate their Burger as one of the best in the Phoenix area. My wife claims their Cobb salad for sure is the best with no one coming close.
Really good Asian food! Super fast service and take out! Wide variety on the menu and reasonably priced! Go to take out place for sure!

We likey! Similar to long john silvers with a lil boost. If you like fried seafood and dont have much cash, Come here. Get the clam chowder bread bowl! I also tried fried butterfly shrimp with fries. No complaints. Coleslaw could have been sweeter, but im an east coast girl. Maybe ours is different.

These guys really know how to paint.  

I had all the wood exterior on my home painted (my home is slump block).  These guys did an awesome job, no over spray...which was important to me... and very clean lines.  Also, very friendly!

The only reason I gave them 4 stars versus 5 stars is that I felt they didn't power spray the exterior thoroughly enough and made them do it again before I allowed the to start painting.  After the 2nd and more thorough power-spray the home looked ready to paint.  Poor power-spraying means the paint will not adhere well and cause it to peal.  

So, great company....great painters...just inspect your exterior after preparation and before you allow them to paint.  And make no mistake, you do control whether they paint or not.

Again, good painters, good prices, good people....just inspect in stages before allowing them to proceed.
Great place and service. Had the seared salmon, ordered it RARE, and they served it RARE!!! So many establishments over cook  fish. Central did it right. Nice ambiance.

I won't use anyone else!  Stacy is amazing with my little Lhasa Apso, Elmo.  He's elderly, blind in one eye and almost deaf and had been treated poorly with other groomers in the past, with resulting bleeding paws, completely shaved, a back injury where he couldn't move for 3 days and only partially drained anal glands, causing him much discomfort.   I don't worry about any of that with her.  He loves Stacy...he hates to be groomed, but loves her.   Stacy has groomed Elmo for about 6 or 7 years now.   She does a wonderful job, is gentle and the price is very reasonable for a mobile service, where I don't have to leave home.   She remembers that he doesn't do well with the powder or anal glands, so I never have to worry about problems or reminding her each time, and he gets the short body, long face/tail cut that I like every time.   With a Lhasa, where long hair growth is an issue, she takes extra care to shave around his private parts, which is appreciated when he doesn't bring "leftovers" into the house.   He prances and runs like a puppy (even though he's 14 years old) after his grooming, showing his appreciation, too.

I just love sandwiches, and I wish I made a few more trips to this spot since I was staying in PH.  I had the full montagu and it hit the spot, perfect size sandwich but I think you can easily eat two if you really wanted to.  
I attempted to eat here again after a night partying at Prive since it's open 24 hours, but unfortunately i was unable to find it but luckily I found my way back to my room.  Prolly a good thing cuz you'd want to remember enjoying the sandwiches there.
Found this gem at a farmers market in Summerlin.  Wonderful flavor that milk, cream, and sugar are not needed.  I am looking more from them in the future.
Delicious original sandwich. I got it without the cheese but it was still amazing. Its a great hangover bite... trust me...!

Tried this nice new spot for an early lunch on a weekday which was nice as it was not busy. Physically the space is really quite beautiful. Modern and spacious. I enjoyed the food, we had the multigrain chicharron, cauliflower tostada and jackfruit taco. The trouble is - it is just damn hard to do a taco right. Every ingredient has to be stellar. And I've simply had better. So while I enjoyed the food I wasn't wowed with bright, fresh flavours and an amazing tortilla. These are the things I'm looking for in a taco! 

Granted we didn't do an extensive sampling of the menu so maybe we missed their best dish it's hard to say. I definitely would return, especially if I was just looking for a pretty space to share a few dishes if I wasn't too hungry. Of course if you're vegan that's also a big draw here - still most Mexican restaurants have some vegan options. The other issue is price. It's quite pricy for what it is. Although for the location the pricing is normal. I see it more as paying for a nice ambience and fairly attentive service. But if you are looking for the most quality taco/Mexican dish I think there are better options out there.
great all u can eat at this price, and have many choices. I have been to this place several times, their service is really good too.

Where should I begin? Alright, here are the pros: the rooms have a nice modern design with the typical vegas amenities included. However not everything in the room was remodeled and some comers were cut to save money. Connecting rooms are available (sometimes). Cons: everything else is a con. The pool, the distance from the main strip, the false advertisement, the spa and fitness center and much much more suck ass. Lots of hidden fees for the room. They tell you a total up front and then tell you a whole different total when you check out. If your lucky, or if all the other casinos are chafing more than $300 for 2 nights then you might think it's worth staying here still, but your forgetting one thing. If you want to go to any club, the drives back and fort are going to cost you more than if you just paid more to stay at a better casino. Last but not least, the room sucks as far as noise goes. You have constant noise no matter what. You will think it is your A/C but you will later find out that nope it's not. With all that said, I would definitely not recommend this casino to anybody. Not my friends or strangers. By the way, I gave 2 stars only because I feel sorry for the casino.

"I know there's a place you walked
Where love falls from the trees
My heart is like a broken cup
I only feel right on my knees"
- The Who

Anise Tapas & Grill has a bit of an identity crisis, but if you're looking for a spot that offers up Tapas, Moroccan, Spanish, Interesting Egg Rolls, Mediterranean, and Israeli Kosher Items, then Anise may be an option for you. I didn't mind the variety, though it requires several visits to get a sense of the variety of flavors. The real identity dilemma is about the space and value. Anise offers a beautiful atmosphere that you pay for by way of over-priced items.

I had take-out from here once...felt rather underwhelmed, but was coerced back with a two-for-one offer. Altogether, I tried the following items:
Drunken Avocado Empanadillas
Duo Hummus
Atun Tartare
Moroccan Fish Tajine
Pargiot Skewer
Jambalaya Spaghetti
Truffle Wild Mushroom Pappardelle

There wasn't a lot of redemption with my 2nd visit. In fact, as I paid the bill my exact thoughts were, "It's a good thing I'm not paying full price right now." There was also nothing I had that would entice me to come back. To be fair, nothing was horrible either...just nothing good enough to cause me to return, even with an offer. The group I was with on the second visit enjoyed the Drunken Avocado Empanadillas the most...but again, I don't think anyone else was really impressed enough to be lured back for a return visit.

This is an expansive convention center. Props for LOTS of bathrooms. And the staff are great at cleaning them very frequently. They also have a food court within the convention center, which is a nice bonus for those of us who attend conferences here where food is not provided. Like other convention centers, though, it is way too cold inside. Brrrr. The friendly and attentive staff make this convention center a step above the rest.

Been coming here for about a year now and ive watched the place go slowly in the wrong direction I come in around 10 o'clock in weekdays sometimes Saturdays good is great getting a little weird now that there is a new chef for instance cucumber on a blt make it good and keep it simple and it will taste amazing the customer service is where this place is struggling the servers are to busy tslkimg amongst themselves and the regulars at the bar when u walk in to a place a hello welcome in should be your businesses number 1 priority hospitality starts the moment a patron walks in to a restaurant shouldn't have to sit sit down wait 5 minutes for a server to come up to my table and ask have u guys been helped yet with no menus or drinks on the table keep the food where it's at its delicious but please retrain the wait staff they need a lesson in hospitality 101 had to add in the burgers taste like pre made frozen burgers now and the fries were the best now they're pre cut frozen fries so sad and cucumber and what looks like a balsamic vinegar based sauce has no business being any where near a blt with chewy undercooked bacon

Susan is great! I come here often and she does a good job. However, today I came in late and she wasn't there and lady upfront for whatever reason ripped me off and only gave me foot massage for $30 instead of full body massage. I am so pissed!!! I literally came in because my back hurts and my legs. So disappointed!!!!

We had a wonderful lunch at Central Bistro.  Shelby was our server and she was very attentive and helpful.  As a gluten-free diner, you never know if you're going to end up with just a plate of greens, but Central Bistro has gluten-free pasta available upon request.  Husband and I split the Kale Mixed Salad and the Garden Pasta and both were delicious.  The Kale salad definitely rivals True Food's Tuscan Kale salad -- very tasty.  Portions are very generous - we were glad we split the items.  This is a great addition to the neighborhood and they've thought of small details like the filtered water with your choice of orange, lemon or lime...decor is modern but warm and comfortable.  We'll definitely be back to try the weekend brunch as well.
