Again, the meat was not hot, no even warm and the cole slaw was not cold.  Have not decided if we will try this place again. Two ad out is probably our limit. I worry about the low temp of the meat and where it was setting -- not on a warmer or in a refrigerator.  I still prefer Memphis Championship BBQ on Warm Springs.  Everytime we try a new BBQ in Las Vegas, we go back to Memphis Championship BBQ for the St. Louis ribs.
The place to get a loose in Chinatown... a little weird inside the weird!! Jeff at the bar is the guy behind the guy, behind the guy to make your night get where it needs to get going

One word to describe Jim: honest. I called and asked for help with our irrigation system. I told him I knew nothing, the house had it when we moved in. I don't even know how to turn it on. 
He asked for my address and said he would swing by sometime and give a free quote which was nice because I didn't have to arrange my schedule. One day later, he texted me (also nice) and said there was nothing wrong with the system, told me how to work it and best if all, never charged me a dime. Now he could have named tons of things I needed and since I know nothing, probably would have done it ( if reasonable in price). But his honesty has made him my go to man for all irrigation things. Thank you!!!
My boyfriend and I come here once a week. Best sushi ever!!! And of course can't forget the great service, Odi is our favorite!

We were after a bit of lighter dinner after nearly two weeks of eating out on vacation, and were already at the Bellagio while waiting for the doors to open for O.  A quick scan of the restaurant offerings seemed to suggest that Noodles would hit the spot.

We ordered a pair of specialty cocktails, the steamed dumplings, the Szechuan Dan-Dan noodle soup and the Spicy Thai Shrimp Noodle Soup.  I had high hopes, given the decor of the restaurant and the emphasis on "Authentic regional dishes from all over Asia".  

Food snob warning:  I have fond memories of Dan-Dan Noodle Soup from visiting Szechuan province, and there's a restaurant near my home that does a pretty accurate version.  I also make it pretty well myself.  It's not hard.

What I was served at Noodles compares only in name - the flavor of the broth was extremely muted and there was no measurable amount of heat to the dish.  It needed chili oil, and I tried to get some Szechuan chili oil from our server so I could fix it, but no can do - she said the kitchen doesn't have it.  Which seems odd, being that Szechuan chili oil is a key ingredient in this dish.

I'd liken it to serving pho without having Sriracha and hoisin sauce to dip the meat in.  It's edible, but would be missing an expected set of flavors.

After a little prodding, our server did bring out a dish of the house chili oil, which was chopped green/red jalapenos and garlic in vegetable oil.  It helped a little, but it doesn't exactly replace the complex flavors or the numbing sensation of Szechuan peppercorns.

The wife's Spicy Thai shrimp noodle soup was similarly bland and would have benefited from some additional fish sauce and Thai chili pepper.  She wasn't very happy either, but she doesn't feel a need to go off on a tirade about it.  That's my turf.

Authentic?  Not one bit.
Palatable to the average American?  Sure.

I did get to pay more than 50 times what a bowl of Dan-Dan noodle soup costs on the streets of Chengdu, and almost twice what it costs at home. So it had that going for it at least.  ;)

I should have pulled the car from valet and driven to Chubby Cattle instead.  Oh well.

This is by far my favorite location!! The staff and atmosphere is fun and welcoming. My son will play ping pong or sand bags while we wait for our food. I'm a healthy eater and their salads are super fresh and love all the items they use pears or pecans!
Most recently we were there and my son had a sticker for accomplishing something great at his school. The manager noticed and offered him an ice cream scoop for his achievement. I felt this really showed how the staff is involved with their customers. Love this place!

Came in just to check out the store and ended up walking out with a new ball. The employees each went above and beyond in order to help me work through my various options. Very knowledgable staff who genuinely care about the customer and their needs/wants.

Isn't it just typical of Verizon to have sent me this reply to this review last week, only to not reply to me like they said they would. And since customer service is one of major nits with these people, for me, the ball is in their court, which they have failed to return:

"I am very concerned about your experience with our company Chris! I apologize for the inconvenience you had with your upgrade as well as the service! Allow me the opportunity to restore your confidence in Verizon Wireless. You deserve the best customer service and I am here to give that to you! I would like to address your concerns with the dropped calls and provide you information about your upgrade. Please reply back with your full name and mobile number. I will contact you to better assist!"

I gave them my name and number last week, and have not heard back from them. And, I'm not going to go chasing a lame duck. And, now that I read that Verizon donates millions of our dollars to political special interests (which don't have OUR best interests at heart), it just keeps nailing the coffin shut for me. Yes, other big name mobile communications companies use their huge profits for political influence, but almost everything about the way Verizon does business, and fails in its service approach puts them at the bottom of the list behind AT&T , T-Mobile, etc. These companies are dominating our lives because they know, or figure upon the fact that we can't do without our mobile devices. But, what if we all took that power back, and formed a union, and jumped ship en masse? We would bring them to their knees. Who's with me?

And hey, Verizon, how about no more mandatory software "upgrades" that actually slow my phone down and mess it up, with lost settings, that simply pisses me off! And, when will my phone ring when the ringer is turned on? Should I ask for a rebate check for the myriad of lost and deferred calls--some which have cost me a potential client? And, are you going to make good on your promise of a free upgrade to iPhone4S, or was that all golden carrot-dangling mularkey?

Update: 8/19 -The customer service rep who responded below, just like the last person, asked for my info to get right back to me with, and of course, never did. Or, maybe she tried, and the phone never rang, being Verizon. I think I am going to sue Verizon for all my money back + damages. $97 x 20 months = $1,940. Anyone want to start a class action suit with me?

Best meal we had in Vegas (and way better than Chef Ramsay's steak, for about 20% the price). The service was excellent, and although I didn't particularly enjoy the ambiance of sitting at the edge of the casino, I'm sure you could sit more 'in' the restaurant to enjoy it more. 

That being said, the scallop dish with potato and bacon moat under it was heavenly. Each bite on its own was wonderful, but combined wax a little symphony in your mouth with each bite. The shepherds pie is good (if you like lamb), but the Caesar salad was just average. 

This is a great option to try some of Chef Ramsay's food influence and ideas without using hearing protection & dropping a mortgage payment over at Steak.

Have been here several times.  Ordered pazole freshly made, served with with onions, cabbage,  spices and your choice of corn or flour tortillas. Also ordered a carnitas quesadilla. Chips with beans and salsa were also served.

The pazole was very tastey and flavorful. It was not greasey and full of tender pork and hominey with the added cabbage and onions. Need to watch for the bones. The quesadilla was very good. Orderrd some sour cream and guacomole with it. The chips with beans were not very good. Beans were cold and chips were a bit soggy. 

Placed was packed on Saturday afternoon. Great selection and unique dishes such as birria (goat) stew.

What can I say it is all M&M and the ran out of the cherry flavor so I was a little late. This is one of the fun stores and I love bringing people here because there is something for everyone including clothing, toys, household items, trinkets and of course M&M. If you ride the monorail they have a coupon book that has a 20% coupon in it and you can use it toward a discount on the full purchase. I would highly recommend asking the sales associates about the latest flavors which currently is the caramel and birthday cake. Upcoming soon will be there Holloween flavors such as pumpkin spice and candy corn. Everyone here is great and they always provide top notch service. The kids go crazy in this store so I highly recommend it.

First off, I want to know what kind of royal buffets some of these people are going to. MORE is by far one of the best buffets I've been to.

My husband and I went for a Friday lunch. We got there about an hour and a half after they opened and we thought it was going to be busy already. We walked right up, paid and were seated. I love the layout of this buffet with all the side dining areas, I mentioned to my husband that there were a lot of people here but it was so quiet. They have it spaced out that it really reduces the noise level and you don't have to yell at the person sitting across from you.

The place was clean, we didn't see anything on the ground or food on the counters. The employees were making sure the food didn't sit, they were walking around stirring and changing out spoons. Usually when I go to a buffet I pick up a couple of plates that are still dirty and put them to the side, not once for either of us.

Our only complaint was the gentleman at the meat counter, my husband said 4 times pork sausage and the guy repeated it and then cut him a piece of turkey and was trying to hand it to him. I ended up taking, I wanted it anyways but he got an attitude when my husband told him, "No thank you, I had asked for the pork sausage." Then when I came back to get another piece of turkey he was standing chit chatting with a woman and he watched me walk up and he stayed there for about 45 seconds to finish his conversation. He never greeted me and said he would be right over, just stared at me when I walked up. Very rude. Had he said he would be right over I wouldn't have taken a point away from them.

Other than that, all of the food was cooked properly, everything was presentable, everything was clean, and for the most part the employees were all nice and greeted us.

First time here at BlackGold Cafe. Got two matcha green latte, red velvet cup cake and chocolate avalanche. 

Start off with the latte, pretty disappointed with how they filled up my latte and the difference in taste between the two cup that I got. The one I got was pretty diluted. 

Chocolate avalanche prob my favour. It was so good! I'm not a big fan of chocolate but this is by far the best chocolate pastry I've had. 

The red velvet is cup cake is good. 

Def go back for the chocolate avalanche. But not sure about the drinks.

Bacchanal Buffet is the ultimate buffet of all buffets.  It has been on my list of places to visit.  I wanted to eat here for dinner when I was in Vegas several months ago for my birthday, but the wait was over 2 hours.  And we had a show to catch, so ended up eating somewhere else at the time.

This time around, we came here during brunch-lunch hour.  The wait wasn't too bad at that time-like 20 minutes?  There's 2 lines: one line is for paying to get into the buffet, the second line is to get a table.  We were debating getting the Groupon, where you get the VIP breakfast experience for two, but decided not to get it.

They have so many different varieties of food.  I tried a little bit of everything: dim sum, prime rib, roasted duck, clams, sushi, creme brulee, flan, etc.  My favorite was the prime rib and there was this speciality dish of pork belly on top of squash and another similar one with short rib on top of mashed potatoes.  They also have fresh fruit juices-my favorite was the guava juice.  Their dessert selection was so good also! So many varieties!  

Overall, its a great place to eat.  I would come back to eat here again, but during dinnertime.
Kilt lifter is delicious and great before a flight! The food ain't bad either. Bartender is kinda shitty but it's whatever

Didn't even get to have an appointment.  They were in a big hurry to schedule me for an appointment, but neglected to mention that there are 2 offices. So naturally I show up at the "wrong" office and get told to either wait 2+ hours for a different doctor or hie over to the "correct" office.

Odd how if I miss the appointment they'll charge $50, but when it's the office's screw up I don't get to skip the co-pay. I'll be going to San Tan Foot & Ankle from now on!

When you live in Las Vegas, friends and Family come to visit you. They always expect  you to take them to a great restaurant. I always pic Yonaka because I know it is different  and they will never see so much creativity and flavors.

So glad we finally went here. Close to home but never tried them. Only had cocktails today but checked out the menu and will be back for food. Lots of choices and what we saw coming out of the kitchen looked good. Breezy today so stayed inside but patio looked awesome. Will be back.

I have been a long time customer at this location.  Luckily even when a therapist I liked departed there was another great one on staff.  After not going for almost a year after my previous therapist parted ways with the company I went back.  I asked the front desk staff member who has been there since before I started going who she recommended. She actually gave it some thought and called me back later that same day.  She suggested Ryan, so that's who I made an appointment with.  He is AMAZABALLS!!   I have a weekly standing appointment with him.  He asks questions and actually listens to you. I also get my facials there.  Stephanie is brilliant!   The recommendations that these two give are always helpful and relevant. They are not just trying to sell things.

California club : bomb. Turkey club : good. Regular side salad : okay. Protein burger early bird style : eh...too spicy but probably to hide the fact that the quinoa black bean party is extremely bland and dry. Green tea and breakfast buzz were delicious too. Quaint spot, very small, has a drive through but you should dine in or you'll be in line forever. People are saying it's one dollar sign but I think it's on the expensive side...maybe for the type of food it might be one dollar...or considering it's Scottsdale it's pretty cheap lol.

TERRIBLE!!! My aunt had her wedding China shipped from PA to TX with this company. They gave us a date of delivery, but arrived in town at an earlier date when I was not home. The delivery man left town since I could not meet him on that one day. They took the China back to PA and shipped it UPS. The boxes arrived very banged up and needless to say, many of the pieces were broken. The boxes just said Don Farr, nothing said fragile. When unwrapping, several of the dishes were wrapped in the paper five at a time. No wonder they broke! So sad...

The spa area is not very big or modern, but 8th is usually empty and quiet and relaxing. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful, which I was pleasantly surprised with. To top it off, I had the 50 minute classic massage with Iryna. Now I have been to almost every spa on the strip and a massuse as good as Iryna is very difficult to find!! She was friendly and knew all the right spots and pressures. She was not overly talkative but still made you feel very comfortable! My back is a mess as I am in the medical field and stand for long periods if time, and I could immediately feel the difference after her session!! I am a local and will not only be going back for her very soon, but I highly recommend her to anyone who wants a treatment.

A few friends were discussing how dismal so many pizza places are here in Vegas. As the topic shifted to places that are worth a try, one friend recommended Cugino's near UNLV. My wife and I stopped in about a month ago was was VERY pleased with the pizza they served. We just stopped in again today and was equally pleased. I have lived here for 8 years and this is serioulsy one of the best pizzas I have found in the valley. If I remember correctly they make their own sausage. The crust is fantastic, hand made, a nice crispness, even the smell alone screams quality. We have also had the bread knots and the toasted/fried ravioli. I havent seen toasted ravioli on a menu since I have moved here. Everything has been delicious.  We are looking forward to exploring other aspects of the menu, including some things we are not familiar with, but must be more popular on the east coast, including rice balls, and Jamaican beef patties. They also sell various sauces, olives, homemade sausage n' cookies, and other Italian goodies for the kitchen. Pizzalicious!

Service was excellent, food was really good, and beer was good.......but not great. Perfectly situated in town and has fantastic outdoor seating. Don't buy the baby/kids onsies though, they do not fit well.

Once again my ancient pipes were acting up. everything was backing up in to my bath tub. I called 4 plumbers this week, the first one refused to work on my problem (he's getting a special review), of the remaining 3 only Freddy returned my call today. 

Freddy arrived in the time frame he said he would, dressed appropriately, and was very courteous. I showed him all of the special plumbing we had. Unlike other plumbers I have used in the past he listened, didn't complain or curse, even though he had to spend a couple hours on my roof in the searing heat. 

His quote and final price were reasonable and the same. There were no surprise charges.

Dr. Naik goes above and beyond, taking her own personal time to reach out to patients. She actually cares about her patients and it shows in many ways. The staff took their time to do a great job and the new hygienist was the best I have ever had! I feel lucky to have found such a wonderful dentist. If you have an opportunity to have Desert Sky Dentistry work on your smile I can promise you that you won't have any regrets.

I've had bad experiences at other dentists in the past so I know what it takes to be the best. Dr Naik has nailed it! I don't have any complaints.. She's hands down the best!

3 stars for being a nice hangout place.  Really 2 stars for the food and drinks.  Tried the chocolate malt coffee monsoon and it was nothing spectacular.  Did not care to finish my drink.  The cupcakes I had here were a bit dry.

Good riddance to bad burgers.  On August 31, a new purple banner with the name "Kopper Kitchen" covered the Lick's signs, and they posted a new diner type menu on the door.   Time for the rest of the chain to go away.  Pickering needs Five Guys, Fatburger, Smashburger, or Shake Shack (a man can dream...) rather than this joke.

I can't comment on the restaurant itself because I experienced their food through a catered event. However, the food was quite delicious and I look forward to visiting the location sometime soon. Since it was catered, the food was spread out buffet style and I was able to try a wide variety of options. The flavors were quite delicious, and while there were a few items I didn't particularly enjoy, the others made up for it. I happily went back for seconds!

We have been to Mercuri for "MTL à TABLE" and we were underwhelmed to say the least. The appetizers were good but it was downhill from there. 38$ for 2 slices of steak, 30$ for 5 raviolis, and their ribs were very rough if you could find the meat at all. My friends told me it was amazing one year ago but it has obviously gone down in quality. We gave our feedback to the waitress but we never heard anything back. A real shame considering the venue is well put together. We will not be back.

Visited JOEY for a business dinner with three guests from out of town. 

I hate to start off a review with a constructive criticism, but it is really one of few such remarks about my experience: Service at the hostess booth can be improved as the young ladies there look dazed and confused about what is going on and take a significant amount of time to recognize and greet customers. JOEY's weakest point would be our first interaction with their staff here. Otherwise our experience continued quite positively.

Ordered some drinks and beers that were on special -- all arrived rather quickly. 

Shared the yam fries and artichoke dip to start; both were quite delicious and we polished off the crumbs off the plates. 

I ordered the 12oz. New York -- cooked to perfection and accompanied by delicious sides. If you're hungry and a meat eater, you'll love this. (8/10)

Fellow diners ordered the Bombay Butter Chicken Bowl (guest said it was mediocre), Herb Crush Salmon (guest said it was excellent!) and the 7oz. CAB Sirloin (also excellent). 

Our server was incredibly friendly, helpful and fun!

We ended the meal with a shared molten lava cake which was amazing!

Dinner is on the expensive side for a chain restaurant, but the experience, quality and service are worth it.

I came here near the end of last summer, and I must say that the food wasn't the best I had. I ordered a burger that was dry and completely flavorless. It was as if they pressed minced meat, put it on the grill, put the patty in between two stale buns, slathered some ketchup on it, and voila!

A restaurant in such a lovely location with such a spectacular view should have food that accompanies the senses.

Mind you, I haven't tried all their food, so the rest of the menu could be better!

Came here a few times before and it has never disappointed me. Food is always good, I love their pizzas (my favourite is Neptune). I tried their pastas and Mac and cheese before and liked those too. Service is always super prompt and friendly as well. Will definitely keep returning  ( $10 pizza deal on Mondays is an amazing deal!)

Quick, easy, and DELICIOUS.  Gyros are good, fries are made just right... pita bread-to-meat ratio is spot on.  I prefer their honey mustard sauce and love the fact that they make it available for you to add just the right amount.... I usually don't pay more than $7-$8 for a combo.

My only regret:  I didn't have more of Zorba's as a student.

Amazing place. I decided to get my first piercing and as it was in a sensitive area I wanted to research where to go. HTC was a place I immediately trusted and had profiles of their piercers. I decided Kat was the one for me and went down. I and a friend went down to get piercings. It was a very professional place and very clean, which put me at ease.

Once back there Kat was amazing. She was professional and personable. As I was getting a genital piercing one could easily become uncomfortable but I didn't feel so at all with her. It was amazing and I trust her wholly. My friend got an industrial and was happy, but I can't speak for her. 

The only downside is being on Mill Ave it is busy and can take a while.

Looked on the app to see if item was in stock in the store and it said it was, when I drove all the way over there it wasn't even there, so i bought something else and then when i showed them my $10 rewards coupon it didn't work and they didn't even try to fix it, they just said it's not working and made me pay full price.
Delicious, we really enjoyed our dinner, service was amazing, and the waygu  steak was the best steak I have ever had.   We will definitely visit this place again next time we come to Las Vegas!
Super good pizzas, I loved my combo.  My kids could pick their own flavors, and it was fast.  I love this place!
Good food... good service and pricing!  Especially during 4-7 happy hour! Nice seating indoors and out!   Well managed - we will return!

This is the second time I've used these guys and thought ti was high time I wrote a review. Both times were for repairs of a chipped/starred windshield. The mobile service came out on time and performed their work quickly, and successfully. Price was $60.00 which seems to be a very good value.This last time, while the service tech was waiting for the repair to dry & harden, he washed all of my windows and vacuumed my interior without asking and without me even being present. Phenomenal service -- thanks!!!

Everything was really good. Hibachi chicken was delicious. Wonton soup was awesome and so were the egg and spring rolls. The fried rice was great and one order could feed 4 people. They are working on getting their liquor license, but you can bring in your own. The staff was very attentive and nice. Very clean restaurant and looking forward to going back soon!

I literally have them on speed dial. I've pretty much tried majority of their menu items but completely agree with everyone that said the dynamite roll is by far the best. It did however slightly increase its prices but you still get value for your money. Because this is more of a take out place, I call 5-10 minutes in advance and its always ready by the time I get there.

One of my favorite bars of all time...period! 

Cheers - In rememberance of Andy
Here's to you buddy!

A wonderful gem with prime location in Paris Hotel & Casino on the Vegas strip and a gorgeous patio overlooking the breathtaking Bellagio fountains, Mon Ami Gabi serves up a delicious French menu. I have had the pleasure to dine here on multiple occasions both inside the restaurant as well at the outdoor patio seating. 

Steak frites - they have a great selection of different preparations of steak frites. I really enjoyed this dish, the steak was cooked well and enjoyed the crispy frites.
Escargot - it was a treat to enjoy these piping hot snail appetizers. Cooked in butter and fresh herbs.
French onion soup - one of the best French onion soups that I have had. A savory flavor with sweet onions, bread and melted cheese.
Chicken liver mousse pate - this dish is my favorite. creamy texture and delicious flavor. Served with tasty burgundy red wine mustard and cornichons, which add a nice sweet and sour touch to the pate. Comes with delicious crispy bread slices, also goes great with complimentary baguette and butter.
Sangria - cool, sweet and refreshing. Perfect to enjoy while dining out on the patio on a warm and sunny day. 

The service is professional and prompt. They checked in with us regularly to make sure we are doing ok and asked if we have additional requests.

The restaurant is spacious and it gets very busy during lunch and dinner time. Make sure to arrive early to avoid long wait times. You can make a reservation on open table and Yelp!

Overall I love Mon Ami Gabi. Great French bistro with a generous menu of delicious food and drinks, amazing views of the Bellagio fountains from the patio. I could sit there all day. I will definitely return in the future.
Food is good here. I like their lunch specials as It comes with a yummy spring roll and dip. Their Pad Thai is so good. Decent price at lunch. Staff are super friendly. I highly recommend.

Best breakfast ever. Although, the cinnamon bread was a bit burnt, it still tasted great. They have the freshest fruit and delicious jams. Their bacon was pretty good as well. This is NOTHING compared to IHOP. I usually get a weird aftertaste with IHOP pancakes but not with the food here. Although, there was a bit of a wait, it was totally worth it. I don't remember the name of the item I ordered, but it came with cinnamon bread, an egg (that was rather small), bacon and fresh fruit. It was very filling and all around delicious. I tried my bf's crepes and although I can understand how they can be rubbery, they were not overly sweet like the ones I've eaten in America. I would def. come back again!

I have only tried the shaved ice but it's really really good! They just opened and they are very welcoming and professional! I will come again soon because I love me a shaved ice. I will try the ice cream next time and update the review!

I love coming here for their fresh juices and sandwiches they have a full variety you could take it to go or you can sit down and eat.    Great customer service and whenever I'm in the area I make it a point to stop by

I'm going in with a good solid 4 stars. I will say I went for lunch and only had the salad bar ONLY,  which I might add was a beautiful lunch! the salad bar was only $15!!! .. which was more than plenty and I didn't feel as if I were missing out on all the gorgeous looking meats that came out..(will go back for that sometime for dinner) Great ambience,   Way more personal than Texas de Brazil much more enjoyable,  the servers were more than happy to please.. Good wine list! Great just great!

Jacques Brel is alive and living in Cleveland, in 5 magnificent restored theatres that are the pride of a city that nearly lost its soul but somehow found the means to grab it back.

Cleveland boasts the 2nd largest theatre district in the United States, after New York's Broadway district.   Can you believe that?  The rescue and restoration of Playhouse Square, a collection of 5 classic and opulent old theatre properties on Cleveland's near east side of downtown is perhaps the most significant and certainly among the proudest moments in Cleveland's post World War II history.  

The State, Palace, Ohio, Allen, and Hanna theatres, clustered around this end of downtown a few blocks east of Public Square, opened in the early 1920's, and saw a heydey through World War II.  But all 5 had fallen into disrepair and disrepute just a couple of decades after the end of the war as Cleveland's residents fled downtown altogether for suburban living.   

The magnificent theatres were threatened with demolition for bland commercial projects or surface parking lots, but when it seemed their days were numbered, civic groups struggled to save them and finally won control of 2 of the theatres.  They restored the facades and lobbies and then worked on the grand theatre spaces.  A landmark moment came when the play Jacques Brel is Alive and Well and Living in Paris opened in the lobby of the State for a limited run that eventually lasted 2 years.  

Jacques Brel helped feed momentum and over the course of a decade Playhouse Square Center was formed, money was raised, two more theatres were purchased, and a 40 million dollar renovation project finally restored these theatres to their former glory. The Hanna soon joined the group, and Playhouse Square resumed its rightful role as the cultural centerpiece in a glittering Cleveland crown that already boasts the best orchestra in the United States, a magnificent art museum in a grand collection of museums, and one of the oldest African-American cultural centers (Karamu House).

If I have one quibble it's that there is not much local theatre originating here, but the 5 theatres in Playhouse Square's program host hundreds of events every year and play a major role in keeping Cleveland's wonderful heart still beating.

Chang Eye Group is quite good.  I've been here several times, as have several members of my family.

They have a large facility with good equipment.  This translates into better eye care, I believe.  I see Dr. Weatherly, and she is excellent.  Not only is she very knowledgeable, pleasant, and professional, she takes enough time with me to answer my questions.  During the eye exam itself, she is very patient as she works through the "better now, or now?" bits. 

Their eye-glass boutique is pretty large, but I've not purchased anything there, so I can't really comment.

I very much like the ambience of this restaurant where it's laid out and what they've done with this space. The second thing that strikes you as the friendliness of the staff how they greet you and how well they remember some of your preferences and make suggestions. I really think the food is outstanding as it honors Italian tradition but is still innovative and uses dishes and Inspirations from all the different parts of Italy!

Came here while vacationing in Scottsdale and it was delicious! Great clean atmosphere, friendly staff and great selection! I got the Colorado scramble and it was so good! Fresh, eggs cooked just right! Highly recommend coming here!!

Great food, Beautiful ambiance and Friendly staff - Now that's a recipe for a fantastic restaurant, and that's exactly what you should expect as you walk in the doors of Pattaya. 
It's so hard to find authentic Thai cuisine without trekking downtown, but no more, Pattaya has filled the gap. 

As we walked in we were greeted by friendly staff and we requested to be seated by the window (with beautifully draped curtains - perfect for a date night) and they accommodated with no hesitation. The interior was simple but elegant, and they pay a lot of attention to details (there were designated glass place holders on each table!!). 

Note worthy moment: We asked one of the staff to take a picture of us, as we were celebrating a b'day and he did. But he went a step further by asking if it's ok if he took a picture from outside the restaurant of both of us since we were seated by the window. Now that's customer service - Going over and beyond to satisfy customers!!! Two thumbs up! :)

With regards to food I'm going to give Pattaya 5 full stars! It's up to par with the Thai holy grails downtown. The squash fritters were so crispy and fresh with a delicious sauce, and the presentation was beautiful. For mains we ordered Holy Basil Chicken and Curry Pad Thai w/ Chicken and they were both perfection! I really wanted their Mango Sticky rice for dessert but we were stuffed by then. But I shall be back, so no worries! :)

All in all, Pattaya is definitely worth the trek to the East end if you're not from this end of the town. It is rather small for a restaurant, but they have optimized the space to seat as many as possible comfortably. Do give it a try!!

The food here was great, the prices were great, and the wait staff was great!

I ordered the chopped salad, one of the best that I have had, me and my spouse split the salad so it is certainly enough to share if your having an entree. 

Also order the lasagna, I like cheese but not a "cheese lover", so for me it was a bit cheesy, but for those of you that love cheese you will love this...they were very generous.

We also had the spaghetti bolognese, it was absolutely delicious, the pasta was fresh and thick, you can tell it was home made.

Since I the took the spaghetti to go, I was able to mix my with my lasagna and it was great.

I also love that the prices are reasonable.

I will certainly go back, can't wait to try other items off the menu.

This is my second time coming back to this place and both times, it was great!
It gets really packed in the evenings which seems like a good sign. I do prefer this pho place over the other one across the street.

Portions were large and everything tasted amazing. I got the grilled pork vermicelli (the usual for me at any Viet style restaurant) and it didn't disappoint. The grilled pork was really yummy, lots of noodles along with it. They also have really yummy milkshakes.

I'd definitely recommend this place and will be coming back myself.

The chicken was cold and really sour. I was hoping maybe it was just a random bad piece... I was wrong. Half of it was cold and the other half was mushy and barely warm. The server also had a terrible attitude, cursing under her breathe, and rolling her eyes at co-workers saying they did this and that wrong. I was already next in line and I figured give his place a try. The soup's spinach was fresh which was the only saving grace. When I received my food, I asked where the utensils were and a server just pointed. No looking you in the eye and saying anything, very poor experience. AVOID if you can.

I can not say enough about All Pets. Dr. Marsh is a caring and very knowledgeable vet. His passion for animals is evident as soon as you meet him.   His staff is friendly and courteous, the office bright and cheery.  If you are lucky you will get greeted by Nigel, the resident cat!  I had issues with my cat that another vet could not figure out.  I brought him to see Dr. Marsh and upon examination and x-ray he was able to find the problem and offer a reasonable solution.  I would never go anywhere else!

Not happy with this place. It looked good but watch that they make your food then touch money and cash register without removing gloves. Ensure they take them off from the previous customer. If you order the soup of the day ask to see it first. I was told it was vegetable and the picture on the board looked very hearty, what I got had nothing but broth? When I asked about it they said it was blended in. Tasted blah!

Excellent burgers, one of the best burgers I have had in a long time. Home style freshness and filling.
Pineapple garlic aoli is amazing.
Bento are great. Garlic chicken wings are perfect.
Mauna Pua and Pork Hash are made to order!

I noticed this place a few months ago and made it a point to one day check it out, today was that day.

I walked in and immediately could hear Hawaiian music playing over head, already giving me the feeling of nostalgia of being back home in Hawaii at a local Mom & pop restaurant which is very much like being back in the islands.

The restaurant is small with a few tables, aloha shoyu can be seen on all the tables, another detail to make a Hawaiian like me feel at home.

I perused the menu & ordered the large fried plate, 15 pieces of pork hash, & J's bento.

The cashier will make you feel like family & the wait for the food wasn't very long though they did have quite a few patrons.

I have to say the food is very good.

J's bento includes chow fun (very local to Chinese food in Hawaii), Redondo's hot dog, mochiko chicken, and teri beef, all sitting on a huge portion of rice.

The fried rice has all my favorite things, char sui, egg, spam, etc...if your one person, perhaps you should consider the smaller portion as the large is perfect for two people.

15 pieces of pork hash. Traditionally, pork hash (a type of potsticker) are usually in small bit s size pieces- but these are huge in portions. If your ever having a Hawaiian potluck, this would be my recommendation!

I'm excited to try other dishes on the menu.

It's not a big menu with tons of selections, I like that they are keeping it simple without so much confusion.

Poke, cone sushi, long johns, Kalbi, teri beef, & island style chicken is also available.

If your in the area & craving some Hawaiian fare, I would recommend this place!

I will be ordering from them again in the near future. Perhaps you may also!

:)

Michelle and Modern Mama Doula Services is/was fantastic. After much prodding from a dear friend of mine before I attempted my VBAC I decided I would reach out to Michelle at the very least for placenta encapsulation.  Michelle urged me to meet with her just to see if we would be a fit for doula/client services and I thank God she did.  Michelle helped not only myself, but really put my husband at ease for all the things that were going to come with having a VBAC birth.  You see, neither of us knew what to expect and Michelle really was there for every stage. Not having my mother living near me, Michelle became that mother figure I so needed during my birth. She was the encourager and the help to get me to refocus when I was getting a little too lion-ness with my voice (my husband will tell you I was LOUD lol).  I literally cannot imagine doing it without Michelle.

Oh, and then came after the birth! Placenta encapsulation...if you haven't done...have another baby because boy are you missing out--that stuff is like nectar from the Gods. Then the salves, the nursing help and even just the comfort she provided was amazing.

Thank you Michelle for all you do for us momma's. I'm so grateful for you and will definitely have you again!

Went to Dr. Hankins for a breast augmentation. My body went through quite a change; starting with a small B, going to an almost Double D while nursing my baby, to deflating to a Double A when all was said and done. I hated taking off my bra, I felt so uncomfortable in my skin. I didn't feel like me. I went in with the notion of not necessarily wanting them bigger so much as wanting them back. Dr. Hankins and Bambi were very informative about everything and suggested a size proportionate to my body. 6 months after my surgery, though the size did fit my body, they didn't fit my mind. I was more comfortable with a smaller size, even if it was smaller than proportions. Dr. Hankins suggested I wait a year to make sure it was really what I wanted. 
After a year and some change I went back to visit Dr. Hankins and we talked about my comfort levels with my breast size and what would be the best option. He suggested a size to me, explained to me the difference from the first implants to the next, and just a little under 3 weeks ago I had my second procedure with Dr. Hankins. I was awake for this procedure and as soon as I sat up on the table, I knew I would love them. I got many compliments on my first set, people commented on their feel and how they looked; and I get twice as many compliments on my new pair. Now it's not just about how real they feel or how they drop or how natural they look, but also on how they fit me as a person and my active lifestyle. 
So happy I went with Dr. Hankins. I know girls will "shop around" and that is a great idea, get as much info as you can, but I will wholeheartedly recommend Dr. Hankins any day.

I'm sorry, are you calling your consumers liars or telling us we are blind to what we saw? There was a red head girl in black pants, a white shirt (not blouse) with the sleeves cut off and hemmed so yea, a professional wife beater shirt I guess and thin strap sandals.  Not professional business attire at all! The girl in the black dress had cute trendy platform shoes on, however the dress was too short to be business professional. She looked like she should be working at Francesca's. The girl with the gray dress on looked fine and was in business attire.  However, she was your hostess, not a sales person. I'm not saying that you're not capable of running a great store, but it all starts with first impressions.  Get your team to dress better. These brides are looking for their fairy tale to come true and be treated like a princess, not shopping for their summer attire at Tillys. It's a special day for brides from engagement to the end of their wedding day. Im glad you're a small business, that's why we visited your store. It just wasn't the best one we visited. However, you have potential. You have a great location, in a nice area.  Best of luck to you.

Full disclosure, owned by personal friends.  That said, I know how much thought went into this place and it shows.  The best cheese curds in town, which should put them high in the running for best cheese curds in the universe.  The Lazy Susans are a great sconnie take on meze.  Egg-topped buger was fantastic.  This was my first liquid old fashioned experience.  They are tasty and come in various permutatations, the table favorite was made with applejack.  Ho-maid ice cream an excellent finish, recomend the buttered beer nut.  Lactose intolerants, veg, maybe vegans can find something.
Awesome service!!  I have used them for both my businesses and for home use and they are reliable, prompt and very professional.

I made an appointment several days in advance to have Drain Com install some faucets and an appliance in my home. I called them on the day of my appointment to confirm the booking and they assured me there would be no issues. Long story short, the technician (Boris) waited until 20 minutes before his scheduled arrival time to tell me he would be late and unable to complete the job that day. The lack of notice was extremely frustrating and resulted in a lot of wasted time for me. When I called the head office to advise them that I had to cancel the appointment, and to tell them about the technician's screw up, the "office manager" told me this type of thing is to be expected in the industry. She was blatantly flippant about the situation and offered no apology whatsoever. I was SO disappointed with the attitude I got and the lack of customer service, especially given the reviews I had read online.

Mon Ami was recommended to me, and I am happy it was! 

Great location in the heart of the Las Vegas Strip. Love the decor and service is always great. Not to be outshined by the food. Each table is welcomed with a warm baguette. Me and my fiancé always order the goat cheese appetizer, the marinara and warm goat cheese are delicious together. 

I just love to sit outside and have a glass of wine and truly enjoy my day and whomever I'm at the restaurant with. 

This is a must for every trip to Las Vegas and is always on my list of restaurants I have to go to. 

Thank you Mon Ami!

***Update***


The owner, Jeff, contacted me almost immediately after I submitted my review and was extremely apologetic. He explained that he was investigating what had happened and was going to work with Old Republic and me to fix the situation. He had a team out by 10 and we now have a working water heater! The team was super nice and did great work. Jeff was great to work with and I can now see why his company gets good reviews. Thank you for the great communication and responsibility!



We were assigned this company by Old Republic Home Warranty because we had a water heater that wasn't working. They had a technician come out the following day. He took one look at the water heater and said it needed to be replaced. He followed that up by saying that he wouldn't be able to do it and it would take two people to remove it and another company would need to be assigned by Old Republic. He was literally in my house for less than five minutes and it was obvious from his demeanor that he didn't want to be there. When I followed up with Old Republic, they told me that he had reported that our water heater was 75 gallons (it was only 50) and used that as his justification for why he couldn't take the job.

I got the Chicken Shawarma Pineapple platter and it was great! I never seen any other shawarma places have grilled pineapple before, so I had to get it.  The chicken and pineapple were freshly grilled, and the garlic potatoes warm and soft yet crispy. The rice was good too, and the salad was all fresh.  The portion size was good for the price. The staff were very friendly as well.  I'll be coming back for sure!
